name: Sachsenplatz Dresden
description: The RV overnight stay is in a very central location on the Albert Bridge, just across the coastal road from the Elbe. In 5 minutes walking distance you`ll find the boat landing, the Terassenufer und the famous Elbe steam ships. Several playgrounds, restaurants, supermarkets, bank, post office and doctors nearby. Price: 10€

name: Radeberg RV Shop
description: All kinds of RV and Camping supplies, mechanic

name: Parking Area Cave
description: Parking area of the Cave with the possibility to stay over night

name: Frankenalb Camping
description: 12€ per camper

name: Campingplatz Rudolf Reidinger
description: Beautiful view from hill over fields.

name: Camping Am Schwimmbad
description: Busy site.

name: Ferienresort Kulkwitzer
description: Nice spot next to a lake. €21 w/ electric

name: Dresden Waldschlößchenbrücke
description: Free parking directly at the Waldschlößchenbrücke and on the Elbe. During the day traffic noise. In the evening very quiet and the view from the bridge of the Old Town is especially the sunset just terrific. Bicycle and bus / tram in the immediate vicinity. 3 km to the old town and 2,5 km to the famous newtown "Dresden Neustadt".

name: Havenhostel Bremerhaven
description: Hostel with attached campground. Perfect place after you picked up your truck at the port of Bremerhaven. If you sleep in your vehicle you park on a paved road. For tents there is a big grassy field. There is a power socket (long cord needed) and a tab with potable water. Clean toilets and great hot showers. As a camper you can use all the facilities of the hostel. Camping in the car is  EUR 15 per couple incl power, wifi, showers etc. There is a restaurant, breakfast buffet is EUR 7 per person. Walking distance to downtown (20min). Supermarket right across the street.

name: Camping Sonnendeck
description: Very nice campground at a little lake. Lots of permanent campers as usual but the setting is better than at other places. Grassy sites with power and water. Luxury facilities, hot showers and clean. Tent sites are right in front of the showers/toilets. Washing machines, cooking possibility and sinks for dish washing. Restaurant open for dinner (we didn't try). Good wifi (pay extra per hour). We paid EUR 5 p/P plus EUR 3.50 for the car (Land Rover size), power would be additional EUR 2.50.

name: Sora I Schöne Aussicht
description: Parking lot for the "Pumphut" hiking trail. Restaurant "Schöne Aussicht" (this means "stunning view")  nearby. The name is te value ;)

name: Freiburg
description: great central location parkplatz to visit the old city but only  suitable for self - sufficient camper vans with own facilities. Some of the spots have electric. There are plenty of shops, good restaurants and bars in the town within 10 mins walk.  €8 per night + €1 for internet.

name: Stellplatz Altenbrak
description: Car Parking for camper vans near the stream.

name: Stellplatz Schwindebecker Heide
description:
A very nice and quiet, unpaved place in the Luneburg Heath (Lüneburger Heide) area. During daytime, used by locals and tourists to take a walk in the beatiful heath and wood area surrounding this lot. Overnight parking is allowed and the community asks to pay 3,50 (low season)/5,00 (high season) Euro at the Amelinghausen Tourist office. phone +494132/930550 Anyhow, the place looks and feels almost like wild camping - very nice!

Fresh Water and tank dumps available at the sewage facility (Kläranlage) Oldendorfer Straße in Amelinghausen day and night.

name: Parking On Sachsenstrasse
description: Recommended by a local. Parking along a city park about 1.5 Kilometers from the heart of the old town. Free relatively flat. No amenities except recycling at the end of the street. We came off season and emptied tanks and filled water at the campground, Campingplatz München-Thalkirchen, located south west of town for free.

name: Camperarea Berlin
description: Camperarea in Berlin. Address: Weidmannsluster Damm. Walking distance to Underground which goes directly to the city center. Price (high season) €15 for a medium sized spot. Shower €4 a day (you must give driving licence a deposit for the key)

name: Fortress
description: Famous fortress used as a prison in WWII. Some parts can be visited free of charge

name: Camperarea Dresden
description: Camperarea and parking directly at the Elbe river opposite to the historic center, beautiful view. Walking distance to all attractions. Dixie toilet, dumping station. 15 EUR for 24 hours. Fast mobile internet.

name: Camperarea Timmendorfstrand
description: Camperarea Timmendorfstrand on the Island Poel. € 11 per night . No toilet available only shower €1 (get the key from the nearby shop)

name: Camperarea Vogelpark Walsrode
description: Camperarea at the back of the parking of "Vogelpark Walsrode" (a bird zoo). Camping is free of charge and toilets stay open 24 hours.

name: Camperspot Wertheim Bettingen
description: Good spot with clean showers. Internet at the entrace. You can camp next to the river. Price for camping 17 Euro per night for 2 people

name: Heidelberg, City am Neckar
description: For a Quick stop nice. Right next to the Neckar with a beautyful view to the castle. Close to the halfpipe.

name: on the Rhein river :-)
description: A place, for one night, right next to the rhine river.

name: Volkers Stellplatz
description: Nice caravan camp ground next to dyke. Very quiet and tidy. Restaurant 2 km away, mobile 3G internet. 40 km from Bremerhaven port.

name: Strotzbüscher Mühle
description:
Very nice campsite, romantic situated in the Ueßbach valley. The land on which you can camp belongs to the old Strotzbüscher Mühle, nowadays been used for touristic purposes. You can camp anywhere you like on the large field, with quite superb spots alongside the Ueßbach stream.

Large (or long) vehicles may encouter some problems - or even might get stuck - when trying to reach the valley on the small, curvy road.

name: Plon Stellplatz
description:
Lakeside Camper parking for self-contained vehicles.

Five Euro per night

Dump point and water available (1 Euro)

name: Alpirsbach Naturpur
description: Under 20 euro to dry camp in small streamside campground. You can dry camp or bring small caravan. We were here early May, not very crowded. Families and motorad campers. Small store and food available. Internet is good. Camping-alpirsbach.de.   Many thanks to the kind owners, the Rudolph family.

name: Bringhäuser Bucht- Camp Ground
description: Terraced, nice view over Edersee (lake). We did not stay there, but it looked well maintained and new.

name: Campingplatz Ederseeparadies
description: Huge camp ground around a farm at lake Edersee on grass. Lovely scenery, absolutely quiet at dead end road. Cramped area for permanent campers. Clean facilities, but ground around farmhouse carelessly maintained (old caravans etc. around). Good starting point for hiking and canoeing. 17,50 EUR w/o electricity for 2 persons pn/ 0,50 EUR for shower. 3G mobile internet. Basic restaurant and grocery store.

name: Röders Park
description: Great Campground with a little lake in the middle of the campground. In high season (summertime) often fully booked. About 70 km south of Hamburg.

name: Aussichtsturm Hohenmirsberg
description: wild campground with barriers. no problem for motorcycles. for vehicles, there is enough space near the tower.

name: DKV Camping
description: Beautiful camp ground of the German Canoe Club at lake Edersee, terraced on grass. Lovely scenery, absolutely quiet, access via forest road from Basdorf. Lots of permanent campers. Clean and very well maintained. Good starting point for hiking and canoeing. Restaurant and grocery store with friendly stuff. 20 EUR w/o electricity for 2 persons pn. Slow mobile internet.

name: Parking Lot Near Burschenschaftsdenkmal
description: Parking lot close to Burschenschaftsdenkmal  and 4-star hotel/ restaurant Berghotel. In the forest, very quiet after closing hour of restaurant. Beautiful view to Wartburg Castle. Starting point for several hiking tours (e. g. Hohe Sonne, Wartburg). mobile internet. Free.

name: Camping Regenbogen, Bad Liebenzell
description: quite campground near the city-center.

name: Altensteiner Schloss
description: Parking lot on the castle grounds, 200 m from main entrance. Very quiet, surrounded by big trees. The park is amazing! You can walk around several hours. Restaurant at park entrance. No facilities, toilets in park during day hours.

name: Ebertswiese
description: Parking lot at dead end road to Ebertswiese (Ebertswiese restaurant 1,3 km away).  Very quit, in the middle of the forest. Ideal starting point for hiking tours. No facilities.

name: Kohlenbachsgrund
description: Parking lot Kohlenbachsgrund, park your car in the forest 150 m away from road. Very quiet. Restaurant Kanzlersgrund 200 m away.  No facilities.

name: Campingpark Eisenach
description: After trying the suggested "parking lot near burschenscaftsdenkmal" which was closed for overnight parking I found this site not far away. Nice organized camping site near a small lake.

name: Waldcamping Meyersgrund
description: Camp ground in the forest, nice terrain  on gras, spots separated by hedges, quiet, lots of permanent campers. Chalets available. 19,50 EUR for 2 persons pn w/o electricity. Washing machine + dryer 5 EUR.

name: Parkplatz Ilmenau
description: Public Parking lot where overnight parking for mobile homes is allowed. Water and dumping station for gray water and toilet.

name: Public Parking Place Waldgasthaus Auerhahn
description: Public parking spot at forest edge. Reasonably quiet. Note: upper spot is for restaurant guests only!

name: Campingplatz "Rohrer Stirn"
description: Very clean and organized camping next to the community swimming pool

name: Parking Lots At Public Swimming Pool
description: Parking lots next to swimming pool at edge of forest, absolutely quiet in the off season. No facilities.

name: Wanderparadies
description: Beautiful caravan site in the middle of the forest, on gras, absolutely quiet. Chalets available. Lots of hiking trails. 14 EUR for 2 persons pn w electricity. Washing machine + dryer 5 EUR

name: Farbglasguette Lauscha
description: Production and sales of hand blown glass. Very interesting guided tour through the production plant. Amazing glass products including Christmas articles.

name: Camping Isarhorn
description: Nice natural campground with many trees directly beside the river isar. wide area with no typical permanent campers. good basecamp for trekking, mountainbiking, rafting... round about 3km to the city center of mittenwald.

name: Friedrichshöhe, parking lot in the forest
description:
Parking lot in the woods directly at the Rennsteig. Free. Starting point for nice hiking tours. Very quiet. Weak LTE reception. 
Even in winter a nice spot to park overnight. Winter-hiking-trails and cross-country-ski-tracks prepared.

name: Campingplatz Am Waldbad
description: Beautiful camp ground at forest edge, well maintained, absolutely quiet, end of valley. Perfect starting point for hiking tours through the biosphere reserve Vessertal. public swimming pool nearby. 6 EUR per car + 6 EUR pppn w/o electricity.

name: Herrenchiemsee
description: King Ludwig II last crazy palace on an island. 2 hours total time needed to ferry to the island, museum and tour. ferry, museum and tour total cost about  16€ from Prien.

name: big grass lot by the river
description: there's plenty of space and always a couple of rigs parked there

name: wild camp
description: nice quiet small place on the river. surrounded by farmland. nice sunset

name: Limes Parking
description: At the entrance to the limes trail. Quiet, even the main road is right next to it. level.

name: Am Löwentor
description:
Shady parking lot next to the historic Löwentor.
A good place to boondock in Koblenz. From here, you can take public transport (Line 12) to the city center and visit all the sights. Walking is possible too. 

Parking is free and quiet at night. If you need a shower, wifi, water, repairs, supplies or information about the area, ask around for Gorm and Eli (Am Spitzberg 5) - 50 meters away!

name: Konigswinter
description: Next to the Train and almost  under a Bridge but its a Nice place.  not to much noise of the Train or Bridge.

name: Across from hotel Oosterman.
description: 2 miles east from treis-karden. free. its not prohibited but Have never had a problem. good for fishing. acros the Street there is a restaurant called Oosterman.

name: Neipperg, Weingut Echle
description: Camper site at winemakers at the edge of a small village. Toilet and shower next to shop (we arrived at Sunday evening and got the key for the toilet/ shower from the owner's son). Prices: €6 camper, €2 electricity €2 shower. When you buy 12 bottles of wine, you don't have to pay for the night.

name: Grimaldi port entrance
description: Exit and enter port here

name: Sportbootanger Wittenberge
description:
Shower € 2 per person
at the Nedwighafen Restaurant (WC also there)
 Electricity 70cent / 1kwh
 Parking space 7 €
 Boat ramp available
Tent 5 €

name: Holsten Therme Stellplatz
description: Stellplatz across road from Therme complex. Nice surroundings, no traffic noise. Camping for SELF-CONTAINED VEHICLES ONLY. Power water and dump point available each for 1€. Showers and toilets available with entry to therme

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Andernach
description:
On the Rhine 👍 * Pitch 7 € * Electricity? * Water 100l / 1 € * Disposal Information: www.perspektive-andernach.de 


Am Rhein 👍
*Stellplatz 7€ 
*Strom ?
*Wasser 100l / 1€
*Entsorgung

Info:
www.perspektive-andernach.de

name: Burg Plesse
description: Big  parking lot in the woods, very quiet after opening hours of restaurant. Rather tilted, difficult to find an even spot. But we found a place 100m downhill, where we stood for the night. Mobile internet.

name: Schuetzenhaus Hermannsburg
description: Trailer park on grass in the woods next to the clubhouse of the local gun club. Dumping station nearby, see separate entry. Fast mobile internet. 2 EUR pn.

name: Waldschwimmbad Dumping Station
description: Dumping station, trailer park ca. 150 m away on opposite side of the road - see separate entry.

name: Adventure Playground / Abenteuerspielplatz
description: Parking lot in the forest, slow mobile internet. You can hear the traffic from afar, but during the night it is quiet. Barbecue area, waste bins.

name: Burial Mound Parking Lot
description: Next to an ancient burial mound there are  a few parking lots in the woods. Some 20 m away there are benches with nice views over the heath landscape. Depending on the wind direction you don't hear the Autobahn or you find it disturbing in this nice surrounding.

name: Vineyard parking lot
description: A small, paved parking lot (3 cars) in the middle of a vineyard. You have a beautiful view over the valley and it is level. There is also a similar place 200m further but not level. The streets to reach it are only for 5 ton cars maximum.

name: Mitsubishi Electric Halle
description:
Win very large public parking


win sehr grosser öffentlicher Parkplatz

name: Steinbeck Parking Lot
description: Parking lot at beach, on grass, shady trees, kiosk with fast food, cycle path; nice place, but no facilities. 10 EUR per calendar day and vehicle; i. e. 20 EUR per night!!! Key for toilet only available during business hours of kiosk (12-18).…

name: Trailer Park Poeler Forellenhof
description: Parking on concrete at water front/ small marina, grassy area with trees/ bench nearby. Tidy ablutions, washing machine, dryer ( each 2,60 EUR). Morning rolls available. Nice people. 13 EUR pn for 2 persons. Belongs to a smoke house where you can buy and eat excellent fish.

name: Danube Parking
description: Parking lot, free parking. Water fountain and Garbage cans. No Services. 20 m away you can overnight on the river's edge. fuel station 100m distance.

name: Trailer Park Sanddornstrand Wittenbeck
description: Nice, wide grassy area. You can park somewhere in the fields (w/o electricity)or under a poplar alley (with electricity). At the field edge we could watch roe deer. Absolutely quiet. Station of ancient "Molly" train nearby. Mobile internet. 12 EUR pn.

name: Regenbogen Camp Born
description: Wide campsite under big trees, on grass, very quiet. Kiosk, bakery. Mobile internet. Friendly stuff. 22 EUR pn w/o electricity. Prices higher during high season. From here you can explore the whole peninsula via bike.

name: Marktbreit Riverside Parking
description: Free parking on flat gravel surface. Next to playground and walking trails. Pizza resto next door.  Within walking distance to center of old town. Paid campground next door with water (10 cents for 10l) and toilet dump.

name: Campingplatz Romantiek
description: Camping near the nice city Landsberg am Lech. We paid 17 eur. Shower cost 50 ct for 5 min. We had a quiet place at the bottom next to the playground and fireplace. Gate is closed between 13.00-15.00. Snitzelhaus on campsite 8,50 each incl french fried.

name: Camping Romantic
description: Ther are two campsites just outside a small village with historische altstad. We choose thisone because of teh name. We paid 20,20 eur for a car with rooftoptent and two people. Free wifi and restaurant on site or closeby. Quiet place not very busy when we where here. Separate place for campers and tents.

name: Rhein near Karlsruhe
description:
September 21st, 2016 by patric-otto Iconpopout
No offiziell Camp Place but for a stop in the Road perfect 

But take care about the water, when it rains verry much it can be under water

name: Naturcamping Alt Reedevitz
description: Nice campsite on grass, partly park-like with big trees. Best (flat) places in the upper area of the property. Good starting point for cycling tours. Absolutely quiet. Mobile internet. 25 EUR pn for 1 car+ 2 persons. Very friendly host. Ask him for restaurants and cycling tours.

name: Bullensee Rothenburg
description:
Bathing lake with large parking 
Good for all night

name: Ochtumsperrwerk
description: Parkingground AT the Ochtumsperrwerk with a view over the Weser

name: Wachsenburg
description: Very quiet parking lot close to Wachsenburg castle. Mobile internet, to restaurant "Veste Wachsenburg" appr. 700 m walk.

name: Double rainbow palace
description: campground for min. four vanagons, with entrance to a lake.

name: Offroadpark Langenaltheim
description: It's the campside from the offroadpark

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz
description:
5 simple flat pitches with fine chips. Restaurant Hellas (Greek cuisine) directly opposite, very recommendable, with animal park and bathing establishment next door. Power 8h / 1 € and fresh water


5 einfache ebene Stellplätze mit feinem Splitt.
Restaurant Hellas (griechische Küche) gleich gegenüber,sehr zu empfehlen ,mit Tierpark und Badeanstalt  nebenan.
Strom 8h/1€
und frisch Wasser

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz Kleinensiel
description:
Motorhome parking space Kleinensiel Parking at the football field near the Weser and Weser beach


Wohnmobil Stellplatz Kleinensiel Parkplatz am Fußballplatz nahe der Weser und Weser Strand

name: Monscheuer
description:
Truck Servic 

 Friedrich-Engels-Str.25 | 51545 Waldbröl

http://monscheuer-nfz.de/

name: Hoffmann
description:
Likvid Gas
Bernd Hoffmann 
Nümbrechter Str. 20, 51545 Waldbröl

name: Öjendorfer Park
description: nice parking area, quiet at night, good for a night

name: Hohnsensee
description: Official RV-Park of Hildesheim. Very nice place at a lake and about 15 minutes from the center. No amenities, but free for 2 nights. A good Restaurant is nearby. But it's not cheap.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Wismar
description:
10€ /24h - Nahe der Altstadt, sehr ruhig. Netter Platzbetreiber. 
200 m away from down town. Quite  place.

name: Marktplatz
description:
Market square with 2 fountain squares with 2 gilded towers city church


Marktplatz mit 2 Brunnen
Rathaus mit 2 vergoldeten Tuermen
Stadtkirche

name: Spitzingsee
description: Quiet place near the lake. 200m till cable car for skiing. 8 min to the village of Spitzingsee. Restaurant 5 min.

name: Campingplaz Frielendorf
description: Nice smal campground, brand new sanitary blok! Verry friendly owner!

name: Naturtheater Renningen
description:
Parking Lot of an open-air theater in a little forest.
You have to cross the Restaurant at the border of the forest. After a few hundred meter there is a clearing with a parking lot of the open-air theater nearby. Actually it's only allowed to park there when the theater is in operation, also it is a nature protection area...

name: Camping-Wohnmobilstellplatz Lenggries-Fall/Sylvensteinsee
description:
Http://www.lenggries.de/sommer/camping-wohnmobilstellplatz-lenggries-fallsylvensteinsee

Lenggries offers for mobile tourists a quiet night parking space in the district Fall am Sylvensteinsee. The Sylvenstein reservoir is a wonderful area for water sports enthusiasts and hikers. Facilities and advice: Forest parking without parceling and without lighting Sani station for fresh water and sewage (machines per 2 euros per filling or disposal) Public toilets No electricity connection Park charge: 4 euros per day  Next shopping possibility 10 km in the direction of Lenggries Restaurant: Hotel Jäger by Fallkein Contact person on site, no information about occupancy situation Suitable for short stays Sommer und Winter 

http://www.lenggries.de/sommer/camping-wohnmobilstellplatz-lenggries-fallsylvensteinsee

Lenggries bietet für mobile Urlauber einen ruhigen Nachtparkplatz im Ortsteil Fall am Sylvensteinsee. Der Sylvenstein-Stausee ist ein herrliches Revier für Wassersportler und Wanderer.

Ausstattung und Hinweise:

    Waldparkplatz ohne Parzellierung und ohne Beleuchtung
    Sani-Station für Frisch- und Abwasser (Automaten je 2 Euro pro Füllung bzw. Entsorgung)
    Öffentliche Toilettenanlage
    Kein Stromanschluß
    Parkgebühr: 4 Euro pro Tag
    nächste Einkaufsmöglichkeit 10 km in Richtung Lenggries
    Restaurant: Hotel Jäger von Fall
    kein Ansprechpartner vor Ort, keine Auskünfte über Belegtsituation
    Geeignet für Kurzaufenthalte
    Sommer und Winter

name: Wanderparkplatz am Wasserwerk
description: Parking lot in the woods, next to the "Wasserwerk" / water works of Bodenmais. 200 m down the road at the big parking lot there is a well with drinking water. Absolutely quiet. A little bit difficult to find a level place. Slow mobile Internet.

name: Well Bodenmais
description: Drinking water

name: Parkplatz Eck
description: Parking spot next to ski slope and starting point of loipe. In summer it is a starting point for hiking tours. It is not very charming to stay there overnivght, but in winter, when it grows dark early, it is okay for one night. 2 EUR/ day.

name: Parkplatz Regenbrücke
description: Parking at bottom of retaining wall and information point of national park. Parking only for passenger cars and busses! But in the evening we were alone and nobody took care.

name: Am Tanger
description:
schöner Stellplatz.
beautyful place 
24h: 12€
48h:24€

name: Wohnmobilhafen-Hamburg
description: Level gravel parking site in the city with good shower and toilet facilities and power at most sites. A gate is closed to the site later in the night but a security person will open it. Office is open at 08:00. Cost per site €19. Located under an elevated train track and beside a city road but surprisingly, not overly noisy. Many good lunch places nearby and a big supermarket fifteen minutes' walk. Train station nearby. Located on the corner of Süderstr. and Hammerbrookstras. Wifi at nearby cafes and McDonalds.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Iphofen
description: Free parking lot for RVs. For 1€ you can get electricity for 12 hours or 70 l water. Dump station is free. Very clean Toilets for free. Very near to the Town center.

name: Knopftours
description:
hello ,this place has rooms to rent or space to set up a tent or traveller room 
also has a little workshop or space to be with your Camper .This is manly a Motorcycle place where people from around the world come and stay .stefan also sells Green card Insurance for Europe if you come from outside of Europe us well healtsinsurance and all you need

name: Schiffshebewerk Rothensee
description: Flat, paved parkinglot next to the boatlift/lock. Nothing special, but quiet all day and at night. Close to the Autobahn for a stopover.

name: Unter den Linden
description:
Beautiful place very nice pitch night 7 € energy 3.50 € tourist tax per person 1.50 €

 beautyfol place
sehr schöner Stellplatz
night 7€
Energie 3.50€
Kurtaxe pro Person 1.50€

name: am Singliser See
description:
Pitch with designated RV sites
9h to 18h 3 €

name: Camping blauwe adria
description: An Cheap overnight camping option in Altrip (near Mannheim) and near Darnstad Hotel for Free WiFi (fast). There is also a Penny's supermarket in 2 km. Also Cheap Aral petrolstation for Cheap benzine 95. You van stay here for 7,80 euro and the showers are with coins you pay 1,50 euro

name: IKEA Parking
description: I asked the store manager and got the permission to spend a quite night in front of IKEA. They close the gate overnight but will open them at 5 p.m.  for the IKEA trucks. The restaurant is open until 1930 and the store close at 2000.

name: Stellplatz Brückenkopf Jülich
description: Campsite for Motorhomes with limited facilities, but chemical toilet dump, fresh water and paid showers near to a nice paek and in walking distance to the city of uelich

name: Ruin Roman Estate
description: Parking in the fields at the ruins of a roman estate. Beautiful landscape. Picnic table and benches. Very quiet at night. Mobile internet.

name: Limes Kastell
description: Parkingarea between the Kastell and a smal lake (River Jagst)

name: Waldparkplatz am Silberbachtal
description:
Quiet place for a night or for hiking on the Velmerstot 

Ruhiger Platz für eine Nacht oder zum wandern auf den Velmerstot

name: Waldparkplatz am Steinheimer Holz
description: Nice place for a night

name: Speicherkoog Meldorfer Bucht
description: Realy nice place to stay overnight, directly beneath the North Sea and an artificial lake called Speicherkoog for windsurfing. There is also a surf school for surfboard hiring. The smal restaurant, the toilets and the showers are open until 5pm. On weekend there are a lot of people for windsurfing. The price for overnight staying is 8 euros for caravans, campers and busses. For cars it's just 3 euros.

name: SurfCenter Wustrow
description:
8euros for van, 3euro per extra passenger...
Hot and cold water, toilets, shower, super close to beatutiful beach.
Cheapest & friendliest option around

name: camp rubi
description: very clean campsite for campervans and mobilhomes mostly. well organised!

name: Neubrandenburg
description: quiet parking on the night, lot of people on the day. near a great lake where you can swim or learn waterski ! 2km of the center

name: Oldendorf
description: quiet parking by night. 5 minutes to the port for the ferry to sweden

name: Skihügel Wanderparkplatz
description: plain parking spot for hikers. some small garden houses around. quiet at end of small road.

name: Parking lot Hubersee
description: Parking lot next to little lake and restaurant. Ask the friendly restaurant owner for permission. Very quiet. Use of restrooms during the day.

name: Camping Siesta
description: Camping site

name: Abenteuer Allrad
description: This is the biggest 4x4 exhibition in the world with over 200 exhibitors. You find everything from camping tools and small roof tents to €500k 2-floor fully equipped trucks. It takes place every year in June during 4 days. Perhaps even more interesting than the show is the campground with over 3000 visitor vehicles. Any overland vehicle you can think of can be found here and all proud owners are happy to show you around. Camping is €15 per night, hot showers are €2. No electricity, no WiFi,  OK for big rigs and pets. Small restaurant.

name: park with a lake
description: good spot to one night close to a nice lake. We don't know if it is alowed but it was quiet at night. is possible to swim and there is a big field to great picnic.

name: Parking at Bathing lake Sarchinger Weiher
description: Several parking lots around a beautiful bathing lake. On gravel or grass, trees around.  Restrooms were open during summer/ day. Quiet. Mobile internet.

name: Caravan parking Donaustauf
description: Separated area for campers at edge of big parking lot. Traffic noise. Trees around. Restaurants and beer gardens near by. Free. Mobile internet. Walking distance to Walhalla. On that way we found the very nice restaurant "Historisches Armenspital" (900 m away).

name: Übernachtungsplatz für Wohnmobil
description: Behind Hornbach quiet at the Edge of the backstreet

name: Overnight Spot in the Woods
description:
Nixe quiet Spot for Update to 10 RVs
Used to be a soccerfield
Sandy Grass Surface

name: Stromberg camping
description: Nice campground with pitches for tents, caravan or mobilhome. Great swimming pool and nice walks available in the surrounding countryside. Very clean facilities

name: Kurhessen Therme
description: Car park onsite of the Kurhessen Therme Kassel. allowed to spend one night in the carpark after spending time in the spa. nice quiet spot next to the Castle and Hercules.

name: Rednecks Bay
description: Some side arm of the articial lake Hohenwarte. Busy in the day time in summer months, people are slipping boats into the water or take a swim. it's quite in the evening hours.

name: Campingplatz Eisenbachtal
description: For us this was just a stop when going home. We searched for a campsite near the highway and didn't expect anything. Wow, what a pleasant surprise it was visiting this campsite! The campsite is just a normal (but good) campsite, but the landscape and the extremely friendly owner and his passion for nature (and Africa) makes it so good! It is just the perfect stopover, but is certainly a good place to stay longer. Worth it!

name: Parking lot of the “Wildpark“
description:
Lower end of the Wildpark parking. Very quiet at night and nobody around. There are multiple options to camp on level grassy spots. 
Gets busy at weekends from 10am. 
free.

name: Seecamping Kelbra Stausee
description:
Two options to stay: campsite proper or RV park outside the barrier for overnighters. Outside stay costs half of campsite but no power.
Pleasant site, with power and water allover the campsite.

name: Jahnwiese Hildesheim
description: This is a place around Hildesheim, if you prefer nature camping. It's a big field right in the forest, which is beautiful for walks and mountain biking. You also have great views over the Börde. Just 5 to 10 min from the Autobahn, worth stopping by even just for a picnic.

name: Gral Müritz Seebrücke
description: It is a quiet place at a parking area with fresh water and a sanitary dump station.

name: Beside road
description:
Just beside road outside Ludwigstadt. 
No traffic during weekend. Nice view.

name: Hotel zum Friedl
description:
3 parking lots for camper vans next to hotel garage, very quiet. Mobile internet, free WIFI for hotel guests only. 5 EUR resp. 2,50 EUR, if you have dinner in the restaurant. Extra charge for electricity and water. 
There is no legal option for parking in the national park during the night!

name: Waldhäuser Aussicht
description: Parking lot above the village Waldhäuser with wide view (=Aussicht) over the mountains. Very quiet. One of the few parking lots in the area where there are no prohibitive signs for the night. Absolutely quiet. Starting point for hiking tours to the Lusen. Mobile internet. Free.

name: Wanderparkplatz Habichtswald
description: carpark in forest, level site, no service

name: Parkplatz Heiligenberg
description: Nice and quiet place for one or two nights. 5 Euro per car per night. Schwimmbad nearby.

name: Wanderparkplatz "Auf dem Hardt"
description: Small parking lot near the forest and the Wutachschlucht, free.

name: Teen Group Camping Side
description:
A Camping side originally intended for groups, but if you ask nicely and if its not full you can stay there for small money 5-10€.
Just ask the nice man who lives in the cabin next to the entrance road.
The Camp Ground is between the river and the street/railtracks. So it can get a little noisy. On sunny days tourist groups will paddle on the Danube.

name: Schareben
description: Wonderful location in the woods, next to restaurant Berghütte Schareben. Access road narrow and steep. Access with own car only in summer. A little bit difficult to find a level spot and a mobile network! Absolutely quiet.

name: Wanderparkplatz Stadt Roding
description: Small parking spot in the woods. Very quiet. From the gravelled parking lot you have to drive 80 m into the wood. There you will find the sign "Wanderparkplatz" next to a bench. Good for one night when you travel through. Fast mobile internet.

name: Wanderparkplatz Sattel Lambach
description: Parking spot in the woods. Access steep, 4x4 recommended, accessible only in summer. Starting point of hiking tours. Mobile internet extremely slow. Difficult to find a level spot.

name: campingplatz Jarplund
description: great place. there's a good minimarket next to the office

name: At Nordostseekanal
description: Small place for 1 car. Directly to the water. nice to watch ships passing.  Very quiet! (Across the street is a campervan park.)

name: Horsten
description:
Directly situated next to the Nord-Ostsee Canal where large sea vessels pass by. 
€10,- per site.
Dump station and electricity require extra payment.
About 50 sites available.

name: Vater Rhein
description: Next to Vater Rhein campstop there is  a Restaurant. Max 24 hours.

name: Vilshofen an der Donau
description:
parking area next to the Donau river. camping allowed.
was a little noisy in summer as the youngsters were trying out their cars and bikes , but was ok during the night. 
it is next to the road so there is some traffic noise.

name: Schossaritz am Buchenwald
description: Nice place just behind the village. Nice view above the Trubachtal.

name: Baggerloch Obersuhl
description:
This little lake is highly frequented in summer time.
Beside the main tarmac road there is a little path for vehicles with more clearance. At the end of the path, there is a nice place for a small campervan directly to the lake.

name: Forest parking lot
description: Just Small "parking lot" just aside the road. Not Nice but will do the job

name: Vierzehnheiligen Guest House
description:
Guest house of the Vierzehnheiligen monestary complex. 140 beds, 20.50 € incl a nice breakfast in single room with shared bathroom. Well kept and clean. Reception closes 18:30.  Check their homepage or call +4995719260

Brewery with beer garden behind the church.  Food until 19:00, beer until 20:00.   Restaurant in from of church closes 18:00. All reasonable Franconian prices.

name: Covered Rest Place
description: Covered rest place next to the river with table and bench. Good to stay for the night if biking.

name: Weitnau
description: Camping plot for one night near Weitnau, no fees, but also no ammenities.

name: Entrance to Hellersiedlung
description:
This is an informal parking space for people who have their garden in the big garden-colony "Hellersiedlung". Be modest!
Near there are two hills (one with and one without trees) to watch whole Dresden from above. At good wheather conditions you can see the mountains of Saxon Switzerland or even the first mountains of Czech Republik. Also hiking trails pass by. If you go around the hill (with trees) you pass the former military airfield of the Russian Army which is a re-naturalised nice meadow now. Also the gardens of Hellersiedlung werea military airfield before 1945. Near there is also the forest "Junge Heide" and the huge Dresden forest "Heide". Also near is Dresden's nightlife neighbourhood Neustadt and Industriegelände.
Another possibility is the other entrance to Hellersiedlung on Magazinstraße (51.092302, 13.765152), but it's noisier because of the Königsbrücker Straße near there. Or you find another place in the quiet public street Magazinstraße by going more towards south.

name: Entrance to Hellersiedlung
description:
This is an informal parking space for people who have their garden in the big garden-colony "Hellersiedlung". Be modest!
Near there are two hills (one with and one without trees) to watch whole Dresden from above. At good wheather conditions you can see the mountains of Saxon Switzerland or even the first mountains of Czech Republik. Also hiking trails pass by. If you go around the hill (with trees) you pass the former military airfield of the Russian Army which is a re-naturalised nice meadow now. Also the gardens of Hellersiedlung were a military airfield before 1945. Near there is also the forest "Junge Heide" and the huge Dresden forest "Heide". Also near is Dresden's nightlife neighbourhood Neustadt and Industriegelände.
Another possibility is the public street Magazinstraße near there (51.092302, 13.765152), it's the other entrance to Hellersiedlung, but noisier. Maybe you find a more quiet place down the street.

name: Campingplatz München-Thalkirchen
description: Huge campground by the river. Reservation is not possible. €4/day for the internet, €2.10/warm water shower. We paid €29.50 for two adults, one kid,one tent and one car. There is a restaurant on site.

name: Magazinstraße
description:
This is an informal parking space for people who have their garden in the big garden-colony "Hellersiedlung". Be modest! 
A petrol station is close by, maybe there is a toilet.
Hiking trails pass by. If you go around the garden colony you pass the former military airfield of the Russian Army which is a re-naturalised nice meadow now. The gardens of Hellersiedlung were a military airfield before 1945. Near there is also the forest "Junge Heide" and the huge Dresden forest "Heide". 
Dresden's nightlife neighbourhood Neustadt and Industriegelände is also near. The Trams 8 and 7 stop there and go directly into Neustadt and into the city center.
It's noisy because huge Königsbrücker Str. is near. Another possibility is to go the Magazinstraße toward south, it's more quiet there.

name: River wild camping
description:
Large level area by the river. 
Quiet. largely used by motor homes.

name: Diesbar-Seußlitz, Radewitzer Str.
description:
It's a parking space for strollers equipped with table and bench and situated next to a huge fortress from the Bronze Age (now a vineyard, an educational trail explains that). The view over the river Elbe is exceptional.
Down the hill there are some restaurants, it's quite a touristy area but the landscape is very beautiful.

name: Berli, Treptower Park
description:
Parking space for free. 
For old diesel-cars this is the last parking space before the forbidden area: the "Hundekopf", which is the wider city centre of Berlin marked by the circular line of the S-Bahn (Underground).
Nearby is the S-Bahn-station "Treptower Park" for going deeper into te city. The river Spree is near. Some Trees and Bushes provide shadow. Somewhere in the park (closer to the S-Bahn-station) there is a public toilet.
Across the (noisy) street there is the "Treptower Ehrenmal", which is a huge memorial built by the Red Army in 1945 in honour to their massive losses while fighting fascism.

name: East-Berlin, Treptower Park
description:
Parking space for free. 
For old diesel-cars this is the last parking space before the forbidden area: the "Hundekopf", which is the wider city centre of Berlin marked by the circular line of the S-Bahn (Underground).
Nearby is the S-Bahn-station "Treptower Park" for going deeper into te city. The river Spree is near. Some Trees and Bushes provide shadow. Somewhere in the park (closer to the S-Bahn-station) there is a public toilet.
Across the (noisy) street there is the "Treptower Ehrenmal", which is a huge memorial built by the Red Army in 1945 in honour to their massive losses while fighting fascism.

name: Parking lot @ Olympic Rowing Facility
description: Huge parking lot with lots of trees next to the olympic rowing facility. a beautiful lake can be reached by walking a few minutes. Toilets may be used at Munich Beach Club at the end of the rowing facility (on a cool summers day this place was deserted but not locked - they also have a fast food hut there which was closed when we were there. we did not try the toilets, so can't say what they are). We arrived in the afternoon & stayed till the next morning. very quiet. only a few joggers etc. Probably not a good idea to come here when they have a rowing event and the place is packed.

name: Rügland
description: One is standing near a playground on gravel

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Amberg
description: Caravan site with about 15 places, no trailers only camping cars. No fees for overnight, possibility for fresh water and electricity (payment)

name: Hamburg Fischmarkt
description: Parking ground also for RVs and iover Night. nö Gas. No toilet.

name: Hamburg StrandPauli
description: Parking lot near the River Elbe. at the Harbour.

name: The Walnuttree
description:
We are Overlander like u r. And currently on home holidays and sharing our big rick friendly parking lot, happy to give you power and water! Running water toilet and a big walnut tree with Hängematte :-)
Close to the area is so called gods garden! You can go for a hike to the Staffelberg or relax at the thermal public bath.
Please email at wir@swots.de before you arrive.

name: Innenstadtparking Görlitz
description: Big parking lot close to downtown Görlitz, staying overnight officially allowed. Very quiet during the night. No facilities. We paid for 12 h parking (1 night + next morning) 4.10 Euro.

name: Schaidt
description: Free spot provided by the village of Schaidt. Intended for campervans, but you could easily stay here with rooftoptent too. There is a tap for fresh water(1€/100liter). It is next to a sporting ground and extremely quiet at night . Next to a forest. 500m to the town. Not the most idyllic, but functional for a night.

name: Camper van parking near Herrgottsruh church
description: Camper van parking for a few vehicles for free. There is a sign providing details of where to go for waste disposal, gas bottles etc.

name: Holnis peninsula
description: Nice parking spot on a small hill with great view of the sea. Also a good starting point for short nature hikes. Occasional vehicles passing by (dead end) until approximately midnight.

name: Einsiedel WoMo overnight
description:
official overnight park ground

gravel and slightly flat near lake Walchensee near the road

no supply

Comment: sorry, no big rigs possible!

name: Gästehaus SchilcherAlm
description:
very friendly couple with typical Bavarian food and there's a hut with an indoor grill ... usually on Saturday ;)

booked out most of time of the year ... but you should try if you are around

name: Frickenhausen Weinberge
description:
Wild space for motorhomes, VW buses or cars with roof tents. No all-wheel drive necessary. Great view on the Maintal. Best to come late and break down early
------
Wilder Stellplatz für Wohnmobile, VW Busse oder Autos mit Dachzelt. Kein Allrad erforderlich. Toller Blick aufs Maintal. Am besten spät kommen und früh abbauen

name: Heeke Hadern Bootsanlegerparkplatz
description: Parking lot in the fields next to a little creek, big tree. Very quiet with the exception of the rapids. Mobile internet.

name: Stockstadt am Main
description: Place 10 m near the river Main. Absolute quite!

name: Trailhead parking Margarethenhöhe Siebengebirge
description:
Trailhead parking Margarethenhöhe. Siebengebirge. Parking area 200 m from the street in the forrest. 
 Nice daytrip to the Drachenfelsen and Ölberg and than back to the camper (ca. 15km).
Quiet in the night. Restaurant nearby.
We paid 3€ p/d the night untill 8 o clock included.
Realy nice day in autumn.

name: RV/Camper Parking Lot
description:
Medium Size parking Lot, just aside the Street. Located in a beautyful Valley with a Small Town near by. 
Forest trail also near by

name: Wild Camp on the river
description: Beach next to the river. Departure point for canoeing tours. Legal campsite close by in the lake is only a couple of Euros.

name: Zur freundlichen Einkehr
description:
Schöner Platz für vier Wohnmobile an einem Gasthaus, in dem man essen muss. Dafür kosten die Plätze nichts. Dusche für 2 Euro.
---
Nice place for four campers at an inn, where you have to eat. The seats cost nothing. Shower for 2 euros.

name: Parking Lot at Sports Center
description: Big parking Lot with a lot of space. some trees. Overnight camping is allowed.

name: Parkplatz Aull an der Lahn
description:
Nice parking place directly at the lahn-riverbank.
Perfect view on the castle and a bit hidden in the trees.

name: Parking Döbeleplatz
description:
directly next to the Bus Station are several lots for campers. Parking time has to be purchased from the Machine.
Campsite is directly in the city center close to the Swiss Border. many Restaurants and shopping facilities are close bye

name: Stellplatz am Katzenteich
description: Overnight parking lot for campervans. you pay €5.- to enter. €0,50 to use toilet, €1.-/kw electricity. drinking water available for a little extra cost as well. walking distance to town center and castle

name: Camp am Yachthafen
description: Camp for Motor Campers only. Not realy a campground but looks like. Nice Place to stay a few days.

name: thurnau
description: Parking on gravel. Near center. with disposal

name: Gleitschirmflieger Startplatz
description:
Wild Campsite with wonderfull view over the Valley. Natural Source just 5 Minutes away.
Drop Off for paraglider.

name: Camping on a private property
description: Just a small area for camping. Any Traveller is welcome, but please contact owner in advance: kofferleben@digital-dictators.de

name: Autobahn Rastplatz
description:
The last rest area before the Danish border, a lot of 
people camp here to be an early bird at the border. Not a very nice place but will do the job.

name: velmerstod, eggeturm
description: Place for tents and at on of the two velmerstot is a fireplace. open shelter close to the tower.  stay of sight and there won't be any problems. nice view

name: Elbe Parking
description: Parking space directly at the river. nice for overnight parkers. maybe also a tent.

name: Next to schoko Fabrik
description: Between schoko Fabrik and the railway tracks. Surprisingly quiet during the night. Definitely no one cares in this dead end road about overlanders

name: View point
description: Close to the street but still remote. Bike Trail Passes. Between fields with a little bench.

name: Waldparkplatz Freibad gaustadt
description: At the road end in the forest. Quiet and good enough to stay overnight. Nothing special but good for parking the van, going/cycling downhill to Bamberg, see the city, have some beer and sleep up here. Nobody cares about overlanders

name: Königstein Camping
description: Full camp site along the Elbe river, in the heart of the Elbsandsteingebirge.Very nice place, Very quite and beautiful.

name: Camping am Treidlerweg
description: Beautiful camping place along the Elbe river! Top spot!

name: Picnic spot at the Rhine river
description: Nice picnic spot on grass directly at the Rhine river. Parking on tar beside the road “in der Rheinaue”. Quiet. Mobile internet. Free. Popular with dog owners.

name: Waldparkplatz Auerbach near Tatzelwurm waterfalls
description: Spacious forest parkinglot along the small river Auerbach and close to the nice Tatzelwurm waterfalls along the Deutsche Alpenstraße. I was totally alone at night and in the morning only some hikers and cyclers parked or passed by.

name: Auf dem Schweinsberg
description: Beautiful picnic place in the neighbourhood of castle and chapel. Close to the road but not much traffic at night

name: Hotel Wiesengrund
description: Nice hardstanding suitable for campers, vans, 4x4 etc. Good toilets and the town of Bad Hindelang close by.

name: Dahlemer Binz
description: A parking lot next by a small Airport for free.

name: Camping am Waldschwimmbad
description: A nice camping place near Altensteig. His is a good place to camp if you plan on experiencing the north part of the Black Forest

name: Stellplatz Moselherz
description: Stellplatz Moselherz behind small port next to the Mosel River. Between Mehring and Pöllich. Toilet, Shower, Water. Nice spots, facilities simple. Cost: 7 € for 2.

name: Stellplatz Hausdülmen
description: Quiet spot next to a playground and the forest. Restaurant nearby. No facilities, no costs.

name: Campingplatz Weiherhof
description: A nice camping near lake Titisee. From here you can easily reach Feldberg, the highest peak in Schwarzwald.

name: Overnight stay among meadows
description: A calm place on a meadow, fare away from the next village, only 10 minutes from the highway A73. Leave the small tar road and take a two spoor gravel track for 200 m. There is a streamlet nearby. The place is nearly not visible from the the tar road. Good enough for a simple overnight stay.

name: Museumsdorf
description: Nice free lots amidst a park for free nearby the Museumsdorf. RV only!

name: Parking area Sackpfeife
description:
Parking area Sackpfeife
This is a big parking in the middle of the forest next to a nice Summer slide.  We paid nothing for the night and were alone.

name: Reisemobilstellplatz Turnhagen
description: This is a nice place for Motorhomes only. The Place is free, and for a fee you can get power and water.

name: Parking lot with a view
description: Parking lot right next to the sea. Perfect view. Small beach whete you can take a dip. Quiet at night. No facilities, no costs.

name: Wanderparkplatz Ennest
description: Trailhead parking. Pretty close to the street, but thankfully with only little traffic, although it will pick up at 6 am during the week.

name: Bitterfeld Lake View Parking Lot
description: Huge parking lot at the lake. There is a barrier, but for 2 € you can just enter (24h).

name: Parkplatz Hennesee Immenhausen
description: Roadside parking with a tiny trail leading down to the water.

name: Wilkenberg, Naturpark Ebbegebirge
description: Trailhead parking. There’s a parking lot right next to the street, but follow the road for 100m until you arrive at a group of trees with tables/ benches underneath for a better view.

name: Kutmühle Bakery Handmade bread
description:
best price quality  offer. cheap stuff for the half price from the day before.

Handmade and healthy.

name: Forest hideout
description: Woodland forest hidden away from the main road. Quiet, birdsong. Firewood readily available for safe fire makers. Sheltered from wind. We have a Land Rover with roof tent. Shops within 5 minutes.

name: Barn between Egling and Dettenhausen
description: On a meadow behind a barn. Quiet and far from traffic noise.

name: Mamming Bridge
description: Mamming, bridge over the river Isar. Big parking lot near the river.

name: Parking 1
description: Parking lot. Campervans allowed. dumping waste possible

name: camping Quendorfer See
description:
Nice campground next to a lake where you are able to swim. good for tents and campers. It is in the ADAC camp bible. You can find the complete pricelist here:
https://camping-schuettorf.de/index.php?language=de&category=030001

name: Kuralpe
description: Designated parking lot right next to restaurant and hotel "Kuralpe"

name: Knaus Campingpark
description: Big and quiet Campground directly at the river Ruhr. Also not far away from Town. May be 10 minutes walk. Flat an grassy. Toilet and Showers completly new renovated and in TOP condition. Payed 26 euro for 1 night with camper, electricity and 1 Person.

name: Nice place out of town
description: Gravel parking lot out of Herda. Place enough for big rigs. Very quiet at night.

name: Reisemobilhafen Twistesee
description: Established caravan campground. One the prettier ones.

name: OBI store
description: Refilled butane bottle here, large hardware and garden store

name: Campingplatz am Hainer See
description: Recently built campsite, right by the lake with modern showers and bathrooms and power on most sites. Very quiet and relaxing.

name: Caravan erleben
description: Very nice and friendly people! They have a huge camping shop with a lot of camping stuff, and they have a great mechanic who fix every problem!

name: Unimog Museum
description: Nice Museum for Unimog, with good Restaurant.

name: Campingplaz Fuldaschleife
description: very nice and neat and clean, Euro 25.- for Camper and 2 persons, much recommended

name: Offroad Manufactur
description:
Overall mechanic repairs store. Mainly LR. Speak to Florian. He is the owner. Has a good eye on small detailed things 
THIS IS A NEW LOCATION, COORDINATES OK! 
Lademannbogen 9, 22339 Hamburg, Deutschland

name: Reisemobilhafen Eiswiese
description:
Very nice Parkingspot near indoor swimmingpool. Toilet on parkinglot. Showers in pool aera.
9€ 24 hours parking, shower 1.5€ pP

name: Free parking at the Rhine river
description:
Free parking spot next to the Rhine river. 
Good spot for night.
There were no people beside us.
Pretty quiet at night.
--
Kostenloser Parkplatz neben dem Rhein Ufer.
Gut für eine nacht.
Wir waren die einzigen Camper.
Nachts relativ ruhig.

name: Sowiet Memorial
description: This place is next to a loud road in one side and the quiet park to the other. Restroom available. Countless campers are parked here.

name: Corn field
description:
Next to an old wood storage and a bench
Opimun place to set up a hammock and relax after canoeing or climbing

name: Naturcamping Oberuckersee
description: Beautiful campground under large trees right at the lake. Open during the season until October. Reservation is recommended during school holidays.

name: Campingpark Treviris
description: Campsite along the river about 2.5 km walking from Trier center via a footpath next to the river. The campground is situated in an uninspiring neighbourhood  and near major streets and a railway, which makes it rather noisy. The individual grass pitches are small. However, the ablutions are excellent, with kitchen, lockers for phone charging, washing machines, dryers and a sanitation dump station. Fresh bread can be ordered. Very small camping shop. The nearest shop is over 1.5 km away. The fee is € 20 (2 adults, camper). Showers and electricity are charged separately.

name: Pullman Camping
description: Campsite just across the road of pullman western city. campground, toilets and showers are ok. Quiet in the night. Wifi cost extra money 2 euro for 3 days.and does not work with samsung phones. very strange. restaurants across the street inside the western city.

name: Caravan Park Hauenstein
description: Caravan parking next to the shoe museum. Free. Bad mobile internet. Restaurants in town. Toilets available, when museum is open. Free.

name: Parking place
description:
Parking lot in the forrest.
Quite but also shady.

name: Parking ,Weindorf
description:
Nice parking right on the Rhine.
Chargeable. Also suitable for large campers (trucks).
Next restaurant 50 m.
Walk to the historical center 10 minutes.

name: Knaus Camping Park ,Rhein-Mosel‘
description:
Great campsite right at the mouth of the Mosel on the Rhine.
With a view of the German Eck and the fortress Ehrenbreitstein.

name: Camp Hammer
description:
Beautifully situated campground along river between hills. Good, very complete ablutions with washing machine, dryer and ironing, even background music and background lighting. General room, small shop, bathing for children, sanitation dump station and bar. Good environment for walks. Nearest shop 3 km.
Fee is € 20.50 (2 adults, camper), additional fee for WiFi, kitchen, laundry amenities and showers, cash payment only.

name: Camping Denntal
description: Big grassy campground with nice surroundings. Also a hotel and restaurant close to the campground. Very clean toilets and showers. Extremely quiet in the night.

name: Parkin Lot
description: simple place near Highway no. 71 in Bad Kissingen. No services availble

name: Ottersberg
description:
A Parking with electricity next to a sports center and swimming pool!
There is drinking water ( 1,== €/ ca. 60l). You can also leave chemical Toilette and wastewater.

name: River in the valley
description: There is running water from a spring, a table with benches, a fireplace and beautiful nature. What else do you need? You can be seen from the road, but there is very low traffic so that should not be a problem. Enjoy!

name: Wedeler Wohnmobilstellplatz
description:
Large area reserved for RVs on municipal fairground. Capacity officially 20 units, but it can actually host rather 40 - 50. Open all year long (except when events or festivals are taking place). Electrical hook-up on 12 sites. Charges: €10 for RV; €1 per 6 hours electricity; €1 for 80 liters of drinking water. Free dump station. 10 minutes walk to city center and train station. The train takes you to Hamburg city center in approx. 40 minutes. 10 minutes walk to the Elbe river. Municipal pool and sauna opposite of site.
The site is placed nicely and quiet in a green area of the town. The large open space may look a little dull and you could question the justification of a €10 overnight charge as the place has no further amenities than those mentioned above. But the town of Wedel offers a full range of services, supermarkets, restaurants, etc.. The walk down to the beaches of the river Elbe, a visit of the beach club "28°" or the ships welcome point "Willkomm Höft" is always worth it. The pool (indoor and outdoor) and sauna "Badebucht" opposite of the site is just great, both for kids and adults. And the train takes you in 40 minutes to downtown Hamburg. This may seem long, but there are only very few quiet RV sites available in this second biggest German town. So Wedel may offer a great alternative for your visit to Hamburg.

name: Kerkamm Weltreisemobile
description:
Jörg Kerkamm is a truly experience overlander, he traveled large parts of the planet in his own truck. Additionally, he has a long experience in manufacturing offroad vehicles. He recently decided to open this brand-new facility. It host a production site for offroad camping trucks, a very large and modern workshops for all sorts of RVs and a parts and accessories shop.
Jörg and his team did a great job on my expedition vehicle. The quality of their work was excellent and prices were fair. They went the extra mile to come up with practical and solid solutions. Jörg always has an open ear for your questions and happily shares his experience with you.
Should you need maintenance and repair for your offroad vehicle or RV this is the place to go in Northern Germany.

Web: www.weltreisemobile.de
Address: Werner-Von-Siemens-Str. 2-4, 25337 Elmshorn
Tel: +49 (0) 4121 12 22

name: Abenberg Stellplatz
description: Very nice free parking for motorhomes next to a little lake with a sandy beac. Swimming for free! Water 1 EUR till your tank is full. Electricity 1 EUR 8 hours. Dumping is free. Bakery and supermarket right across the street. Very quiet at night. Public toilettes at the beach.

name: parking lot next to a park
description:
parking lot with space for 20 cars/camper.
free parking

name: Gmund am Tegernsee
description:
A camping ground where you don't have to pay for it.

Public service: Clean WC

name: Breege
description:
Small parking lot with a little forrest close to it.

Ca. 350m to the sea

name: Hillside forestry track
description: Not very far from the road, you‘r not seen but you hear it. Up a steep gravel forestry track there is place for one pickup-camper or tent.  4wd or bike-skills needed.

name: See Camping Langlau
description: Great campground with a lot of permanent Campers at the Brombachsee. Clean Showers, Washing machines, electricity and all facilities you need. 7 € p.P., 8€ for the camper, 2,35€ for electricity and 1€ Kurtax.

name: Main-Donau-Kanal Hilpoltstein
description: Bin grassy area for about 30 Campers directly in front of the Main-Donau Kanal. No facilities. 6€ per day. The Lady comes in the evening to take the money.

name: Speicherbecken Geeste
description: A Campground with several parkinglots. Allowed for Campers for one night. Free, no facilities, quiet at night. And if you want to stay longer... Nobody cares...

name: Papenburg near the Town
description: A great parking-area near the town. No facilities, free. Best place to stay for visiting the beautiful City Papenburg, the „Venice of the North“ with lots of canals, nice restaurants and the great Meyer-Werft. You can book a guiding Tour for visiting this Werft and look how the great ships are built. The bus starts just across the street.

name: Autoselbsthilfe
description:
A Nice place and very Nice People who are willing to help. We got some parts for our Defender

https://www.auto-selbst-hilfe.de/

name: Olafs repair shop
description:
Great mechanic with a heart for overlanders.
Repairs all kind of cars.
We worked here till midnight

name: Falkenstein forest parking lot
description: Streetside parking lot in a quiet forest west of Hamburg. Slightly inclined spots in a dead-end street, mostly used by hikers on weekends. Lots of shade, little direct sunlight, rarely fills up. Luxury houses in the vicinity. 20min walk down to the river beach. Okay for a night, free and legal.

name: Hungerhamm beach parking lot
description:
Commercial parking lot right behind the dunes, 5 min walk to the beach. Level grass/dirt/gravel, quiet at night. Restrooms and foot rinser open 24h, coffee during daytime.

Fees: EUR 5/night, EUR 4/day (making it EUR 9 for 24h)

Nothing special, just a parking lot around a shed, but a convenient location if you're headed for the wide beach just behind the dunes.

name: Seepark Kirchheim
description: Large campground at a small lake. Electricity, Restaurant, restrooms, laundry service.

name: half way to rømø
description: spot near the street with place for 3-4 rigs. attention it‘s in a nature reservate.

name: Ruehler Schweiz
description:
Really nice and relaxed campsite. Down at the river Weser are places for tents and campers on open grass area. Electrical power supply with ECE adapter (necessary).
Little pool and restaurant. Owners are relaxed and friendly. Prices are moderate (paid 23€/night with little camper van, 2 people and two dogs). Showers are hot and cost 50 cents for a long time. Quiet and nice area around.

name: Birdegg's 13
description:
Three spots behind the ice cafe on gras for not too big rigs or tents. Doreen, the owner, is a woman of great energy and fun to be around. 
There is electricity available but no sanitary devices. Nevertheless fresh ice cream, coffee or cake during summer time.
Prices are reasonable and the area is really calm and relaxing for one or two nights to stay.
There is a nice lake within walking distance, a museum and a restaurant nearby. Also a little supermarket (Edeka) within 250 meters.
Great for bicyclists, motorcyclists and campers. Easy to reach from the A24 (exit Neuruppin Sued) in no time. Neuruppin, a cultural-historical pearl, is reachable within 15min by car.

5€ per person and night. Electricity (220V) is 2€ per night fix.

You can contact Doreen by +491731803624 (she speaks only limited English)

name: Close to the road
description:
Un chemin forestier rejoint la route en s'élargissant suffisamment pour y dormir dans un grand cc. La route est par contre très fréquentėe : très bruyant.

Enough space between road and the little path for a big rig. But a lot of trafic. Very noisy.

name: Gas station parking
description: Some parking lots... Close To the highway but not noisier than expected.

name: Parking for rv no tent camping near lake only 6€ a day
description:
6€ a day 
Nice campsite 
A bit noise from the highway busy at weekends 
Boat renting and ferry close

name: Niemtsch at Senftenberger See
description: Very nice parking area with lots of trees, on grass in the woods 150 m from Lake Senftenberg with a nudist area. Absolutely quiet and even in high season not overcrowded. Starting point for a bicycle tour around the lake. During summer: 10 EUR from 7 am- 8 pm, cash only. Max duration 1 day. Toilet, waste bin. During winter: free, toilets closed. Very slow O2 mobile internet.

name: Naturcamping am Mössensee C25
description: Nice natural campsite.  Camp between trees or on lawn. No distance to the lake, small beach and canoe access. They also have canoes to rent. Ppn € 4,-, big mobile home 8,-€, family rate is 13€ for parents with all own children under 18 years. Small shop with everything you need. Fresh rolls in the morning.

name: An St. Peter, Boisheim
description: Parking lot near church. Quiet Place to stay a bit away from highway 61

name: Kirchberg
description: Parking lot for hikers near a lake, next to a main road. Toilets close at 7 p.m.

name: Sandy beach
description: Sweet little Parking Spot in a Forest close to a Sand Beach at a River. Parking with River view possible. Quiet at night. Busy during Weekends. With toilette.

name: Wild Camping next to Donau River
description:
You can drive your vehicle right next to the river bank. No 4x4 needed.
Nice shady places can be found

name: Engen
description:
Very quiet place about 100 meter to the beautiful old town. 
Thai restaurant 50 mtr. Excellent taste

name: few meters of the highway
description: Just a few meters off the highway but not noisy at all. Good place to stay one night. some cars passing by to reach a restaurant along the road.

name: Parking lot Dießen
description:
Big parkinglot at the Ammersee, flat gravel ground with a little beach and a beautiful view over the Ammersee. 

Usually a lot of campervans around, shouldnt be a problem to stay one night.

name: overnight spot
description: parking lot of the Bikepark at the street. okay for an overnight stop.

name: gasthof adler
description: 18th century hotel. reasonably priced and very good English spoken. very clean and nice. limited things in town other than a supermarket

name: Engen Citypark
description:
Address: 78234 Engen, Am Maxenbuck

Wonderful place directly opposite the park.only 200 meter to the beautiful old town. 100 meter from a delicious Thai Restaurant. 
Very quiet and good for a overnight stop to Italy or Switzerland. 
Also for visiting the lake of Konstanz or the black forest.

name: Hilltop
description: Not hidden, but quiet. In the morning some people came with their dogs.

name: Campingplatz an der Oertze
description:
Very quiet campground. Cost for a camper with 2 people was 20 Euro, shower 1 Euro
--
sehr ruhiger Cp Camper mit 2PERS. 20 Euro Duschmarke 1Euro

name: Stellplatz Tuttlingen
description: Free Parking for Campers at the River Donau! You can stay 3 nights

name: Ochsenfurt Stellplatz
description: Very nice free Camping at the River of Main under Mapletrees!  The old Townsville of Ochsenfurt is a good Place to visit!

name: Senftenberg
description:
Free parking along a beautiful lake.
50m to the beach. 
Good for one or two nights.

name: Heldburg Stellplatz
description: Near the old Town of Heldburg is a free Stellplatz with Water, electicity and whast water hole! You can Walk to the Veste Heldburg! Unfortunatly It is near a bussy Road!

name: Naturfreunde Haus
description: This is a nice official Stellplatz for Campers! At the Weekend there is a little Gasthof! Good hiking Trails! Nice and quiet to relax!

name: Wittwe lake
description: Beautiful clear water lake in a Natural Reserve. You cannot drive directly to a lakeview but the parking spot is in the forest and just 2 min walk to the water! Amazing place!!

name: Radeburg Lakeview
description: Close to the Highway is a nice little Parking Spot close to a Lake. Nice for a sleep over or just a break from the Road! Only until 1,5 tons but that s just so no trucks park here. For campervans its not a Problem.

name: Parkingplace in the forest
description:
It is a nice and quiet parkingplace near a little lake in the forest.
There are of course some people down there but in the evening there should be no one.

name: Mammut-Camping
description:
Big meadow, not everywhere electricity, very nice toilets/shower

200m next to the entrance of the Mammut-Park

name: lush green forest road with converted van
description: Road leading into the forest brought us to a small side path bumping up a corn field. Easily accessible. rustic. surrounded by nature. A+

name: Zwiefalten bus parking
description:
Ample space on gravel bus parking lot. Next door are football grounds which can mean some action or traffic, but it was very quiet. Nothing special or particularly beautiful. Restrooms (possibly even showers, didn't check) were free and open at the sports grounds and in town at the abbey entrance.
A great kids playground and some fitness installations are right next door.

300m walk to Zwiefalten Abbey, 200m to supermarket ('PENNY'). The town feels cosy, has bakeries, a brewery and restaurants (including 'beer heaven'). The abbey is open, but currently under construction, so you can't really see much of the interior.

Level, quiet, mostly sunny. Legal and free.

name: Camper parking Ravensburg
description:
Official camper parking. Nothing special. Convenient location, a bit noisy. Dump station, electricity. Level, sun and shade. EUR 8.50/day or 0.80/hr, pay per meter (machine).

Water 1,-/50l

name: Schleifwiese
description:
Nice way to camp for one night. Covered bench with table (erichshütte) is available. Sometimes water at the source - but rather take it with you. very beautiful view.

Schöne Möglichkeit zu Zelten für eine Nacht. Überdachte Bank mit Tisch (erichshütte) ist vorhanden. Manchmal Wasser an der Quelle - aber lieber mit hin nehmen. sehr schöne Aussicht.

name: Schaalsee Camp
description: Friendly, family-oriented campground in the forest by a lake. All sites are under the trees. Canoeing available. We paid €19 for two people and a rooftop tent.

name: Blumenthal
description: Parking lot next to a beergarden restaurant suitable for indisturbed overnight.

name: Parking Dreiburgenblick
description: beautiful view above the river rhine to 3 castles

name: Camping Hopfensee
description: Big campground directly at a lake. Own beach and also wellnes and pool at the campground. All pitches leveld and enough space. Cost about 30 Euro per night 2 persons a dog and a camper. Price for off season.

name: Guglhör
description: Quiet little spot with beautiful view. Close to the City of Murnau.

name: Colditz
description: Mixed parking area with designated spaces for motor homes. Plenty of space, quiet area, gravelled site next to grassy open space in a residential area. Short walk into town and to castle. Supermarket nearby.

name: Paderborn
description: Water and waste disposal. Water is 50c for 60litres. Also a Overnight parking area for a 5Euro fee.

name: Windischeschenbach
description: Free place near by the Town. No Water, no Service.

name: Fritz Berger
description: It is a place to stay maximum 3 days for free.

name: Camping Land an der Elbe
description: Great campsite for those who love nature. You can camp in a garden area behind reception - or on the other side of a dike on the Elbe River. The owners are very nice and live on site. They left the river side of the campsite as wild as possible with many trees. There are no specific campsites. You just chose a place. Not at all crowded on a week day in September. Campfires are allowed and firewood is available for purchase. There are nice flush toilets on the river side. You walk over the dike to use the showers - which are in beautiful, clean modern sanitary facilities. We paid €22 for two adults, our truck and rooftop tent. Showers are €1 each for 5 minutes. There is a grocery store about 5 minutes drive from the campground.

name: Free RV
description: Parking lot in quaint town, dump included. There were 9 RVs the night we were here. Just off the highway between Bremen and Hamburg. Quiet. Lidl and aldi on your way into town. Toilets

name: Free Park Location
description: Park in a small town with spots reserved for motor homes. The town isn't much but the park is large and there's an old windmill. Toilets available between 8 am and 8pm. There's also a sanidump station in the lot.

name: theluckyvanlife
description:
This is a "Park n' Ride" Place, it's very quiet, not much traffic and also no facilities. On one side the River "Neckar" and on the other the street which brings you to the highway. Nothing fancy, but works for a night. 
Please note, that overlanding in gerneral is not allowed, but if you just sleep in the car (not camping outside) it might be fine.

name: theluckyvanlife
description:
This is an official "campsite". No need to check in, just park if there is space. On the link below you can find all the infos (in German) - In case you don't speak german: short info - 3 days parking, free. Electricity, water etc you pay with coins. Toilets are at the kiosk, but they might be closed by night. Showers: you can go into the town swimming pool (pay for the evening ticket) there you shower. Only open between May and August.

I'm not sure, but I don't think someone will recognize if you stay longer than three days. But we never tried out. 

Be aware: Heilbronn has the "environment badge" (Umweltplakette) - if you travel Germany you might already recognize. Here you need a green one.

http://www.heilbronn-tourist.de/hn_content.asphmg=4xx44xx0xx0xx0&lang=01

ABOUT HEILBRONN:

Enjoy the city, go for a walk at the riverside to town. There are tons of restaurant you can eat at. From vegan food at "Velo" & "Grüne Pause" to vietnam food at "My Sapa" or regular good food at "Charivari". If you are there in summer, visit the "Kaffeebucht" it's very close to this point. If you go out for a beer, there are also tons of bars. Young people really enjoy the "Data 77112". Lots of open minded people from all over. 

If you want to swim, the town swimming pool is also right next to this place. If you need groceries and daily stuff there are also many stores around. Best (in my eyes) is "Edeka" - everything we listed here you can google to find the adresses. Have fun <3

name: Camping Furlbach
description: Good campground for a night. Nothing special. Traditional layout of pitches without any privacy. Shade trees. Kitchen and Sanitary facilities are well maintained and very clean. We paid €16 for two adults and a truck with a rooftop tent. Shower tokens cost €1 for 6 minutes of hot water. Background noise from the nearby highway. Strong LTE cell signal here.

name: Main Spessart Camping
description: Big Campground with lots of all year campers. Enough pitches left for others. Quiet and near to the river Main. We paid 19 Euro for two persons a camper and a dog. Good Restaurant.

name: Rheinufer Gailingen
description: Very Nice grassy parking area especially for campers. 15€ a night very close to Rhein. You can go for a swim here. Toilets und showers are available.

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz Bad Camberg
description:
free, quiet parking for about 10 vehicles with disposal and fresh water. short walk to the old town

kostenloser, ruhiger Stellplatz für ca. 10 Fahrzeuge mit Entsorgung und Frischwasser. kurzer Fussweg zur Altstadt

name: Inzell
description: Nice campground between the mountains. Some pitches are bit small. Excellent facilities! Best I’ve ever seen. Two persons, car, rtt, €15 in oktober

name: Treffurt Public Campground
description: This is a public campground for €6 per vehicle and night. There is a lawn, trees and a beautiful view on the castle of Normannsburg. It is next to the river and only limited ammenities available.

name: Bad Sooden-Allendorf Public Campground
description: This is a public campground for €4 per vehicle and night. Electricity and water is available at some extra cost (€ coins). The ground is a parking spot out of town close to the 'former border' museum of Schifflersgrund. Museum is definetly worth the visit.

name: Allendorf Public Campground Franzrasen
description:
This is a public campground 'Franzrasen' next to the city centers of the two villages Bad Sooden and Allendorf.
It is €8 per vehicle and night. Water included and electricity at extra costs available.
There is a nice lawn area with trees and a not so nice gravel area. The ground is next the watergate of the Werra river.
It is also close to salina thermal public pool.

name: Pullendorf
description: Nice, quite and cost 6 Euro, restaurant nearby, electricity extra, water also

name: Riedlingen
description: 3 womo parking place free, electricity and 200l water 1Euro 4 hours, nice town in walking distance

name: Site Nationalparkzentrum Thiemsburg Baumkronenpfad Canopy Walkway
description:
This is a dedicated tarred space for campers as part of the normal parking area with no direct amenities. Quiet at night and close to wonderful Baumkronenpfad (canopy walkway).
It is flat 1€ exit fee (pay at exit boom gate) for a stay as long as you like. 
There are very clean toilets next to the entrance building but only accessible during office hours (roughly 9:30 until 18:00). There is also a restaurant at the entrance of the park (similar office hours, see above).

name: Dultplatz
description: Free parking close to town, no facilities but lots of motorhomes stop here

name: Pfeifferling Ippinghausen 34466
description: good place for a sleep, german food and safe place for motorbikes

name: St. Florian Hütte
description: Quite spot next to a small road with little traffic. Beautiful view into the Swiss alps if clear. Tables, shelter and bbq on site

name: Wild Resting Spot
description: Very simple yet useful parking spot in the wild. Close to the A9.

name: Zweribach parking
description: Parking place for the hike to the beautiful zweribach waterfalls. Nice view, fresh water and very calm to spent the night. Access only via Wildgutach. Take your rubbish with you

name: Am Alten Bahnhoff
description:
Official camper Place near a small village, with bakery, pizzeria and some shop.
Good for overnight stay. Nice walking in the area. 
6 euro a night is collected. Open all year.

name: Campingplatz Birkensee
description:
Very nice campsite open all year with a bar and restaurant.
Very friendly staff.
Heated shower and toilet blocks
WiFi only in bar / restauant

name: Burghausen
description: Nice Place for Campers - very quiet, in the nature, 5min by bike to the old City. Nice Sunset. Electricity and water. 8€ / Night

name: Campspot next to the river Rhine
description: Nice Campspot next to the river Rhine (Rhein), right by the river. You can get there with any car, but if you want to drive down at the beach you should have 4x4. No signs for no Overnight parking or anything else, might be good for a night, you hear the Trains and cars passing by, but not that loud, thanks to it lower position. Keep it clean.

name: campspot next the the Rhine river
description: Campspot next to the river, just of the B42 easy access for any vehicle. You hear the Cars and Trains from the nearby railway and Road.

name: parking lot at the forest
