description: Parking lot right beside the forest, quiet at night. During the day, there is traffic on the nearby road. might be good for a night, if you go a little further into the forest you have a beautiful view over the Rhine (Rhein) valley.

name: Auto Schiemenz
description:
Lada specialist and dealer. Super professionell workshop.
Lada dealer since 1972. You will get anything you need for your Lada Niva etc...

name: Wasch Salon
description:
Outside the city of Trier, near the University, in a small shopping centre.
We parked our medium sized vehicle - 7T Vario with box camper - in the parking lot. 
A great and accessible do it yourself laundry.

name: Suederluegum
description:
Official campervan site of Suederluegum. Quiet place at night. Close to the Danish border.
Free of charge.

name: Munich
description: Agip Gas Station. Located virtually in the centre of Munich.

name: Burg Vogelsang
description: Wohnmobilstellplatz Burg Vogelsang , Schotterplatz ,Besichtigung  ,Wandermöglichkeit , Nationalpark

name: Home of knockingonheavansdoor
description:
This is our basecamp and we would like to invite every overlander to be our guest. 
It is just a small parkingspace, enough for 2 campers, but you can also use our backyard for hanging out or take a bath in the pond.
There is 230V and fresh water for free, just knock on our door and ask for anything you need. We are more than willing to help.

name: groß wasserburg krausnick
description: very nice Place for one night friendly People ...

name: Northeim
description:
Northeim Seenplatte. Nice big parkinglot near the lake and a Restaurant. One Toilette
6€ per day.

name: Arnsberg Lifte
description: In summer a big parking lot. Good for one night. Near by a Ski area.

name: Wessendorfer Platz
description: Very quite Place in the middle of a forest. Good for one Night. Easy to find, there is a sign by the mainroad. No facilities.

name: Ortenburg, Parking Place near Center
description:
Parking Place close to the Marketplace.
Quiet Place for Overnight.

name: Aschaffenburg RV / mobile home parking
description:
Parking for mobile homes. 5€/24hrs, electricity and FREE WIFI provided. There are signposts to showers and toilets, but we did not check them out :-)
Very clean and peaceful place, nice view of the castle, directly next to the river.
Trash bin and light provided.

name: Parkplatz Laufenburg
description: This parking lot is used for hikers and day visitors of the Ruhr Eifel area and forest. During night the spot is empty and nice. A small disadvantage is the relatively close by road (noise), but traffic is low when night falls.

name: Water Tap at City Center
description: It is a public water tap in the city center of Penzberg. It is right next to the central bus stop.

name: Campingplatz Fohnsee
description: It's a campsite right next to Fohnsee. It is in the forest, so there's a lot of shade. And the Lake is perfect for swimming. Also there is a restaurant nearby.

name: Camping Walchensee
description: It's a campsite at the Walchensee located in the town called Walchensee. It's suitable for tents as well as RVs. There is also a small campsite shop with a bakery. In the town are many restaurants and a small town shop. The lake is perfect for swimming, wind surfing and sailing.

name: Campingplatz Renken
description: The campsite is located in the town of Kochel. It's right next to the Kochelsee, which is perfect for swimming. You can also go sailing there. In the town there are many restaurants, a swimming pool and a supermarket

name: Campingplatz Kesselberg
description: The campsite is located at the of the town of Kochel. It's right next to Kochelsee. In town there are many restaurants, a swimming pool and supermarket.

name: Hotel Berggeist
description: It's an hotel with a restaurant located in Penzberg.

name: Wanderparkplatz Silbersee
description: Remote parking in the forest, very quiet during the night, lots of families came in the morning on a sunny Saturday even in winter - it’s a nice hiking area! weak mobile O2- connection.

name: Wanderparkplatz Bundenberg
description: Parking in the woods. Starting point of nice hiking tours. Absolutely quiet at night, no O2 net.

name: Wanderparkplatz Sensweiler Cemetery
description: Very quiet spot with nice views over the meadows. Starting point of the hiking trail Köhlerpfad. Weak O2 reception.

name: Eastern Comfort hostel boat berlin
description:
During summer camping 12,50€ pppn is allowed on the upper terrasse/deck of one of the boats. During winter you can choose a cabin 50€ double pn.
Parking your rigg arround the place is still free..you could park your car at the opposite riverside ( more quiet) and take a shower 5€pp or a drink at the boat 
The owner is traveling a lot and can give you advice. Overlanders are very welcome

name: Kiesteich Windehausen
description: A nice place to get out with the van. Close to a lake

name: Wanderparkplatz Muldenberg
description: Nice quiet place in the woods. Starting point of hiking / cross-country ski tracks. We found a level place at the very end of the parking spot. Weak mobile O2 internet.

name: Tollensesee
description: A spot next to Tollenesee lake on the way to the camping.

name: Rerik parking area
description: A parking area on the Haven Rerik quiet and empty out of season. cost unsure

name: Lauffen official RV parking
description: Small parking lot outside of Lauffen direct on the river Neckar. The parking cost 7,50€ per day. There is also a sewage disposal for free. fresh water (in wintertime not available) and power cost seperat. you can take here some hikes, bicycling, and there is a pool just 200 meters away.

name: Petersau
description: Parking place on the River Rhine next to boat ramp. Popular dog exercise area with open fields. More suited to campers/motor homes that are fully equipped with onboard toilet.

name: Nice large car park
description: This is a very large parking area in the countryside but on the edge of a nice town. There is a water tap on the cemetery which is about 400m away. It's very quiet. Very nice place.

name: Car park at Mountain pass
description: We stayed a night here, after the sun went down it was very quiet. There are toilets near the old hotel. Amazing view.

name: Picnic spot with parking
description: Small car park with a lovely picnic area! Next to a road but very quiet after night fall! Local dog walkers very friendly! Perfect for over night stay.

name: Badisch Lappland
description: RV- Parking at the event Local Badisch Lapland. Several pitches in a very quiet rural location. Water and electricity can be placed on request.

name: RV Stellplatz "Karwendel"
description:
RV-Parking with all Amenities and great mountain view. Near to the traditional center of Mittenwald Market with historical houses etc, and shops, Bavarian Restaurants, Mountain Trails ... Near also to Mittenwald Station, but the passing trains don't make much noise.
Prices start at 13 Euro per night + electricity. Good place to have a break, when entering Germany from the South.

name: Overnight-P  SylvensteinSpeicher
description: RV Overnight-Parking near to the Sylvenstein-Lake (= artificial lake to control the water flow of the Isar River). Not any special facilities, just parking space, with access to the lake and to a Bavarian Restaurant nearby (200m).

name: Dullgartenweg Walchum
description: Dead-End way in the fields with space for a few RVs. Not any facilities, and no houses nearby. Nice open view to the West. Stayed there a few times over the last years: Not any disturbances or problems...

name: Parking day and night without amenities
description: Free parking spot busy in day with hikers quiet by night! Plenty of spaces and great area! Near by town with cafe restaurants etc...

name: In der Silz
description: Flat Level Parking Lot. Water available 1 Euro per  80L . Electric hook up 1 Euro for 1 kw. Close to Bad Durkheim, which is a very pretty town surrounded by vineyards.

name: Aumeister Biergarten München
description:
This place is just the Overflow-ParkingPlace (Grass!) of the Biergarten, but it's not often in use and very calm at night. The owners tolerate a few RVs staying there overnight. No traces, please!
Enjoy the Biergarten! (with Toilets), 400m to subway to Munich-Center, Lots of  space in the English Garden ...

name: Camping Ostsee
description: Campingpark Ostsee Rerik.  13€ /night not include electricity

name: Bojens Truck and Trailerservice GmbH
description: A Workshop for truck and trailer repair  and service

name: Engel-Netze GmbH & Co. KG | Beste Qualität seit 1951
description: A good place if you need any cable replacement for you winch.  Nice and helpful team.

name: tourfactory - expeditionsbedarf
description:
description from the owner:

- complete solutions on the basis of toyota hzj
- toyota parts and products
- self-developped parts
- know-how and experience

www.tourfactory.de

no fixed opening hours!
tel: +49/2157/872277

name: Campingplatz Tennefels
description: Basic campsite with mostly permanent caravans. Flexible sites with space for big rigs. Quiet and attractive Black Forest area with friendly and helpful owners—speaks English. 23€ for 2 nights without electricity—2 persons and car. Bike path and stream adjacent. Grass sites. Upgrades to ablutions almost finished—heated toilet block and heated shower rooms with hot water in scullery, also heated. Walk to bakery/cafe open on Sunday. Enjoyed and recommended.

name: Camping Wangen am See
description: Moderate size campsite on lakeshore—1/2 permanent caravans. Pub (opens at Easter, but can get beers, coffee all year)—restaurant at entrance open all year. Modern/clean ablutions, washer/dryer 5€. (Mostly) Gravel parking pads, grass elsewhere. Well organized campsite, somewhat small sites. Owner lives offsite, very friendly, speaks English. 34€ for car/2 adults 2 days, no electricity. Butcher shop 100m also has hot deli for takeaway. Campsite especially recommended if u want to avoid mega campsites on main lake.

name: Parking with lake view
description: Lots of free parking in the area but this spot is very quiet and away from the road so very little noise, can see the lovely lake from the van as well as great fields for letting the dog have a run

name: Next to the wagon cleaner at shell station
description:
Friendly staff 
Free disposal of black water and fresh water available for free

name: Villa Helios
description:
Very nice, quiet campsite in the shady park of an old villa, situated on a hill opposit of the Osterburg (Weida). The centre of the 800 years old town with restaurants and shops is in walking distance (1,5 km). 
The warm and friendly hosts Rico and Marie will look after you and have tipps, what to do in the surrounding area.
Contact is +49 171 189 2218. Fee was 12€ per campervan/night.

name: TISCHER Freizeitfahrzeuge (Pick-up Camper)
description: Produktionsstätte & Werkstätte von Freizeitfahrzeugen auf Pick-up oder Kleinlasterfahrzeugen. Versiert im Reparieren von typischen Wohnmobilproblemen ...

name: Wohnmobil-Parkplatz (free)
description: Offical parking area without costs. 30m beside the river Main, 10 min walking distance to the town, 100m Lidl-Discounter, 300m REWE-Supermarkt

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz
description: No tents just rigs are allowed. 6€ for 24h. Fresh water, dump station & electricity, close to the Main-Donau-Kanal

name: Campingplatz Dresden Mockritz
description: 4 km from Center of Dresden. Bus in front of Camping. Not very big but has everything you need (Restaurant, little shop, etc.)

name: Tegernsee
description: A large gravel car park which is at the start of a local hike. Raised up from the main road with a view down to the lake.

name: Arnsberg
description: Quiet parking spot next to a small river

name: long parking lot near a restaurant
description: parking lot near a street and a Restaurant. come late and leave early.

name: hiker parking lot near Waterfalls / Bühlertal
description: big parking lot for hikers. forest an small city with shops, Restaurants, bars, hotels, stores nearby. Come late - leave early.

name: hiking parking lot Kalchreuth
description: parking space for hikers. near fields and a forrest. all day open. trashbins. tents maybe possible but stoney ground

name: Ferienhausvermietung Kieling
description: 3 guest houses, very nice lady, pets allowed, near forrest

name: hiker Parking Wilischbachweg
description: nice spot near a Restaurant and a forest with a small water spot

name: Massingsmühle
description: Very quiet natural place near a little river at the end of a narrow gravel road in the forest!

name: Ostseeblick Caravanpark
description: Very nice place on grass plots with electricity. Next to beach.

name: Stellplatz  next to harbour Wustrow
description: Simple official parking for camper and caravans. 24h max. 10 Euro without any facilities. Toilets and wash bassin at the harbour.

name: Rostock Stadthafen - Stehplatz
description: Official Parking Lot for Campers. 20.00 Euros 24 hours, 2 Euros per hour

name: Spessart parking
description: Parking lot in the woods. Nice for a hike on the “Eselsweg”through the Spessart. Bad internet reception.

name: Vockerode Near Elbe River
description:
Little nice spot under trees near Elbe River. Quiet. Good starting point for a cycling tours to Wörlitz and Dessau. Good mobile internet. 
A few fishermen around in the evening.

name: Parking Wörlitzer Park
description: Day and overnight parking for camper vans. Water behind the green reception house. We didn’t stay overnight, but most probably quiet when daily visitors have left. Slow internet reception. 5 EUR /day, 10 EUR overnight.

name: Koenigslutter elm
description: Not the nicest place, but large and away from road and flat. Access not forbiden as most of those places in germany. After short 100m dirt road from main road you will reach tarmac/concrete “parking” in the middle of woods. No trafic at all close to very less frequent road. I slept there few time in car and never ever had any company nor issue with anyone. Quite good place away from people. If you wanna overland for cheap without official campsites come here! Also good setpoint for walks to the forrests arround.

name: Picnic area at Repenter Kanal
description: Small picnic area with roofed table and bench directly at the water in the midst of the forest. Absolutely remote and quiet. Access road partly unpaved/ bridge up to 9 tons. Poor internet reception.

name: Lochbauer
description:
Pension&Restaurant. 
Nice location in the valley of the River Elster.

name: Roadside parking
description: There are vans and rvs parked here intermittently. If you are a light sleeper I would not recommend this place. Trains and cars going by are quite loud at night. I wasn't bothered by police or anything though.

name: Königsforst Parking
description: Free parking area in residential area. Pretty quiet at night and close to the trains to the city. Great hiking nearby. Wasn't bothered by people or police

name: Gartenverein Camping
description: Really quiet spot at night. Occasionally cars from the gardening club drove by, but later at night it was completely empty. I was not bothered by police and the night was a great rest. There were woods on the side of the road. Excellent spot

name: Lakeside Quiet Parking
description: This spot is super quiet at night. Very remote for being in the city and there's lake access not even 200 meters from the spot

name: Nürnberg
description: Nice official place to stay safe overnight. You can stay up to 3 days and visit the City there is a bus station near the ground. It’s for free.

name: Naturcamp Hexenwäldchen
description: Camp directory at Jamelsee. Wonderful view over lake and forest. Absolutely quiet. Starting point for cycling and canoe tours. On grass, partly under trees. We didn’t use toilets and showers  - we have our own. 17 EUR for camper + 2 persons w/o electricity /pay 2 nights - stay 3 nights in low season. WLAN free. Showers for extra fee. Mini mart, fresh rolls for breakfast. Next restaurant in 600 meters.

name: Havelquelle/source of the Havel
description: Very nice parking spot between trees on gras. Close to the source of river Havel and just off the border of Müritz National Park. Starting point for a hiking trip around lake “Mühlensee“. Very poor internet reception.

name: Camping am hohen Ufer
description: Campsite directly by the sea. A lot of permanent Campers. Good level pitches with a lot of green. 30 Euro for 2 persons a camper and a dog. Good place if you take the ferry to Helsinki.

name: Eubabach
description:
Parking next to a museum. 
Wide area. A lot of nature around

[ADMIN NOTE] - Wild-camping is generally not allowed nationwide, please check the local rules.

name: Ruhrtalblick
description: Nice camping with restaurant. Near the Ruhrtalradweg.

name: Camping Tiefurt, Weimar, Am kleinen Gütchen
description: little familiar campground for RVs and Caravans up to 7m. Attention: radar speed control 30km/h on the road. Shadow + Sun places. Door open 7-12 and 15-22. Car with 2 persons incl. electric, water, grey, waste: 24,50€/night - cash only. Hot shower 1€/5  minutes. Dogs allowed. Little pool+ TV. Bakery, Cafe, Restaurant near by. 3km on bicycle to the center of Weimar/Thüringen - sightseeing for Goethe/Schiller/Liszt. Not open all over the year - call +49 3643 850121 , mobile +49 163 2980970 . www.camping-weimar-tiefurt.de

name: Camper Parking Öllingen Free Camp
description: Free camper parking. Three spots. Free dump and water. Electricity 1 € (not sure about the electricity price). Typical little farmer village. Quiet.

name: Mittelhof Free Camp
description: You can use the unpaved parking that is basically 200 metres unpaved parallel road along the paved Mittelhof road or you can take the unpaved road (100 metres and easy to drive when it's dry) opposite the Mittelhof road parking dividing farmland from the forest and leading to this spot. Recreation area with 2 fire rings. We enjoyed 3 peacefull days here. Nice view. Trucks 3500+ are not allowed on the Mittelhofweg (Anlieger frei).

name: Seeblick Kloster Lehnin
description:
little campground at Klostersee
very natural and mostly quiet
showers and toilets are clean
extra pay for showers 1 € per 3 minutes
little kitchen for diswashing but you can't cook there
they accept only cash
dog bathing spot
driveway is a bit adventurous, but we did with 11 meter (van plus caravan)
we have seen no restriction for hight except maybe some branches

name: Rosenhof Camping
description: nice and cool place, quiet, in the backyard of s big sportscenter, horse riding, bowling, tennis, squash, kid-friendly... price EUR pool 20.- incldg. breakfast bread rolls (!),  for 2 people in small rig

name: Tiny lake love
description: Nice and very quiet spot for a night in the fields and close to a tiny lake. Lake ist maybe not for swimming though, didn't test. 20 kms away from Berlin.

name: Stadtsteinach Camping
description: A nice camping place. We payed 21 euro for 2 people and one camping car per day.

name: Markkleeberger See
description: Campground next to a lake. Very friendly staff. Nice restaurant and Biergarten in the campground. We paid 15 euros for 2 people, 2 motorbikes and one tent.

name: Generator Hostel
description: Big hostel with off-street parking for a few motorcycles or fairly large rigs. A bed is 14 Euros a night (booking online, at reception it was 19 Euros a bed) so booked online in the reception with the free WiFi here. By the way super fast wifi! very hot showers. location isn't the best for walk abouts but the tram station is just next door. there are 3 grocery stores close by as well. stayed 3 nights and found it to be a great base to go out exploring the city without breaking the bank.

name: Sales Office A goBox
description: Vehicles in Austria over 3.5 tons must install and charge a "goBox". More problematic than the purchase is the return of the box and payment of the remaining credit. Here on the German side it is quite simple. Shell petrol station with extremely friendly staff. The return and payment took minutes. When entering Austria you can of course also buy and load one there.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Diepholz Free Camp
description: Huge grassy campervan park. Free with free WiFi. Close to town centre.

name: WOMO Stellplatz Lindenfels
description: The village Lindenfels offers a part of the parking lot for car camper. 5 € p.n., water and power extra. Max. 3 nights. Clean bathrooms. Dumping possible! Very nice place with a view on the castle. Small town with supermarket and everything you need and of course the castle.

name: Stopover Schwarmstedt
description: Gravel Parkingarea between a field, a sidestreet and a small industrial area. Has wateroutlets. Quiet stopover when you are on the A7.

name: Remagen Camper Stellpaltz
description: €12, €1 2kw power, €1 water. level grass sites. easy access to river and pathway to town.  Free access to cassette and grey water dump.

name: Stellplatz Malzmüllerwiesen Free Camp
description: Huge grassy gravel parking for Campervans. Free.

name: Camping Heidelberg
description: Campsite close to the old town of Heidelberg (6 km, 10 minutes by bus). The Campsite is direct at the main Street and because of this very loud. Cars and Trucks passing by, even during the night Showers are included within the price of 25 € (1Van, 2 person, without electricity). They have places with and without electricity. A supermarket is in front of the Campsite. Good to visit Heidelberg and the castle.

name: Freizeitcenter Oberrhein
description: Huge campsite around two swimming lakes. Price is 30 € a night for a camper and two persons including facilities. We stayed outside at the Mobile home lot for 10 € a night without facilities. You can buy a day pass for 3€ p.P. to enter the lake/camping area and use showers, go swimming, etc. Midigolf, restaurants and Animation withing the Campsite. It's recommended to book in advance.

name: Alken town camp platz
description: free. motorhome carpark for 4-5 motorhomes.  max 6m long. small gravel parking lot next to the tour bus parking.  no awnings, chairs, tables, generators - I guess they want you to buy drinks and food in town.

name: Wurzburg camping platz
description: €12 24hrs in a carpark in very tight bays. The parks are on the riverside so you can put out chairs and enjoy the view.  power and water available at extra cost. free dump station, although you will need to walk your cassette in if not staying. Easy wall to the city.

name: RV Parking Hoya
description: A quiet place overlooking the Weser. Accommodates 10 campers...(Ein ruhiger Platz mit Blick auf die Weser. Platz für 10 Wohnmobile...)

name: Volkertshausen behind the culture center
description: Very quiet large parking lot for some motorhomes. Behind the old church in the middle of the village. In the village you will find three typical German restaurants, one with Bier garden and close to the supermarket Edeka a good. Chinese restaurant. you can ask for drinking water at the fire department.

name: Steisslinger Lake
description:
Very beautiful lake with a lot of parking lots. But better to stay on the meadows behind the paved places. very quiet at night but busy on daytimes because of the people who also like swimming. 

There is a restaurant at the lake you can go without entrance fee. And some other good restaurants in the village. 

Best place if you want to stay free and enjoy swimming.

name: Wohnmobil und Zeltplatz
description:
Here is a small cozy campsite with pitches for campers and a tent meadow. There are fire pits, a barbecue area, vending machines, showers (€ 0.50) and WC.

Hier ist ein kleiner gemütlicher Campingplatz mit Stellplätzen für Wohnmobile und einer Zeltwiese. 
Es gibt Feuerstellen, einen Grillplatz, Getränkeautomaten, Duschen (0,50 €) und WC.

name: Welschingen sports hall
description:
Big parking lot from the sports hall. Quiet from 10:00 p.m during the week. 
At weekends there may be some activities. than all the lots are full with cars.
Good restaurant 300 meter far away, Bären.
During sports Sessions you can get drinking water if you ask.

name: nice and clean overnighter
description: nice and clean overnighter provided by the council. There is a bit of road noise during the day but quiet at night. Bakery and Restaurants just a short walk into town.

name: Neviges swimming pool caravan parking
description:
Swimming pool car park, with dump station. 
Great outside swimming pools. Perfect for a stopover in summer.

name: free car park with an amazing view of Rursee
description: free car park with an amazing view of Rursee, Plenty of space friendly locals who we only saw in the morning walking there dogs.

name: UNDER THE BRIDGE- NEXT TO THE RIVER
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: iOverlander does not support any illegal camping. Please check local and country laws. Germany is known for having strict regulations and a general probation against wild camping.

Place next to the River „Weser“. Place with a little place with roof on top. A grill to make yourself a BBQ. And a Perfect Little bridge to go into the Water.

name: Wooded area near sports fields
description: Quiet location in the woods, with large area to park just off small paved road. Hikers and bicyclist pass by, some with dogs, all say hello. Good shade and flat parking. Walking distance to a supermarket.

name: camping platz
description: only €3 for 24hrs.  large carpark, some grass and trees for shade. close to city walls.  toilets open 07:00 to 19:30.  dump, water and power available

name: free camping platz
description: free for 5 days.  flat carpark short walk to the town.  dump, power and water available.

name: camping platz
description: Carpark, €5 24hrs. Some shade. Factory on the other side of the river but not too noisy.  very peaceful night.  swimming access to river across the road.  dump station and water available.

name: Parking on Siemensallee
description: On the whole Siemensallee there is plenty of room to stay for one night. There are also a lot of Campervans standing and parking there, so if you don't put out your awning or chairs you wont be noticed. Street is not very crowdy and IMHO a safe place.

name: Kettenhammer Weiher
description: Free parking space on a litle lake where you can go swimming. It's free to stay overnight. During the day you have to pay.

name: city centre
description: Great place in the city centre provided by the council including toilets and dump point. Supermarket and Restaurants within walking distance. Water and electricity connection for a small fee.

name: Gasthaus stellplatz
description: 2 spaces at the rear of the building.  €8.50 incl power and water.  good flat site , very quiet

name: Football pitch Boulange
description: Quite and leveled area beside the sport fields. No infrastructure.

name: Schloß Dankern Wohnmobilparkplatz
description:
There are 15 places with electricity support. There are still more without electricity. The charge for 1 night/RV is about 8€; for electricity you will pay 4€  more. Restaurant is in walking distance beside the lake. --- Neben dem Freizeitzentrumpark Schloß Dankern sind etwa 15 Stellplätze mit Stromanschluss; etliche weitere darüberhinaus auch. Die Übernachtungspauschale beträgt pro Fahrzeug/Nacht 8€ mit Strom 4€ mehr. Restaurant (Plünnhock) ist in fußläufiger Distanz am See.
Eintritt in den Park tagsüber kostenpflichtig. Gegen 18.00 Uhr kostenfreier Zugang möglich.

name: Camping Platz
description: only €8 24hrs.  just a carpark, but handy to old town and fortress.  dump, water and power available.

name: Naturcamp An der Weser
description:
Wedged between the river Weser and a small Creek (and busy road), and opposite a very large different kind of campsite (Sonnenwiese), is An der Weser: a small campsite with very spacious pitches and few amenities. Despite the busy and noisy road along side it, it's a lovely place with lots and lots of green. I recommend going all the way to the back of the campsite, as these are the farthest from the crowd that camps next to the river, and you'll have a small creek all for yourself! Drawback is that the nearest watertap is quite a long walk away and there is no power available there. Also, the toilets and showers are on the other side of the campsite. They are quite old, but clean. 
It is allowed to make a campfire, but they don't sell wood.
Spend 2 nights here, one of them was quiet.

prices are low:
Camping                                        per night
Caravan                                          €8,35
Bungalow tent                                 €8,35
Camper                                           €8,35
Extra tent                                        €3,15      
Person                                          €4,20
Kids (max 15 year)                      €2,10
Dog.                                               €2,10
Power                                            €2,25
Car /Motorcycle                                    €2,10
Boat                                                €2,10
Wifi                                                 eur 1,50 

I paid €25 for 2 nights, one person and a landcruiser.

name: Camping Pfronten
description:
Moderator note: please note seasonal closures at this campground. Check website for more details. 

Decent and affordable campsite next to a busy road and railtrack. Beautiful surroundings, though. Less than 1 km from border with Austria. Excellent base for hiking, biking, or visiting the castles of Hohenschwangau. (Fastest route is through Austria, no vignet needed!)
Ablutions are clean and well maintained. And included in the price, just like wifi. Poor cell phone reception. Quiet at night. Quite large pitches. Electricity optional. No open fires allowed. Friendly and helpful staff. Small bar, no food. 
Camping prices 	per night / day
Adults from 16 years old 	6,00 € 
Tourist tax	1,50 € 
kids 3 - 15 years	4,00 € 
Tourist tax	1,00 € 
Camper 		7,00 € 
Caravan with car		7,00 € 
Campingspot with car		7,00 € 
Campingspot no car		3,50 € 
extra tent 		3,50 € 
extra car	3,50 € 
dog	2,00 € 
Electricity		3,00 €

name: Bockenauer Schweiz
description:
Great campsite! No fixed pitches; you can stand on any of the 3 fields. The one in the back has (yet) no watertaps, but does have electricity. Sanitary building is also quite a walk away. That might be the reason I had the whole field to myself. Some small fishing ponds. Lots of shade by trees. Very quiet place!
Fires are allowed. In fact, there are fire bowls everywhere, and wood is for free(!), but you have to saw it yourself.
Lots of hiking and cycling trails in the beautiful area.
Ablutions are clean but bring your own toilet paper. Showers are for free, as well as use of the washing machine!
Prices are more than decent: €14 per night for one person and a landcruiser (no electricity).

name: Camping Erlebnis Zugspitze
description: This camping is on the main road towards Garmisch-Partenkirchen which is very popular among tourists. But if you want a bit of peace and quiet and also some great hiking and mountain biking routes this is the place for you. It is not cheap, but it is clean and the pitches are good.

name: Woldsee
description: Parking close to swimming lake. Nice country side view with cows and forest. Alsof close to train rails. (2 trains an hour around 22.00)

name: Gelterswoog camping
description:
Small established campground on the shores of a beautiful lake, great for water sports.This is a small and cosy campground very friendly people, there is a bar at the front also serves great food. 

Open all year but out of season call first. Season from March to October.

name: Free official parking for campervans
description: Parking next to the lake. shady in the morning and evening. No services but quiet on weekdays. Medium source of mosquitos... lake is about 500m away. Toilets and water there, closed at night. Dogs allowed on beach not in water, but you can go a bit around the lake, there are spots for them to go in.

name: Im Blumengarten
description:
The city center, sights and leisure facilities are easily accessible from here. In the immediate vicinity are shops, restaurants, an outdoor pool and the leisure area on the Ikasee. The bus stop "Im Blumengarten" is right on the square. The pitches are available free of charge, registration is not required. For a fee, a power supply for up to 8 campers, as well as a service station for the supply of fresh water and disposal of waste water available. Showers at pool €2..
---
Das Stadtzentrum, Sehenswürdigkeiten und Freizeiteinrichtungen sind von hier aus sehr gut erreichbar. In direkter Nähe befinden sich Einkaufsmöglichkeiten, Gaststätten, ein Freibad und das Freizeitgebiet am Ikasee. Die Bushaltestelle „Im Blumengarten“ befindet sich unmittelbar am Platz. Die Stellplätze sind gebührenfrei nutzbar, eine Anmeldung ist nicht erforderlich. Gegen Gebühr steht eine Stromversorgung für bis zu 8 Wohnmobile, sowie eine Servicestation zur Versorgung mit Frischwasser und zur Entsorgung von Abwasser zur Verfügung.

name: Reisemobilstellplatz Gau-Algesheim
description:
The course consists of 38 pitches marked exclusively for motorhomes.
---
Der Platz besteht aus 38 ausschließlich für Reisemobile markierten Stellplätzen.

name: Stellplatz an der Goldberghalle
description:
RV park on mixed parking
---
Wohnmobilstellplatz auf gemischtem Parkplatz

name: On the Ruhr
description: Carpark on the riverbanks of the Rurh. Coffeeplace will open at 10.00 AM  and from the terrace you have a nice view over the river

name: Beautiful Lake / Lakeview
description: A beautiful Lake with a big parking Space. It is beside a street B275 (Deutsche Alleenstraße), but you can drive behind the lake and park at a field. There are a lot of trees, why nobody is seeing something. Maybe the farmer, but this is very improbable. it is allowed to stay there.

name: Wohnwagenstellplatz Grossbottwar
description: RV-Parking lot with water, electricity and dump station. 5 Euro/night and other service will be charged extra. Good for one night. Next to a sportcenter and big grassy area. Small creek.

name: Döbertstich see
description: This is a place in to the bicycle route "Berlin/Copenhagen" its exactly in the middle of two small lakes. Next to the lake with Great Lake view.

name: Bootsrastplatz Gungolding
description: The parking associated with the boat camp is a nice spot to camp . The parking cost 3€ per night.

name: naturfreunde
description: established camp site in the Priwall side, great for kids and right on the lagoon. 18€ for two adults and one child in a tent.

name: Beach parking
description:
Small but during the day really used parking lot.

Free during 6PM and 7AM.
Price depends on season and is between 2,5€ and 1,5€ per day.

Beach is about 250m away. Public toilets are also 250m near the beach.

name: Campingplatz am Zellersee
description: nice spot good for climbing or swimming. Hiking and bicycle tracks are available. No dogs

name: Lakeside
description: A small camping spot between the „Rhein“ and a Lake. You can stay with up to 2 cars under 8 meters. 50 Meters straight on you can go right on a hidden path to the lake.

name: Paved Turn Out between Tracks
description: Nothing special, just a turn out about 100 m long, good for one night. Many rigs can fit here. We also saw a couple of people come out of the bushes with tents. It’s really close to the Zugspite tram and Lake Eibsee. It’s really hard to find free overnight parking in this area so this was a little gem for us.

name: Baggersee Rohrheim
description:
Several gravel parking spots. If you want shade go on and park underneath the trees.
Be aware that in some parts swimming is prohibited.

name: Frog choir camp (moto only)
description: Only by motorbike accessible. Try to find a entrance from the road and then camp where ever you want. Very secluded. The water is very clean. Getting in the lake is at some places difficult because of the plants and  the ground of the lake (muddy). The campground is sandy and there is a lot of firewood.

name: Waldbrand crinitz
description: Camping area right next to a “forrest” pool area. Kiosk with simple German food (very cheap) and a big pool with natural water. For non-Germans a very bizarre but interesting place.

name: Pirmasens Camping
description: Friendly established campsite with basic restaurant and bar.

name: Ahlhorner Fischteiche
description: Great hikes in natural park. Average 2-10km. Different routes, color coordinated. Perfect for a nice walk with your dog. Free parking spot right at the beginning of the routes.

name: Basis Camp Berlin
description: Garage specialized in old Mercedes vans a.k.a. Düdos. Very experienced and friendly staff and lots of spare parts. Highly recommend if you drive an old Mercedes Van!

name: River confluence camping
description:
Very nice and tidy campground on the confluence of the Nahe river and Alsenz river. New owners, they make that place even nicer.
Small tent (roof tent) 7.- Euros, 1 adult 6.- Euros
Nice area for hiking along the water and with a castle and a ruined castle.

name: Wohnwagenstellplatz Bautzen
description: Free RV-Parking lot with water, electricity and dump station. Good for one night. Next to a big grassy area. There are toilets :-) 10min walk to the old town.

name: Wild camping
description: Behind McDonalds parking close to an abandoned barn you can find different places to set your tent or even your car/van in the grass. There is a big field with wild grass. The McDonalds is open 24/7. There is also a petrostation and KFC close.

name: Camping Bärenschluft
description: Pretty big campsite surrounded bij rocks (which can be used voor climbing). We paid €16 for 2 pers. + car + rooftoptent. Plenty of showers and toilets.

name: layby rest area
description: In peak season when every campsite and car park is full and you just want to stop driving, try here.  Its a bit noisy with traffic till after 2200, but then amazingly quiet for sleep.

name: Oedberg Alm
description:
Not a real campground but more like a nice parking at the Alm with Sommerrodelbahn (summer sledding), Kletterwald and playground. Nice toilets, but no shower. Very expensive: we paid 28€ for a Camper and family of four. 
Electricity, water, dumping of grey water possible.

name: Wittig Camping
description: Parking surrounded by forest on gravel. Picnic benches and tables. Well with potable water. Just beside the road, but quiet during the night. No O2 internet reception.

name: Eichenbloch-Hütte
description: Nice parking spot surrounded by forest, absolutely quiet. Wooden hut for shelter. Starting point for hiking tour to Herrenwieser See. We didn’t visit the restaurant 2,5 km up the road. There is probably another spot at the end of the road (3,2 km). No O2 signal at all.

name: Huzenbach
description: Big gravel parking lot surrounded by forest, level. Very quiet. Access via narrow steep road, probably not for big rigs and heavy rigs with front wheel drive. Kneipp basin near by with benches from where you have a nice view over the valley. There is a trash bin there and you can take water from the afflux. Starting point for hiking tour to the wonderful Huzenbacher See. Poor mobile O2 internet.

name: Skihütte Martinskapelle
description:
Big flat area in the forest, in winter parking spot for the loipe near-by. But in summer nobody, but nobody was there! From here we visited the wonderful Blindensee (5 km one-way). When you walk to the source of the Breg (1,2 km one-way), you cross the European divide. We didn’t try the restaurant Kolmenhof (1 km), but it was well frequented. Very poor O2 reception. Trash bin at the hut. No fires. 
When you come from the direction of Weißenbacher Höhe, road width is limited to 1,80 m!

name: Harbour side carpark
description: free carpark overlooking the city.  Great place if you dont want to visit the town.

name: Lubeck Camping Platz
description: Cobbled area next to canal.  €10 Mon-Sat, Free Sunday.

name: Ohoi camping Kummerow
description: 2 grass areas for camping. one small kiosk with beer and sodas, they also do hotdog with fries. A litle surfer feeling around the whole place

name: Schaliß-Steinort, hiking-parkinglot
description:
This parking space is located directly at the schaalsee at the end of a dirt road, with a great, sandy swimming spot.
There are picknick tables and campfire spots (not sure if legal but people did it). Also it has trashcans. It's not a big spot, two or three campers would have space. 
It's raining today but it would be the perfect sunset view.
Also it's the hiking route parking spot for a trail around the lake.
the schaalsee probably has a lot of great free camp spots and the lake is beautiful clean! totally recommend it!

name: Citti Park Platz
description: Reserved section for motorhomes outside a large shopping mall. Free. Free access to black and grey dump. Water for €1. Toilets in the mall during opening hours only.

name: Shipyard carpark
description: Large level parking lot that is free to access. Just across the road is the entrance to the Alter Elbtunnel for free pedestrian and cyclist access to the city. Quiet over night, some early traffic noise on cobbled road.

name: Parking site - Dummersdorfer Ufer
description:
Do consider that wild camping in Germany in general is forbidden with some few exceptions!

Gravel parking site for as many vehicles you might be. Haven’t seen any amenities around. 1 km down to the sea. Nothing more to say. We asked a local if it was alright to stay over night with RTT’s and a pickup camper. He said that he never seen any control from the authorities during night, so he thought it would be ok. There were five other vehicles than our three.

Good phone reception, but very slow data reception.

name: Barefoot Path and BBQ Area
description: Path for barefoot walking, circa 1 kilometer long and well maintained, with water crossing and some other nice attractions. A place for BBQ as well. All for free. Maybe there is also overnight camping in a RV possible, but we didn‘t try.

name: Campingsplatz am Knoblauchsberg
description: Campsite with swimmingpool near Tecklenburg (10 min). Almost only dutch and german campers and caravans. Fine for one night.

name: hiker Parking lot Naturpark Habichtswald
description: small hiker Parking Space near a Street and a Forest. no Bit rigs, just PKW. muddy after rain. near a small City.

name: Parking Felsenmeer
description: Parking Space die visitors of "felsenmeer" Odenwald. busy during weekends. quiet at nightfall after hikers finished their hike. next to Forest and some local neighbors. Restaurant is mit constantly  Open. mostly  from friday to sunday

name: Hikers Parking Lot Pilzlehrpfad
description: established parking space near a street. Busy during the day, many trashbins and benches. Many trails starting from here. Not sure how many bushes will be there in the future because another street is under construction behind the parking space. busstation and restaurant nearby, it opens on sundays and holidays.

name: Heitzenhofen an der Naab
description: This spot is nothing special. But due to the fact that is almost nearby a road, it is very quiet. Just for an overnight stay it is perfect. As it is a dirt track to go up afew yards, and we have a Jeep Wrangler, the best is to try.

name: Oppach
description: Very nice spot on a field behind the Eko markt, electricity and shower

name: Chiemsee Schraml
description:
Parking lot but with a nice view on lake Chiemsee. You can swimm in the lake. 
For euro 10,- you are allowed to stay with a motorhome between 1800-1000 hours. Incl toilets.

name: Wald-Erlebnis-Parkplatz
description:
A very nice place for the night, or go for hiking or biken.
Close to that place you will find a little lake. You will reach it in 15 min. by fee.

name: Woodland rest area
description: Woodland rest area and parking. Totally shaded. Many places. Small stream running past. Road is close but not busy even in the daytime.  Perfect to camp and walk in the forest. No fires. Weak phone signal. No facilities.  Big rig and pet friendly.

name: Fürstenhagen Free Camp
description: Gravelparking free of charge. View on a little pond and meadow with trees. Nothing special but good for an overnight stop. Quiet. Even the church bells hamering every 30 minutes take a break at night till eight in the morning.

name: Saalfeld Camper Parking Free Camp
description: Gravel Camper van parking surounded by trees and bushes. No ameneties. Free. Follow the signs through the city.

name: Campingplatz Waidmannsruh
description: Basic campsite in a dens forest with squerls, next to a river. Very friendly owners.

name: Hamburg Aussenalster
description: Here you can stand directly at the Aussenalster free of charge with the camper, great atmosphere!

name: Rheinböllen, Wildpark
description:
Near the highway, bit noisy from there. It’s in front of a Wild Zoo. 
Nice place for hiking in the forest.

name: Burgruine Schauerberg
description: Nice hike to old classic german ruins. Worth a tour if you come from Nurnberg. You can park your vehicle in Altschauerberg safely.

name: Schladitzer Lake
description: official free parking spots for the Schladitzer See (lake). Few fisherman at night, jogger and people walking their dogs will greet or ignore you in the morning. it can get busy at sunny days especially on weekends.

name: Löwensteiner Platte
description: Gather place for Motorcycle riders, drinks, snacks and good company.

name: Streitberg Bahnhof
description: Disused railway station in Franconian Switzerland

name: Forest
description: Flat area for one or two big rigs. More quiet than here is not possible. We liked it!

name: Ribbeck Parking Lot
description: Designated parking lot for campers in the small but famous village Ribbeck. Free of charge, no amenities, restaurants close by, playground for children.

name: Reisemobilpark Treviris
description:
Good parking next the river.
11,90 euro for 24 hours, shower, electricity, water and water discharge not including, but with the card, it is possible to use.

name: Campingplatz Ostrauer Muhle
description: Nice site, got all facilities and pretty busy late August. Great location in the beautiful national park where there is lots of walking routes up the valley and direct from the camp site.  Pricy, Eu 36 for 2 adults, 2 kids rooftop and ground tent for one night, but great location for walking is worth it in my humble opinion. Site also charges extra for hot showers and washing machines with the use of a charge card, facilities are good however and don’t mind paying if all works really well.

name: Puttgarden Grüner Brink strand
description: Gravel parking lot close to the beach. No facilities at site.

name: Straußenfarm Mhou
description: An Ostrich farm in Germany ... Very nice and quiet place to stay with some spots even for bigger vehicles. There is a nice lake only 3 minutes walk away. Price per night 8 Euro, electricity 2 Euro extra. Toilets available, but closed, when the restaurant closes. Try the Oyster steak ;)

name: Camping Fautsburg
description: An affordable camping on the bank of the Klein Enz river. I have been told there isn't a price list, but it would cost 10€/person/night. For electricity there is another 4€ to pay. I would recommend this camping for budget oriented bikers. It is not very quiet during the day because it is near a main road, but in the night there isn't much traffic.

name: Camping Waldkraft
description: Idyllic spot at a shepherds place! They only accept 2-3 guests so you have ample room amidst their fruit trees. Clean toilets and hot shower. Further reviews and pictures on Google maps. We paid 5 Euro pp + 5 Euro for our campercar.

name: Zernsdorf Green Garden
description:
If you are passing through our beautiful village Zernsdorf and feel like staying for a few days, you are invited to our home and big garden. We have space to park your car and to camp in our property. 

Please, contact Christopher under following number 0049(0)1701855317 before hand for more details.

Our area has to offer a lot of forests and fresh water lakes around.

name: Lieper See Wild camp
description:
Grassy remote place right next to the the channel (Oder-Havel Kanal) surrounded by trees. 
You can meet a beaver if you're lucky. 
Few locals for fishing around. More crowded on weekends.
North side of Channel. Which does make it legally accessible.

name: Hiking Parking Lot
description:
Gravel parking lot for hikers. Slightly inclined (not 100 percent level). Quiet, free, no services. Short drive from motorway. 

About 500m east there's a water ski lake that has toilets, showers (token/coin operated) and offers paid camping (around EUR 8/night).

name: Black Forest Parking
description: Gravel parking at forest edge with a view over southern black forest. Beautiful spot. Met another overlander with an old fire truck.

name: Wiking Yachthafen Schleswig
description: Parking lots in the yard harbour with electrical hook ups. Very friendly staff. Beautiful views. Shower and toilets are available. Shower 5 mins / 1€. Parking fee for the night 13€ incl. electricity. Chinese Restaurant around the corner. 20 mins walk in the town center along the water.

name: Salomon-Heine-Weg
description: Street with big parking lots for no charge. Good for a trip in to the city. One night should be ok.

name: Parking lot next to Imbergbahn
description: Large free parking lot from the Imbergbahn (cable cars). Public toilets and two restaurants nearby. Busy during the day on weekends, very quiet at night. Great starting point for hiking.

name: Lake Bullensee
description: Huge parking lot next to the lake. A lot of trees and many rows to park in. So no problem to hide the car a little bit. Dixi-toilet at the beach in walk distance (10min).

name: Cafe Großklützhöved
description: Parking area next to the Swing Golf Centre and Café. Parking on grass between the cafe and the owners houses. Very quiet and secluded. Payment in the cafe or if arriving late then the owner will come over. 17€ for the night including electric. Water is free. They have toilets that are open all night but no showers.

name: Camping Speyer
description: We payed 22 for one night (tent plus 2 bikes, 2 persons. There is a supermarket very close. The camping closes at 20:00h in the summer.

name: Public water tap
description: It is a free public water tap near "Kläranlage"

name: Campingplatz Maaraue
description: Very good camping! There is a supermarket and cheap restaurant near the camping. Amazing view from the city. There is a small caffe that where you can buy some goods.

name: Free Parking Lot At The Saar
description: Parking lot next to the river „Saar“. Nice hike up to the view point where you can see the „Saarschleife“. 10Euro/person if you like to go up to the tower. No dogs allowed on the tower! Restaurant next to the parking lot looks good. Not so much trafic because it is a death end road. Pit toilet next to the ferry station. Good for one night.

name: Free Pool Camp
description: Big gravel parking lot under trees next to the pool specal and free for campervans. Service station (fresh water, etc) at the big asphaltet parking accross the creek. Small creek for a lovely walk next to it. Entrance to the pool with high pressure shower is 3.10Euro for 2h. Recommended!

name: Free Camp Winery Zimmermann
description: Big gravel parking lot for campervans. Free. No services. Lovely made with bushes and trees. Belongs to the winery. There is good food and tasty wine in the Restaurant which you have to try. Friendly owner! Recommended!

name: Parking near City
description:
Free parking near City "Stadthalle"
Do not use as a campground ;-)

name: Camping Sonnenstrand
description: Very good camping in front if the river. Beautiful view. There is a restaurant with balcony open to 21:00h. Wi-fi in the restaurant.

name: Parkplatz
description:
Informal camping at a parking. You pay hourly, but cheap.
Walking to the center is about 15 min.

name: Parking lot between two lakes
description: This is the Parking lot for people who want to hike here or want to go for a swim. With us there where 6 other buses and planty space for more. Quite, short walk to the lake and the parking lot is accessible for large campers as well. No facilities, no water but a good spot to spent the night before going to Berlin (or after leaving). Could be very crowded in summer.

name: Altenteil
description: A nice Camping on the Beach 20€ inclusive all outside is a Parking for half her Price.great Place for Jogging and Bikini

name: Simbach am Inn
description: 10 places to overnight. Électricity 1euro for one kWh.

name: Wehnser See
description: A very nice free gravel parking lot.  Very clean lake where you can swim.  Children's playground nearby.  Visited a lot during the summer months during the day.  Quiet at night.  Construction site toilet.

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz
description: RV Park next to Public Pool. Water, electricity, dog friendly.

name: Denk-Haus-Dachau
description:
Art House created by famos Friedensreich Hundertwasser.
In the House is a Bakery snd Cafe, a Butcher where you can have economic Lunch. And a Chocolate Store.
It is worth to walk around the house to take a look from all sides

name: Waldseilpark Karlsruhe
description:
Climbing course with 12 courses. Admission per person: 22 € / 3h

Kletterparcour mit 12 Parcours. Eintritt pro Person: 22€/3h

name: CARTHAGO Campsite
description: In the motorhomes builder of Carthago, a parking area and services for everyone.

name: Klein Enzhof
description: Really nice camping on the bank of the Klein Enz river. It is really big and you can find everything here. Restaurant, sauna, bicycle rent. but everything comes at a cost

name: Felsenmeer
description:
Visitor information and entry for Felsenmeer.
Parking fee for normal cars: 4€.
Public toilets: 0,50€.
There is also a playground for kids.
Not for disabled. Only climbing and hiking.

name: Schollbrunn car park
description: This is a parking spot for hikers, only 5 min from the Autobahn 3, near a village called Schollbrunn. There is plenty of space, we were the only van staying over night. Very quiet during the night, woods all around.

name: Marktbreit/Würzburg
description: Nice Location to sleep aloud directly at the River Main.

name: Vinyard Mangold
description: Nice area at the vinyard. Nice owners. A few places on gravel, a few on grass. Electricity 1€/2kwh. Shower 1€/10 min. RV 5€/night

name: Forest field
description: Open field in the forest, nothing special but good for the night. You can be seen from the path but only one car drove by on a rainy evening. No forbidden entry signs from the main road (no. 6) and easily accessible. Far enough from the road to be very quiet.

name: Old Sheepfold
description:
Very nice wildcamp in front of two old sheepfolds. Lots of space on a grassy field. Tables, benches and trash cans.
Quiet at night, a few trucks at daytime driving to the nearby gravel pit.
Nobody came by. One of my favorites in D.

name: Campingpark Fuhrenkamp
description:
nice and cheap campground with all facilities, good restaurant, sauna and swimming pool.
open all year

name: Engelswies parking Dorf
description: a big parking place in the middle of the village. Free and quiet. Behind the church. nearby Pizzeria Mamma Mia good for food or a lokal beer.

name: Shower and Toilet
description:
There are showers (2€) and a toilet (Free). There are also power outlets for a shaver... Everything is very clean. 
Open daily from 8am to 8 pm. 
Between christmas and new year closed.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Verden
description:
It is not a real campground but a parking lot for RVs with electricity, water and dump station. 6€/24h, +1€/8h electricity, 1€/90l water.
Walking distance to downtown of Verden.

name: Greifswald Harbor
description:
Unpaved free parking right next to the river Ryck. Very quiet at night. No street lights. Used frequently by pedestrians and bicyclists and the occasional car during the day. 
Walking distance to the city center.

name: Wangern beach
description:
Green parking area under the trees just 50m from Wangern beach.

Caveats (see also pictures in German):
- max. vehicle height is 2,6m
- You have to pay for parking from 8:00 - 20:00 (cars: 1,00€/hr up to 5,00€ for a day pass; campers: 2€/hr up to 10€ for a day pass). max. stay: 24hrs
- The last bit of road is a wide dirt road but in very bad shape with many potholes. 

There was even a very clean mobile toilet with toilet paper.
It was very quiet in October. However I get the impression that it is much more frequented during the summer season.

name: Gravel parking
description: A small gravel parking for hikers next to the railroad, ok for a night. Slept well with earplugs, no trains at night.

name: Schaichhof parking place
description:
Pretty quiet parking in the middle of the forest, from where you can go hiking or cycling in the nature park.
A couple of firepits next to the parking. There is some noise from airplanes and cars since it is not far away from the airport and main road. Very good place to spend a night.

name: Alter Postweg Parking place
description: One of the most beautiful overnight place you can have in the landscape of Hegau! outside every town overlooking the lake of Konstanz and you can see the alps.  very quiet. lonely but save as every place in the Hegau.  200 meters far you have facilities for barbecue on open fireplace. so bring enough meet or sausages with you.

name: Raststätte im Hegau
description:
motorway service area. 
parking place with most beautiful view of the Alps. good restaurant with toilet and shower near the parking place.
attention : The access is not possible over the parking lot of the highway No. 81.  take the exit Engen, drive about one kilometer into the city, turn right to the village Bittelbrunn, and follow the signs
Autobahnkappelle.

name: Mayen Viehmarkt
description:
Free big parking lot  next to a supermarket. 
Has a dumping station for the RV.

name: Aldi and Lidl and Edeka
description: You will find the three supermarkets  within a radius of 200 m. open from 08:00 til 09:00 p.m. not open on Sunday

name: Eulenweg Forest Parking
description:
Small dirt parking lot at the end of the road right in the fringe of a forest.
Very quiet except for the occasional train going by on the nearby tracks.

name: Stoffers Hoff
description:
Moderator Note: The information for this place is provided by the owner/manager and had not been verified by iOverlander travellers.

We are overlanders ourselves and welcome travelers from all over the world. While travelling we always enjoy to meet locals and stay on non-established campgrounds. That's why we invite you to stay on our farm!

We can provide a campspot on the farm or on our grasslands. You can use a basic washroom with toilet, hot shower and a washing mashine.
 
Please call or write us in advance: +49 17661424621.

Best, Elisabeth and Sebastian

name: Quiet grassland parking
description: Quiet grassy parking close to a small lake (Immerather maar)

name: Parking Altötting Wöhrstraße
description: Official parking for RV‘s. Close to the old town of Altötting and a small park. Restaurants nearby. Clean toilets next to the parking. Quiet at night. There is no parking fee. If someone needs power you have to pay 1 EUR/4 hours. During winter they don‘t offer water (available spring to fall)

name: Helder&Leeuwen Kaffeeroester
description:
Lovely little Café in the Center of Mannheim. 
Great Coffee and delicious Food. 
They produce their own coffeebeans and makes great service. 
Parksituation for big rigs is a bit complicated, but no problem if you are able to walk some meters.

Open from Monday-Saturday 09:00-18:30 

Highly recommendable!!!

name: Parkinglot right next to Ferry
description: Nice view and quiet. Just a meadow between you an the river.

name: Kreiterhof
description:
very nice campground closed to the kreiterhof restaurant. 

fees for camping please check Website : www.kreiterhof.de

name: Panorama view next to a limewood
description:
Little place, for one camper Van, between grapevine in front the forest.
Great Panorama view above the Rhine valley.
Shade from a beautiful lime wood.
Some dog walkers in the evening and at the morning.
No one cares
The is also a trashcan, and a bench

name: Wohnmobil-Stellplatz (RV-Site)
description: Free communal RV-Site with dump, water and electricity

name: Panoramablick
description: Quiet spot with great view surrounded by meadows with cattle

name: A&O Hostel
description: 10 euros at night for a dorm bed and you can't really beat this price. all the beds have usb chargers. They let me park my motorcycle in secure, underground parking for free as long as I put it in a corner and didn't take up a parking space. otherwise it's 17 a night.

name: Parking lot - entrance boulder area Bahratal
description:
It's a gravel parking lot, big enough for about 6-8 cars. It's a good spot to stay for a night or two.
You will find water in a small river right next to the parking lot.

name: Cemetry Parking
description:
Quiete, directly near the woods. 
Good overnight stop.

name: Parkplatz Felsenmeer
description: Quiet parking lot in front of the information center

name: ENZ - Auto and Machinery Repair
description:
I needed to fix my gear box from our SUV Kia.
Ralf the owner allowed me to use his place and tools to do the job by myself.
He can also work on your car but it will cost you more money.
If you do it alone it's much more cheaper.
I payed €50,00 for 3 hole days using everything we needed.
Ralf and his main mechanic give you free tips about how to solve your problem.
I disassembled 2 times the gear box and clutch before found the problem.
Recomended. Ralf is cool. Here you can fix any part of yous car, van or truck.

name: Parking lot behind the town hall
description:
leveled, paved parking lot, without any facilities
ideal for small to medium sized rigs, no trailers 
walking distance from bakery
"BÄCKEREI KALBACHER "
closed on Monday
Tue - Fri 6 a.m. - 12.30 p.m.
Tue - Fri 3 p.m. - 6 p.m.
Closed on Wednesday
Sat 06:00 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.
Here you get basically everything your heart desires, a small village shop...

for medium siesed rigs possible but

name: Allweglehen
description:
Large comfortable campsite with pool, sauna and restaurant on a hill. Additional camper space at the foot of the hill. 
Everything quite new and comfortable.

name: Battert Parking
description: A nice place to stay if you want to go climbing! Its right between the village and the forest. The streets to it are quite narrow so it's not big rig friendly

name: Parking lot near Ems River
description: A parking lot near the Ems with space for up to 6 RVs. You can pay for power. Just Boondocking is free. There is a sing with information for dumping near by.

name: Stellplatzlauheide
description:
A super calm open lawn with a restaurant a side. 
12,5€ per night per vehicle.

name: Milk Automat / Milchautomat
description:
Milk vending machine a few minutes away from highway. 1€ per liter.

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Milchautomat ein paar Minuten von der Autobahn. 1€/ Liter

name: Bonfire spot
description: It's a quiet camp spot with benches, tables, a soccer field and a fire place. There is a gravel parking lot right in front which would fit big vehicles. It's located close to a small village and surrounded by trees.

name: Secluded Wanderparkplatz
description: Some hikers park here during the day. The nights are really quiet. Good hiking from here.

name: Parkplatz am Sportplatz Bad Peterstal-Griesbach
description:
Wonderful place above the village, with nice outlook.
Very quiet, only when it is a soccer or training it can maybe loud
No water,

name: Ferry Terminal Dagebüll
description:
This is one of three ferry terminals to visit the islands in front the coast of Nordfriesland. You can’t reach every islands from every terminal. Look up the schedule online. You can go with every vehicle. 

https://mobile.faehre.de/de/timetable?setTodaysDate=1

name: Rainbow campground
description: This campground is just a couple of meters from the sea with a beautiful view when you go over the dike. Great place for swimming. Short distance to the Center of Husum with restaurants etc. Prices for the night start at 8€ and increase up to 58€ depending on vehicles, amenities and season.

name: Campground Loof
description:
This is a small campground run by a restaurant. You get a chipcard at the restaurant. Adress: Kleikuhle 7, Husum.
It’s very near to the Center of Husum. 
Price is 12€ for the first night, 10€ for the second.

name: Campground Seeblick
description: Campground in Schobüll with seaview. Near to Husum and Nordstrand. Also caravans for rent.

name: Gutbier Caravans
description:
Shop for camping accessories, caravans, tents, mobilehomes.
Also repairs.
Unfortunately not cheap.

name: Wilhelmsen Automix Mechanics
description:
This shop is working on every brand without exception. There is also a fuel station and a washing machine, also for higher vehicles. They also have a lift for vehicles heavier then 3.5 tons. Good prices and fast, also with ordering parts.
They speak English and German.

name: Camping Amsinkhaus
description: This is a small and simple campground behind the dike. Amenities are in the Tourism center. You can rent bikes or you can walk to the Hamburger Hallig which is beautiful. Over there is a place to go swimming in the sea and a restaurant. Just ask at the tourism center for information.

name: Train Terminal to Sylt
description: This is the Terminal where you can load your vehicle on a train to Sylt. You stay in the vehicle. It takes about an hour. Other option is to take the ferry from Rømø in Denmark.

name: Abandoned Discounter
description: This is the parking of an abandoned discounter. Often some trucks are parked there. Big dirt walls giving some privacy in the corner. The area is safe.

name: Ferry Terminal Schlüttsiel
description: One out of three ferry terminals to the islands in front of the coast of Nordfriesland. You can take them with every vehicle. You can look up the schedule and prices online.

name: Ferry Terminal Strucklahnungshörn
description: One out of three Ferry terminals to the islands in front of the coast of Nordfriesland. You can look up the schedule and prices online.

name: Wild SH Tent
description:
Tent camping on a private property. Please call in the owners before showing up
TEL.: 04881-7797
Toilet and shower available. 
Picknick Tables
River to swim in nearby

name: Wild SH Tent
description: Tent camping on a private property in a forrest. No Amenities. BBQ and Pitfires are forbidden.

name: Wild SH Tent
description:
Tent camping in a Museum park.
Website of the park 
http://www.steinzeitpark-dithmarschen.de/
No Amenities. BBQ and pitfires are forbidden.

name: Wild Camping near river Trave
description: a nice place near river, sometimes canoeists stay overnight

name: Sporthafen Gelting-Mole
description:
Place at the harbour. 15€ (2019) per night incl. Wifi, Shower and Electricity. Playground for Children. Nice to stay one or two nights.
Pay at the habouroffice.

name: Sounds of the forest
description:
Great quiet place next to a gravel road, there is just one house behind.
You'll have shadow the whole day, because of the trees around.
Some steps up the gravel road you have a nice view over the rhine valley.

name: nice field next to a forest
description: grass area next to forest and a street. nice view. uneven on some  places.

name: Campingplatz Dausenau
description: nice campsite right on the Lahn. With a restaurant near by

name: Alte Post Neuses am Sand
description: 2-3 places also suitable for big rigs. If you dine at the Alte Post the place is free. Fresh water, electricity, grey and black water discharge available. Very nice place for a stop over with large beer garden. Food is very good and moderately priced. Conveniently located near the exit Wiesentheit of A3. Comfortable rooms also available. Friendly and English speaking staff. Wifi at the restaurant and beer garden

name: Urfa Kebap Salonu
description:
Delicious Turkish restaurant with reasonable prices. 
Meat from wood coal BBQ. 
Not comparable with the „normal“ Turkish Kebap take away stores, much better!

name: Parking lot for hikers and bycers
description: Quiet spot in the forest next to the lake Holzmaar. Many weekend travelers but we assume very few people during the week. Nevertheless very quiet, especially during the night. Weak O2 mobile internet.

name: Parking lot near castle
description: quiet parking lot just 200m from old town, free at night and clear river in the back and free toilets in the town during daytime.

name: Castell Gate Wildcamp on elbe-biketrail
description:
A nice hidden wild Camp where you can set up your tent for a night. At the side of the Elbe Biketrail you find a stone gate after passing the gate just go straight to your right into the little forest. Birds sing, deer can be seen and the sunset over the river is really worth watching.

Maybe not the most invisible and "safe" site because it's near a small village and not completely hidden. But for me, it was just fine (beginning of spring) in summer it will be more difficult to be spotted.

name: Parkplatz
description:
It is a regular Parking Place with special places for Campers. Big Rigs are possible. Power is available. Also Toilet for 50 Cent.
You have to enter your Credit Card at the Gate and it will open. 15,-€ for 24 hours.
It is 5 min. To walk over the bridge to the cathedral.

name: Windsbornkratersee Parking
description: Very quiet overnight spot in the forest. Starting point for hikers. Mobile internet.

name: Camping Parkplatz Wetter
description: Great place to legally camp with your campervan for free. Some spots have a river view

name: Vogelsang view point
description: Quiet place at the end of a dead-end-road. Very quiet, bench, great view over the Mosel valley. Fast mobile Internet.

name: Am Ruderclub Göttingen
description:
Free parking place also for Big RV‘s
Gravel Place

name: Parking
description:
There is also space for big rigs
The price for 24 hours is 10,-€

name: Parking am Kulturhaus Lich
description: Big gravel place. Parking von RV‘s for free.

name: 52072 Aken, Duitsland
description: next to the Bendplatz very nice parking space also for Bitrix no bother no nothing stealth camping

name: Düsseldorf
description:
Nice plaase to boondonk.
now nossing.







.

name: Dolomitenblick
description: Parking spot in the forest, dead end, very quiet, starting point for hiking tours. Fast mobile internet.

name: Tiny Camping Place
description: Very tiny corner behind of a garden, almost invisible from the road.

name: Dobl
description:
Wild Camping situated on an former farm 
with small animals like chickens, ducks, rabbits, cats, bees and a dog. there is a playground with swings and slides
for a donation of 10 Euro you can use electricity and a nice bath room
it´s possible to get homegrown vegetables and honey

name: Isar Lengries
description:
A nice place at the Isar for 2 small tents.
Near the Isar cycle path. A few young people came in the evening, but it was ok.

name: Donau Straubing
description: A nice place at the Donau cycle path. 2-3 small tents are ok

name: Burg Nord-Ostseekanal at the ferry
description:
Nice free spot for up to 15 (depends on the size) RVs. No facilities. The ferry is for free! A WC is on the other site of the canal. Also a restaurant. The little and nice village Burg has a supermarket (Edeka) and an ice cafe.
Good spot for ship spotting.
4G available

name: Camping Aschenbeck
description:
Nice place to stay for 1 or 2 nights. If you want to be for yourself ask for the campground near by the Fishing lakes. Fishing is allowed but needs to be payed.
Campire is accepted.

name: Ruegen Beach South Side
description: Grass Camp ground next to the beach. At the South East Side of Ruegen.

name: Meißen
description: Parking lot on the river Elbe. There are 3 different parking around, one of them with pay station, the others for free. 10 min to the historical town. Very nice .

name: Wild Camping near Donauquelle
description: Located between the two parking spots. Use the GPS coordinates to arrive at the small path that leads to an open area, accessible only with 4x4. Campfire possible if you are careful.

name: Schiltach
description: Gravel paved free parking along the river. Nice view. Facilities of this small village on walking distance. Water available only in Summer season by a small free gift. Electricity available for max. 3 equipes. Not clear how to pay.

name: Parking near Mediamarkt
description: It’s difficult to find a free place in the Bodensee area. This is one to be mentioned. Large parking in front of Media Markt and other shops. In 5 minutes walk you’ll find a swimmingpool where you can take a shower and a sauna if you wish. Use the toilet in the nearby Burgerking. 20 min. walk to the Friedrichshafen harbour wirh nice view over the Bodensee.

name: Peetzig See
description: Quit nice Place at Peetzig See. Space for rd 10 RV‘s. Unserviced but for free. Have a really nice stay there.

name: Pöhl Reservoir
description: Car park right at the shore of Pöhl Reservoir with pit toilets

name: Decksteiner Weiher
description:
you can park on the side of the street with the park next to you. 
park crowded on sunny (weekend) days

name: street parking next to park
description: there is a park to one side and a bigger street to the other. many RVs stored here. good enough for a few days in Berlin

name: Pirna at the river Elbe
description: Parking lot for normal cars (no Campervans). Beautiful spot. No one cares if you stay over night with a micro or minicamper.

name: Papststein
description: Free parking lot about 300 m from the official parking lot.  You will see parking cars there. Go around the corner for a beautiful spot.

name: Sebnitz / Lichtenhain
description: Parking lot at the periphery of the small village Lichtenhain. Homes nearby but obviously no restrictions. Public Toilet available at day times. Small village shop about 100 m down the road near church.

name: Under an apple tree in the vineyards
description: Small gravel parking lot. Very quite night, maybe different on a weekend. Grassy patches but not very level. Free.

name: Parking à côté d'un cimetière
description: Small parking lot next to a cemetery. very calm. possibility to take water at the cemetery.

name: Parking lot
description:
Gravel spot by the road but pretty quiet at night. Some nice forest in the back.
Picknick tables and garbage bin.

name: Parking Lot
description: Little gravel spot where people sleep in their cars, mostly climbers.

name: nice place behind trees
description:
Great calm place behind trees. No traffic, nearly no noise.
Good to stay for 1-2 nights

name: Big parking-ground close to Burg Regenstein
description: Very big parking ground at the beginning of the hiking path to Burg Regenstein (castle). Castle closes at 6pm and then the cars slowely disappear while more and more campers arrive. We were here and saw about 6 other campers spread across the area. Very quiet at night tho. There is a bathroom available (but currently closed duebto Corona). You need 3x 10 cents for entwring the bathroom. Also bins available.

name: Parking-lot at Hainer See (Lake)
description: It‘s a big parking lot surrounded by bushes and trees with enough space for mobile homes and campervans. We arrived at night and there were 3 others parking there already. It is a 5 minute walk to the very pretty lake. No toilets or bins at the parking lot, but maybe at the lake. If you arrive at night, be careful with animals running across the street to the parking lot.

name: Kapellenberg
description: Between Ebersbach and Kunnersdorf you see a massive wooden bench and a stone quarry  a few meters behind. Road is nearby but not much traffic.

name: Parkplatz
description: We stayed for a night at this spot. You'll have a great sunrise over the city of Freiburg. There are two hiking/parking spaces. The lower one is not used by day trippers at all. Therefore you can Camp here undisturbed and in full silence.

name: Water-Source with BBQ Area
description: At the Street is a parking area. from there 1 min. walk you find the bbq area. cross the river over the bridge. there is the source. you have to use a protable canister. it‘s not possible to park close to the source.

name: Between Grossthiemig and Hirschfeld in the middle of nowhere
description: Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose after entering an unpaved way into the fields. This time it was the jackpot. Absolutely quiet in the middle of nowhere after about one kilometer off the main road.

name: Hostel Guben
description: For everyone and for every budget, the appropriate accommodation can be booked from € 15 per night. Very nice rooms and above all very nice care and reception. This hostel is very clean.

name: Elbe Camp
description: Established campground right next to the river Elbe. Especially the tent area is gorgeous. Prices depend on vehicle and number of people. Really pretty campground.

name: Großer Steeder See
description: Beautiful lakeside camping. Sandy approach.

name: Neustadt City parking
description: Parking spot with big spots suitable for camper vans and a toilet.

name: Rastplatz Klausdorf
description: official parking not far from the Autobahn and a big street, but still pretty quiet

name: Insel-Campingplatz Grietherort
description: Well sign posted camping, there is another camping up the road. But it was full when I asked. Dutch owners. I paid 8 euro. Cash only. Showers 50 cents. That’s for a trekking tent, with my bicycle and no electricity.

name: Murr
description: close to the sports ground an the house for children. very quiet and a good restaurant nearby. free. city center and shops only a few metres

name: Public Parking Lot - Lakeside
description:
Nice big grassy parking lot at the lake. There are toilets, trash cans, and you can go swimming.
The only drawback is the loud road in 200 meters distance.

name: Donarbrunnen
description:
In a little building you can get water from a public healing spring for free. The spring is called 'Thor's Spring'. 
You can fill only bottles. There is no easy way to fill up canisters or tanks.
There is a bench with a table — this is also a very nice place for a rest.

name: Camping Park Murner See
description:
Camping site on a large lake. Restaurant nearby. With minimart, wifi, washer and dryer.
Open 1. April - 31. October

name: Just beside de Maine River
description:
Nice litlle spot ro camp.
fits two small cars.
10 meters of the river. If you are lucky as us, you can have the company of some swans.
Little noisy at day because it's 100meters from the Highway.
But OK place.

name: Camping on The Bergen Belsen Parking Lot
description:
We talked to the security Supervisor of the Bergen-Belsen Memorial and asked if we could stay for the night with our car with rooftent.
He was very nice and allowed us an even showed us all the place. 
Can use bathrooms and cook here.
Perfect and calm place.

name: Dirt Road-Wild Camping
description:
Abandoned little road on left side of L140 north direction. 3 km before Grünendeich.
Just 50 meters from dike.
