Near the Big Energy Towers
No facilities. But quiet at night. You can have a walk to the Elba River in 3 minutes.

name: Parking lot at the "Reisegarten Weserufer"
description:
Huge gravel parking lot at the Weser river and at the 'Alte Weser' lake. Swimming is allowed here in the 'Alte Weser'. There is the 'traveler's garden' (Reisegarten Weserufer) here — something like a Zen garden with a fire place and a shelter. And public garbage cans are here.
You can go Bremen's city center from here by bicycle on a nice 10 km ride.

name: Hornbach Baumarkt
description: Hardware store, source for cheap propane

name: Wynen Gas
description: Specialized dealership for LPG or Propane installations. Tanks, piping, fittings, spare parts, service, repairs, custom solutions. Excellent experts and friendly support.

name: Diepers Freizeit Store
description: Camping dealership with repair shop, Truma dealer. Very friendly staff, helpful and good service attitude.

name: Pendlerparkplatz
description: Nice parking. Good for RVs for a night. Right off the highway. No facilities. Don't go here with tents.

name: ParkPlatz Fehmarn Südstrand
description:
parking spot for the beach with dedicated section for campervans.
10€ per night. actually only one night allowed, but if enough space, no one cares. right next to beach with bathroom and outdoor shower

name: Gorilla Park / DIY Repair Shop
description:
DIY repair shop (mainly for Mercedes Düsseldorfer). 
http://www.gorilla-park.de

name: Dump & Water
description:
Dump station for grey and black water 1€, fresh water for 1€.
Right next to the parking lot for RVs.

name: Hiking/Biking parking lot
description:
Stayed here for two nights, but just for the nights. During the day we went to the river or biking.
The night was quiet but in the morning and in the evening it can get busy.

name: Picnic spot
description: Small parking lot next to a picnic table in the middle of some fields. It’s very calm and has a beautiful view. Some people passed by because there is a small village close by, but they didn’t disturb us.

name: Wohnmobilpark Füssen
description:
The campground is like a parking lot. 
One night is 17.- for two people and one van. Power costs extra and shower is 1.- for 5 min. 
There is also a water and dumping station witch is included.

name: Wohnmobilpark Füssen
description:
Dumping station for 5.-
It‘s inside of the campground.

name: Festplatz in Schwandorf, free
description:
A large place with gravel and grass parts at the river Naab.
With water and dump station. 
Free for one week. 
One week before and one week after Pentecost (Pfingsten) the place is closed.

name: Dump station and water, free
description: Dumping station with water, free.

name: Camper parking Fulda
description: parking for Campervans close to city center. costs 6€ per 24 hours. many others were there in July. Not perfect to spend your entire vacation but a good option for a few days in Fulda

name: nice spot for a tent near the river
description: beautiful and calm place on the Main river, perfect if you are bikepacking, there is a watchtower to see birds 20meters away from here

name: Wild Camping near the Marina on Schweriner
description:
Several places along the lake. In the woods, near the lake, little sand beaches. 
Some spots have a P to delimit a parking area but we used them to sleep also as no signs saying is not allowed. 
Many spots an we picked some of them and had good days here.
Even high season but few people arround.

name: RV and Camper Van Site / Wohnmobilstellplatz Michels Land Stromberg
description:
Convenient parking space, with everything you need. Electricity and supply and disposal on site. Shopping facilities / inexpensive petrol station within walking distance.
Space for 5-10 motorhomes


Zweckmäßiger Stellplatz, mit allem, was man braucht. Strom und Ver-und Entsorgung vor Ort. Einkaufsmöglichkeiten / preiswerte Tankstelle  in fußläufiger Nähe.
Platz für 5-10 Wohnmobile

name: Parking by the river
description: Moin moin! I used iO all through Canada, USA, Mex, Guat etc... And want to repay the favour. I've noticed this spot that is camper friendly. It's in front of a school admin building and often has a few discreet full timers in front. Nice view of the canal, on a cycle path so no traffic, the UBahn is walkable etc. The Uni dining hall, about 200m away, does cheap good meals, and if you happen to meet an odd Australian bloke he may just let you use his shower ;)

name: Action einkaufsmarkt
description:
Shop cheap, branded goods cheap

preiswert shoppen, markenartikel günstig

name: Ulmer paddler club
description:
Nice spot at the Donau. Perfect. Between Ulm and Neu Ulm
ADMIN NOTE: could the next user please check and enter details of any rules for camping and/or overnight parking at this club car park.

name: Am Europakanal street parking
description: street parking next to danube. not too busy and some green. many other motorhomes. 10 minutes walking into city center/ old town

name: Chapel
description: Parking lot near a small chapel. On weekends used by visitors of the lakes nearby. Empty and quiet at night time. Restaurant nearby.

name: Magic triangle
description: 2 rivers crossing into one...Come check it out

name: Campingplatz Wassermühlenholz
description: Cute little campsite at the edge of forest within short walking distance of Kappeln, very clean and frequently cleaned bathrooms, quiet with many birds singing, very friendly caretakers and great value for money at 3€ per person + 7€ for campervan

name: Lech Channel
description: Using a car navigation system you may look for Lechwerksiedlung. Just about 80 meters from the main road we found this beautiful spot at a channel beside the river Lech. Wonderful beaver spotting in the evening, quiet at night.

name: Gerolstein  at the station
description:
nothing more than a parking space.
at Sunday it's very quiet and free parking

name: Timmendorf Beach 100 m
description: You can stay here for (officially max.) 1 night for 10 Euros. A lot of caravans, but it's difficult to find legal places in this area, police make some controls. Beach is only 100 m away.

name: Riverside
description: Quiet place on the river with a large grassy area, with even a small stream at the back, ideal to freshen up. Accessible by bicycle or on foot.

name: Flensburg Parking
description:
Free. Alongside the water. Not far to town centre. No facilities.

gratuit, le long de l'eau, 1/4 à pied du centre ville. Pas de commodités.

name: Wildspot at the lake
description:
Nice and quiet camping spot on the lake.  Barely visible from the road.  Many deer, hares, foxes and cranes!  A number of residents came by but no one bothered us.
Two rigs fit in the "parking lot". Tent campers have room for choosing next to the lake.

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz Wipperfürth
description: Simple, central place in the small, historical town Wipperfürth for free. Directly at the river Wipper (will later becomes the Wupper) with electricity (1€ = 1,5 kWh), water (1€ = 60 L) and sewage. Here in the "Bergisches Land" there are many hiking and cycling paths between fields, lakes and forests. The area is rather unknown to international tourists but very nice and green.

name: parking at river
description:
there is a parking next to a river that fits about 20 cars or campervans. seems to be accepted. police stopped by one evening, but didn't say anything.
no facilities and please take home your trash. supermarkets close by

name: Kaltenbronn Parking "A"
description:
Nice spot with scenic view over the Rhine Valley. Maybe a little close to the road (but will get quiet at night). Nice hiking trails nearby for example to the "Wildsee" or the "Grünhütte".
Note: Road is currently closed as of 07/24/20 due to construction.

name: Bispingen
description:
Very quiet behind townhall

P Rathhaus
achter gemeentehuis zeer rustig

name: Zerrentin - overnighting at lakeside
description: It's just a parking spot for the beach of Zarrentin, but there is a sign, that overnighting with campervans etc. is allowed, you pay 5 EUR for 24 hours. The access to the beach is for free and there are toilets at the parking spot for 50 cents. There is water available but you need tools to open it. There are hiking trails around the lake. Beautiful place and not too busy, even though it's high season AND corona.

name: Parking Hülsenstrasse/Hagenstrasse
description: Campings are unbelievably expensive during high season (30 € and up), so we decided to come here. Overnighting costs 5 €. You're only allowed to stay for ond night. It's just a parking spot, but in a quiet neighbourhood, very few cars. There was a construction site when we where there, so we used the temporary toilet box. Suitable for one night.

name: On a hill east of Talsperre Malter
description: Quiet little lot at a corn field right of the street between Malter and Dippoldiswalde. Nice view.

name: Café Vorhoelzer Forum
description: Student Café on top of the university with a magnificent view over Munich. Enjoy a coffe, beer or spritz. Use one of the elevators to get to level six.

name: Very nice place in a forest between farmers land
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Unclear if vehicle access is possible!!

Very nice place in a forest between farmers land. Well hidden. you can watch deer chasing each other. Access is from the road to a farm road and then cross the field and go into the small forest. you hear the highway and some hunter shots from only the forest behind it. A lot of storks flying around.

name: Campersite Munster
description:
Campersite on the parking of a sports complex.

Use of toilets and showers for free in the sports complex during opening hours.(at least 8 am - 12 am)

name: Waldparkplatz Markersbach
description: Large gravel parking lot in the woods at the S171 between Raum and Buchenhain. Very quiet. Start of hiking trails into the Nationalpark Sächsische Schweiz. Ticket for overnight parking is EUR 6 for a campervan and EUR 3 for a car.

name: Sternenpark Beobachtungsplatz
description: They say it's one of the darkest places in Germany, so it's used for observing the stars. The town is tiny and super quiet. You park on the lawn and there is a bathroom with toilets only. Very fast wifi, there's also a small playground. 8 € per car/night. There's a river and a biosphere park (lots of birds) nearby. When you arrive you have to call the owner who will come to check you in.

name: Stellplatz Spreewald
description: It's a big area designated for motorhomes. It's actually only a parking area but the spot is very nice, some grass, a lot of trees. There are public toilets a few hundred meters away (0.5 €). The Spree river is only a few walking minutes, as well as the boat ports to do a boat tour on the river. Very quiet and peaceful, day and night. And the best - it's for free!!

name: Külbe 99
description:
This is a roadside restaurant that offers it's spacious parking lot to truckers and travelers to spend the night.

Fries are great and it’s surprisingly quite alongside the B55

name: Quiet forest road
description: Turn off the tarmac road into a gravel road and about 500m in there's a t junction where you can park off the road in a grassy area. Will only fit vans.

name: Rosenlaube am Campingplatz
description:
Nice little camp site in Schiltach located along the stream.

Spacious plots for tents, caravans and campers. Not suitable for big rigs.

name: Camping Berger
description: Ordinary Campsite. Nice feature: you look out over the Rhine river (if you get a spot there). Many long term caravans, some open spots for tents or small campers. I was here in later September, it was very quiet but I can imagine it is crazy bussy in summer. Last place outside the cities limits for older cars without the right green stickers! Good place to cycle to city - 40 minutes. They rent out bikes. The fence is closed between 22 and 8 at this time of year. Nice showers, a covered cooking place, washing machines, some food can be bought here. 1 person + small camper costs €17,50 per night.

name: Raststätte Lipperland-Süd
description: An spacious Raststätte on the A2. Good for a sleeping pause while on the road. Behind the Aral gas station lies a restaurant, behind the restaurant are spaces for smaller vehicles and small trucks. WC (€0,70), food, drinks at shop. Was very quiet at night. The road is far away enough to sleep easily, and you do not hear the truck ai rconditioners or cooling units.

name: Grassy field
description: This place looks like a park but you can easily enter with your car, trailer or RV. Be careful of some pot holes but nothing too serious. There’s plenty of space and many other campers staying overnight. Some road noise but there are some spots further away from the road near some trees. On the opposite of the road is a shopping mall which has pay toilets during opening hours. Overall not a bad spot near city Center.

name: camping place am Bühl
description:
Very nice and quiet camping spot. A little outside of Kassel. Very relaxed.
Price list in the pictures.
9€, one person, one small tent, one motorbike.

name: Restlich 125
description: Beautiful old quarry hole full of clean water. Accessible with small RTW (<30feet)  via the main road. Just cross the train tracks and drive another 800m to turn left.

name: Eastener Hostel
description: Nice hostel with all you need. 13€ per night. You can put your bike next to the house. It was standing there the whole weekend. No problem.

name: Triangel Camping Niederfinow
description: Lovely, alternative Campsite with many tents, cyclists, walkers. A few places for Vehicles up to 7m. Price good, people great, little caffee, community kitchen and community fireplace. Very relaxed. You can rent a Kanu to explore the river. Bring cash (no cash machine close by).

name: KNAUS Campingpark
description:
Big camp site along the river Mosel. Loads of space. Also nice shady spots under big trees but not on the whole camp site.

Reception closes at 6pm so be on time.

name: Oppurg
description:
Official free overnight spot.

Six spots.

Clean and quiet.

Power (50kwh/50cent) /water (50l/50cent)available

name: Freibad Bischheim
description:
Very good if you like silence and swimming.
Good for tent, camper, caravan.
Cold and warm water, electricity, shower, toilet.
Great swimmingpool, also for little children.
Very nice and helpfull lifegard, Silvio.
Enjoy, but keep this place as it is.
Little cafetaria, Mamma Wok, for drinks, icecream, and drinks.

name: Densborner Wassermühle
description: Simple, small campground, basic facilities. With a (very) small lake that runs the watermill. At the small cascade of the lake, are also a few camping spots.

name: Private Campingspot in the Garden for Tents, near Harz-Montains
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified. 

Camping spot in our private Garden. 

We have a toilet, shower, Wlan, power and a nice garden for camping.
You can use our terrace. 

Booking about:  www.campspace.com.

name: Tirschenreuth
description:
Official free campspot next to a little lake.

Free parking day and night. No maximum to stay overnight. 

Shopping in town, nice walk. 

Good spot for dog walking!

name: Wanderparkplatz Meissner, Naturfreundehaus
description: Beautiful parking place in the forest with a wonderful view to the landscape. Hiking trails into the nature reserve start here and a restaurant is nearby lokated. Good connection for mobile phones.

name: Parkplatz Zur Warnow
description:
nice secluded parking lot with a view of the Warnow also a good place for the night.

schöner abgelegener Parkplatz mit Blick auf die Warnow.
auch ein gutes Plätzen für die Nacht

name: Campingplatz Kloster an der Saale
description: Beautiful place at the river Saale. Nice campground with all the amenities: toilet, shower, washing basin, washing machine - some things have extra cost, but not too expensive. Camping for everyone - tents, motorhomes, everyone on lawn. If you are lucky you'll stay just at the water. We paid 19 € for 1 night, 2 adults in a van, no electricity. Please note: check-in at 3 p.m., make sure to be early during summer time.

name: Campingplatz Grönwohld
description: Established campground directly behind the dunes. Family friendly, place for tents, cars, vans, caravans. they also rent water sport equipment.

name: Ostsee Camp Glücksburg-Holnis
description: 28 euro for camping. Nice and clean place. Gas cooking possible. However you have no mobile connection here. The Wifi of the camping ground is not working at all. You are completely offline here

name: Bilz-Camping Radebeul
description:
The Bilz-Camping offers space for 40 tents and 20 motorhomes directly in the Radebeul outdoor pool. There are sufficient sanitary facilities with toilets and showers. The pitches can be connected to electricity or water. The outdoor pool and the city of Radebeul offer many leisure activities and are only a few kilometers away from the Saxon state capital Dresden.

MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

name: Blunoer Südsee
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Needs to be confirmed if OK

Big parking lot. only stayed here during the day but it looks like a good spot to spent the night. the nearby artificial lakes are actually not open yet.

name: Stellplatz "Kowitzberg"
description: Not sure about the name. Large RV parking close to the northern side beach area. Payment at the machine, €12,50 for 24 hours in main season. Low season cheaper. Self contained vehicles only. Very good location, quiet, room for more than 50 RVs.

name: Parking near trails
description:
Large parking area next to forest and field. Lots of shade! 
A lot of day traffic with hikers. 
Quiet at night.

name: Inn/Farm
description: Gravel parking area next to an Inn / farm. 10€ per night with a clean toilet and shower (2.50€). Ask for the key at registration. There are horses and goats on the property.  The Inn serves breakfast and drinks. Lovely location.

name: Quite parking lot next to the forest
description:
Quite parking during the night, a bit of traffic during morning hours. 
Right at a trailhead and the best: there is a brewery across the road. Lots of animals around. Free. Small creek behind the parking.

name: Quiet Parking
description:
Nothing really special, but best what I found in this area. 
Big, dusty parking, empty during night. 3m walk to lake with few swimming places. 

Except me few others vans were sleeping here.

name: Camper parking next to swimming pool
description: This is an official camper overnight parking. pretty views, calm, swimming pool right next to it

name: Autohof Wörnitz
description: RV parking lot next to gas station close to autobahn A7.

name: Official overnight parking
description: There is a quiet parking lot with two official campervan spots for 24 hours.

name: Parkplatz Buchelberg
description: very nice place. some hikers are doing some walking in the woods but no problem. away from the road and almost in nature;)

name: Schattiger Stellplatz zwischen Gehnwald und Alfsee
description:
Moderator Note: The information for this Place has been submitted by the Owner/Manager. The information has not been verified by an Overlander.

Our parking lot is outside the fence on our private land. The small country road on which it lies is hardly used except during the maize harvest. We offer you electricity via a cable drum and water from a hose. During the bright hours of the day you can use an externally accessible toilet with sink in the house. However, you should like dogs as our 3 welcome every visitor very exuberantly. For the 1st adult we charge 10€, from the 2nd 5€ cost participation per night, children under 14 are welcome free of charge.

Unser Parkplatz ist außerhalb des Zaunes auf unserem Privatgrund. Die kleine Landstraße an der er liegt ist außer während der Maisernte kaum befahren. Wir bieten euch Strom über eine Kabeltrommel und Wasser aus einem Schlauch an. Während der hellen Tagesstunden könnt ihr ein von außen zugängliches WC mit Waschbecken im Haus nutzen. Dabei solltet ihr allerdings Hunde mögen da unsere 3 jeden Besucher sehr überschwänglich Begrüßen. Für die 1. erwachsene Person erheben wir 10€, ab der 2. 5€ Unkostenbeteiligung pro Nacht, Kinder unter 14 sind kostenlos willkommen.

name: Campingplatz Werratal Heringen
description:
Nice place near the local swimming pool.
Quiet. Bike friendly.

name: Wurler See Familliencamping
description: Nice camping site on a lake within a forest.

name: Campingplatz gebuhrenordnung
description: Established campground beside the A5 highway, you hear the road but fine for the night.

name: Englischer garten
description: Beautiful and quiet place to sleep for one night.

name: Next to Donaubad Ulm
description: newly established campground for RVs next to the public recreational city bath of Ulm. Power is 50c/kWh. Fee 24h ist 10eur, NO credit cards accepted at the billing machine!

name: Stellplatz Ilsenburg Nationalpark
description: this is an official campground at the Nationalpark. it's 10€ plus 5€ tourism tax for 2 people. quiet and nice

name: Halberstadt Stellplatz
description: there is an official campervan Stellplatz in town. free

name: Alter Jugendzeltplatz
description: A night with a small tent is possible here!

name: Fahrzeugtechnik Schuh
description: A very experienced and friendly car mechanic!

name: Parking lot with dump station/water/electricity
description: It is a parking lot with dumping station, fresh water and electricity (costs 1 or 2€). There is space for 8 vehicles, even for bigger ones! It is next to an industry area, so it is not very romantic but useful and the parking itself is for free.

name: Landmetzgerei Fastner
description: Simple but great restaurant attached to a butcher. Daily menu really delicious and affordable! Really friendly service. Absolut recommendation.

name: Wohnmobil Camping
description:
this is a new little campground. 
14€ per car, but everything costs extra (toilet, shower, tourist tax, electricity, water, etc)
good location and overnight option as the parking lots also cost 11€ for campervans and don't allow overnight camping

name: Campingplatz Hubertsberg
description:
Owned by a friendly relaxed old guy named and his wife, this little place is directly located at the water. Its a little spot for permanent caravans, but there is two meadows where you can stay overnight with yor campervan.
There is toilet with running water, showers, and some place where you can clean your dishes.
Nice sunset and sunrise!

Note that they might be closed for permanent camping during winter time, but they guys suggest to just give a call. If the weather conditions are good you even can go off season.

name: Waschsalon Bismarckring
description: This is a real Location But i try first time.

name: Hattsteinweiher
description: Small lake just outside of Usingen.  Swimming in the summer.  Large field for campers and tents.  Restaurant with toilet.

name: Car park at boat pier
description:
It’s not a real campground but a car park at the lake and pier. You can not put a tent but say one night in a camper van is tolerated. 
Lots of locals hanging out and cyclists. 
There’s a little cafe with boat rent. If using their washrooms it would be very kind to leave them a tip or buy something;) 

Enjoy and respect the spot :)

name: Parking lot by the highway
description: Nice if you have had a long drive and just wanna sleep one night close by the highway. Hidden by the woods and not too noisy.

name: Kamp Lintfort
description:
A parking lot next to the swimming pool and City center and park and children playground. 
Also a big fenced park for dogs. 
Free of charge.

name: www.stellplatz-scheinfeld.de
description: Motorhome area created by the manufacturer of large Motorhomes : Concorde

name: Parking Ground Witch Dance Plateau
description: Place aside from the parking lot between trees. It is not leveled, standing horizontal may become a problem, in the evening calm

name: Dump station
description:
3€ for filling up drinking water 
6€ for both dumping and fresh water 
Ask at the reception of the camp ground, very friendly staff

name: Campground
description: Big caravan park with pretty much everything you could wish. Campground, caravan parking, restaurant, cafe, laundry, water...

name: Rossbühl lower end of ski lift
description: Close to B500 Black Forest ridge 910m above sealevel

name: Oy Farm
description: Farm where you can spend the night (or more) on a meadow. It costs €10/vehicle.  Very quiet with a beautiful view.  A restaurant is nearby. You should call the owner before: +49 176 8155295

name: Bachheim Drei Schluchten Halle Parking
description:
A really beautiful overnight parking  (paved but better on the meadow)

Very quiet at night. Busy at daytimes because you can make beautiful hikes. 

FREE parking and FREE  overnight 
free toilets and water (drinkable )

A nice kiosk where you can get something to drink and small things to eat. only Wednesday to Sunday 01:00 - 08:00 p.m. you can sit outside in the Biergarten.

name: Near the Church
description: Nice view at the village. Close to the road, but no noise.

name: Tungeln
description: Quiet spot for a camper on a tree lined dead end road between the fields. Some people walking or on bikes, all very friendly. No amenities

name: Forest Field by the lake
description: Field of a Farmer by the lake, the dirtroad is narrow but for small cars or vans no problem. We put our Tent in the evening for one night.

name: Lakeside
description: Beautiful spot directly at the water. A lot of mosquitos but totally worth it!

name: Warwer Sand
description: Parkingspot for people, who wants to go for a walk through the forest. In the evening enough space for few camping cars on the gravel.

name: Donaueschingen Am Schlosspark
description:
official parking for motorhomes FREE.
very quiet in the park close to the young Donau. space for about 15 motorhomes. you can cycle along the Donau. About 20 minutes to the town centre by walking.

name: River zschopau
description:
Nice, hidden, quiet meadow with trees and quite clear water.
That was our last camp spot before our home Dresden, after our 5 years around the world journey, beginning in Dresden.
See you overlanders!

name: Offroad Camping Quaduxenbarg
description: The "Quaduxenbarg" is an old National People's Army (GDR) area. It is home for ground clearance camper, van's and offroader. It is a nice green campingsite close to Wismar and the Baltic See. There are quite nice sanitary facilities and it is possible to enjoy bonfire and do some outdoorcooking. You reach the place over a small privat road after crossing the village Rüggow.

name: Parking for one night
description: Next to the service road of the wind power station. The service road is a dead end. Due to that you can expect very less traffic.

name: Mosbach
description:
Official campersite, free. 
No amenities. Close to the Waldbad, great starting point for hikes and Mountain Bike trips. Between the meadows, lots of cows. Great spot. On the downside: poor mobile internet

name: Place at the Werra river behind the public swimming pool
description:
A quiet place where you can put your canoe into the water. 
It is located down a dirt road by the public swimming pool. There is a big meadow to park on. A bigger street and a train track go by about 300m away.  Not completely quiet but also not very loud. There were no other people when we visited.

name: Free Day Parking
description: Sports Hall Free Car Parking. Day only. No height restrictions. Seems safe. 15mins cycle to centre.

name: Stellplatz Schleich
description: Directly opposite the Mosel, a six-vehicle grassy parking place costing €5.  Electricity at extra cost

name: Wild camping with a view, track from road that leads down to the mosel
description: A small downhill track. Not suitable for large rigs. Go to the end to find a small area for one vehicle next to a hunting seat. Nice view. Tight turning to return so not suitable for anything longer than 5.5m. Small vans only.

name: Camp24 Saalfeld
description: Private campground located directly at the Saale. 10€ per Person per night. Very nice owner. Comes by when you call. It was allowed to make a campfire it you have a fire bowl. We collected dead wood around the campspace. Nice and clean amenities. There was a fair directly behind us, but it closed at 22 o'clock.

name: Buchen Stumpen
description: Parking lot. Good, very calm and safe overnight lot. Very lonely. nothing around. but good for hiking.

name: Hiking parking space
description: Next to a very calm and small street. Even, surrounded by trees.

name: Forest car park
description: Just off the road which is quiet overnight is a small forest car park for two vans.

name: Naturbad Aachtal
description:
Official parking lots for motorhomes.
Behind the natural swimming pool of Worblingen.
day fee 8,00 Euro, 3 days 22,00 Euro incl. dump.
electricity for 6 parking lots.

very very quiet after the swimming pool have closed. 
biking round the peninsula Höri one of the best at Lake Constanz. about 40 km.
good restaurants nearby hiking distance 
also good for hiking Schiener Berg
only 4 km to Switzerland and good chocolates

name: On the Danube
description: For small vans only. Refuge in nature by the Danube. From Buckheim take the small lane, Donautalstraße to the Danube. There is parking for two at the end of the lane (often used by fishermen). Turn left to cross a small bridge and continue to a Refuge area with space for one, a firepit, barbecue, bins and benches. The lane is a busy cyclepath so suggest arrive late and leave early.

name: Watterdingen Biber sportshall
description: Very quiet place close to the sports ground. Enough space for some motorhomes. Good start for hiking the Alte Post Weg with view up to the Alps.

name: Gravel parking lot
description:
It’s a good spot to stay overnight, no camping ban signs. But you shouldn’t stay longer. 
There’s some nice little trails around the river with power station and in the woods. 

Keep it clean, please!

name: Gravel parking
description:
Gravel parking lot by the road and river with no signs saying no overnight parking. 

But please be respectful. Don’t put chairs and tables out and don’t stay too long and of course don’t leave garbage and toilet paper. Bring a shovel if you need to....
;)

name: Parking lot in the forest
description: It's a nice and quiet sleeping spot. You will have a picnic table and a restaurant 5 min away (Schützenhaus Maikammer). Really quiet at night at daytime a little bit traffic from the road and some hikers around. In 20 min walking distance you will find a 24h wine vending machine in the town of St. Martin at the winery "Gilda Moll". There is as well an natural water source 5 min walking or 1 minute driving.

name: Washpoint Gap
description: Fantastic little laundrette with very helpful owner who will do the washing, drying and folding for you for free. No annoying waiting. Brilliant service. Eco friendly products. Highly recommended. 15kg €8.50 7kg €5.10, prices as of today. There's a great cafe next door too, Cafe Berge.

name: Car park for small vans
description: Car park next to police station. Out of season, we stayed overnight with no issues.

name: Camping Schwarzwald
description:
This hidden site is a gem for Visitors who look for a quiet stop to stay overnight.
Attention: only for self contained Motorhomes with water/toilet on Board. No Tent Camping!

What you get: Amazing View in the Valley. Sunshine till evening. Very friendly Hosts, do anything that you feel comfortable.

Electricity and good Wifi at your spot is included. Also an amazing big "adventure playground' for older Kids...

We stayed two lovely days with our MB 814 Truck.

Please notice,  there are only two, maximum three Places for Motorhomes ...they shouldn't exceed the length of 7m..

Attention: please send an email to the Hosts before travelling to them to checkup that a space is free.

Email is : camping.schwarzwald@gmail.com
and here the Website for even more Information:
https://camping-schwarzwald.simdif.com/

You will get a warm welcome!!

At the Moment you pay 10.- for the hole Motorhome with all People...for one night.

Please respect the quietness of the Place.

name: Galopprennbahn Wambel
description:
A huge parking lot close to the race course. Lots of trees with a lot of shade. Two minutes walking distance you can find a EDEKA and Pizzeria.

Free of charge

name: Brauerei Berg
description:
Three official places close to the famous brewery. Quiet after the brewery closed. 

Very good restaurant with beer garden. also a few hundred meters away fine dining restaurant Rose.

name: Hüfingen Wohnmobil Stellplatz
description:
Very quiet official place for motorhomes. 30 sites all with electricity some on grass or stones.
Toilets and a small kiosk. The the river Breg. 

7,00 Euro motorhome p.day. + 1,50 Euro tourist tax (children 0,50) 

 All big supermarkets two kilometres at the other end of town. 

Good restaurants inside the town. 

Good for hiking and biking.

name: Mundelfingen Aubachhalle
description: Parking close to the sports ground and kids play ground. very quiet and a beautiful place. You can hike, bike and the child can play. For free.

name: Wanderparkplatz am Jägersteig
description:
Nice parking area right next to the woods. There's a Street right next to it but the area is shielded by dense vegetation.
.....
Schöner Wanderparklatz direkt am Wald.
Er befindet sich nahe einer Straße zu dieser ist er jedoch durch eine dichte Hecke abgegrenzt.

name: Rothseeparplatz
description:
Even though the parking lot at the Rothsee is located right at the edge of Zusmarshausen, it's still relatively quiet at night. Around 150m away from it, at the Rothsee, there is are Toilets and in the summer you can use the showers.
.....
Der Parkplatz am Rothsee liegt direkt am Rand von Zusmarshausen, ist Nachts jedoch relativ ruhig.
Er ist etwa 150m vom Rothsee entfernt, wo es Toiletten und im Sommer auch Duschen gibt.

name: Lambach
description: On Chiemsee, large pitches, electric, hot showers (pay .5 euro, only need one), restaurant on site. Cost 1 person w/ electric, 21 euro. View of alps, swimming, just lovely.

name: Emmingen - Wittoh Parking
description:
Parking 862 meter above sea level. Free. 
space for about 3 motorhomes. gorgeous view. from Zugspitze till Eiger-Jungfrau-Mönch. shopping in Emmingen or Tuttlingen. 
very good for hiking or mountain biking

name: Pfeifferbrunn
description:
Moderator Note: It is not certain that the water is potable.

A place to Collect water from the ground

name: Schanzenbrunn
description:
Moderator Note: It would be helpful if the next User could provide a photo and confirm that the water is potable.

Water for drinking

name: Vogelsang
description: Water for drinking at Vogelsang in the forest.

name: Menzenschwand
description: Great parking lot. Leveled. Nice surroundings and in winter time a good ski area. Normally you have to pay 9€/night.

name: Wietstocker Weitblick
description:
Naturally quiet parking space on the outskirts of the village Enclosed guarded .V. & E. Plenty of space for, informal, away from tourist actionism.
--
Natürlich ruhiger Stellplatz Dorfrandlage Eingefriedet Bewacht .V.& E. reichlich Platz für , zwanglos, abseits des touristischen Aktionismus.

name: Wietstocker Weitblick
description:
Natural and quite campground location at the outskirts of a village. Fenced and guarded. Plenty of room, easy going. Off the beaten track. 
Open: 1.4-15.10. 

DEUTSCH 
Natürlich ruhiger Stellplatz Dorfrandlage Eingefriedet Bewacht .V.& E. reichlich Platz für Globetrotter , zwanglos.Abseits des touristischen Aktionismus. Open.1.4.--15.10.jeden Jahres.

name: Böttingen parking place
description:
large parking a little bit above the village. Even though that is close to the road it is very quiet. FREE.
From here you can find a lot of hiking trails. For example 14 km Roundtrip Naturpark Obere Donau. This hike is highly recommended and very varied. see photos.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Aquatoll
description: Site offers 50+ parking lots under shady trees. There are restrooms and a dump station too. Parking and overnight camping is allowed for max 24h. No tent sites!

name: Bingstraße
description: parking spot, big vehicals can easily park across two spots, rather full in summer because of the zoo nearby, when not during semester break (break normally from february to april and from august to oktober) you can ask the (normally) friendly and open-minded art students for using the akademie's showers

name: Finn‘s 78 Motors
description: Car workshop specializing in VW buses (T1, T2, T3/T25/Vanagon, T4/Eurovan, T5, T6). Other manufactures are also welcome.

name: Grillplatz Blaubronn
description: Nice quiet place with a fire pit, a small hut and benches. It's level and I did not pass any restricting signs besides one for heavy trucks. Easy access, fresh water available. I wasn't able to adjust the rating, is give it a full 5

name: Windeck Leuscheid
description:
Private Parking one or two campers. Fresh water available and wifi soon. Check with owners before visit. Restaurants in walking distance. Tent ok too. Basic. Railway 5 minutes by Car to Cologne. 
Mail@davidlamb.de

name: Falkenhof Bad Muskau
description:
old private farm, in a quite area outside from Bad Muskau
water and electricity can be provided
space for tents and big rigs 
owners himself are world travellers
(google: elmos odyssee)

name: Mahlspueren im Tal
description:
Informal Campsite. Located in a small village beside a little river.
Very quiet. No service (no energy, no trash, no toilet).
Small shop/bakery across the street.
Cell phone signal availability.
Park fee 5 € per night.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Dillenburg
description: Nice and free parking/camping spot close to the city centre of Dillenburg.

name: Parkplatz Zu Maria Eich
description:
Parking at a pilgrimage church. Junction A96 Germering South not far away. S-Bahn stop Planegg only about 200m away. At night very quiet, occasionally you can hear a car driving across the nearby road. If you just want to stay overnight, you are well served here.
.....
Parkplatz an einer Wallfahrtskirche. Anschlussstelle A96 Germering Süd nicht weit entfernt. S-Bahn-Haltestelle Planegg nur ca. 200m entfernt. Nachts sehr ruhig, gelegentlich hört man ein Auto über die nahegelegenen Straße fahren. Wer nur übernachten möchte, ist hier gut bedient.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz an der Isar
description:
Motorhome parking lot Bad Tölz. directly on the Isar promenade.
.....
Wohnmobilstellplatz Bad Tölz direkt an der Isarpromenade

name: Kempten Reisemobilstellplatz
description:
Located only 100m next to the river Iller and a pedestrian bridge over it, it offers space for almost 10 Reimos. Dog waste bags are available free of charge. 5 € / 24h. Disposal station available. Very quiet at night. 

Nur 100m neben dem Fluss Iller und einer darüberführender Fussgängerbrücke liegend, bietet er Platz für knapp 10 Reimos. Kostenlos sind Hundekotbeutel verfügbar.
5€/24h
Entsorgungsstation vorhanden. Nachts sehr ruhig.


Just 5€/night. There will be space for 10 RVs and there is a dump station also. At night very quite.

name: Rosenheim Stadion
description: Close to the river Mangfall beside a smal stadium. Quiet neighbarhood. Leveled.

name: Stop over at B 13
description:
Just an overnight spot close to B13. A little bit invisible in the forrest and not to noisy.
It was a save place during the Corona restrictions & lockdown

name: Burgruine Hohenstein
description: Parking spot for hikers at the edge of the woods, right below the remains of Hohenstein castle. Quiet and idyllic. Zero facilities, but there is a very nice public bbq spot in the inner ward of the castle.

name: Kreiterhof
description:
very nice place closed to the kreiterhof restaurant 

fees for camping please check Website : www.kreiterhof.de

name: Steißlinger See Mountain
description:
Official Parking place with chairs and table, plus fire place. No 'Camping forbidden' sign. Good place for one night.
Unfortunately millions of mosquitos in the late afternoon!!!

name: Nassau, Water and Sanitation dump
description: At a parking lot, near Lahn river. Few places for RVs. Dumping possible, fresh water, public toilet. No electricity.

name: 24\7 parking at a small street
description: There are not many 24\7 parking places in this area. Silent at night. No amenities. For a few small cars. Leave no traces to keep this opportunity open. A beer-garden is about 1km south.

name: RV Parking near to amenities + river
description: It's a large parking place for RVs, partially under construction at this time. Near to Isar river and to Lidl+Aldi and a restaurant. No amenities on site.

name: Several Places in the Woods
description: About 1km along the main street, but separated by a river. Accessible via 2 small bridges or by a ford. Several nice places along the river in the woods. No amenities.

name: Quiet place at Decksteiner Weiher, Cologne
description: Quiet, some other campers are here as well. The police came for a quick visit to the parking lot, but just checked that everyone is okay. Great for dogs, next to the woods and grasslands.

name: Parkplatz am Sportplatz Wiesenbronn
description:
Nice carpark at the football field. No facilities.

Schöner Parkplatz am Fußballplatz. Keine Ver- und Entsorgung.

name: Big 24\7 Parking at the Lake
description: Just a large P, but lots of space, partially under trees, and very close to the lake. Restaurant nearby, Toilet at site. Of course crowded at summer time. Bathhouse around the corner.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Gambachsweiher
description:
Free mobile home parking space at the Gambachsweiher in Freudenberg.
No supply or disposal, space for 3 mobile homes. 

Kostenloser Wohnmobilstellplatz am Gambachsweiher in Freudenberg.
Keine Ver- oder Entsorgung, Platz für 3 Wohnmobile.

name: 24\7 Parking direct at the lake
description: It's a wild but authorized 24\7 parking place direct at the lake. For about 10 small cars only. Lake access. No amenities at the place, but nearby. No official camping. No tents.

name: Spectator's Meadow at a Sailplane field
description: 24\7 meadow for about 5 smaller cars. Direct at a Sailplane field. Camping and tents allowed. No amenities.

name: Falkensee cabin
description: Small wooden cabin for picknicking with walk path to the lake. Entrance to area only by walking of cycling. Slept inside this cabin with inner tent. Didn’t see anyone, beautiful view!

name: Campervan site Mettnau
description: Campervan Station Mettnau with toilets, WiFi, black water disposal station.  walking distance to Mettnau Strandbad (beach playground, beach bar) and very recommendable walk hrough the natural reserve to the tip of Mettnau half island.

name: Corvey Abbey
description: A huge graveled parking lot for a lot of motor homes, leveled .

name: Pfohren Grill Hütte (BBQ hut)
description:
On top of a small hill in district Aasen, North of Pfohren. overlooking the Baar you can see the highest mountain of Baden württemberg from here. 
very quiet for a night and only 100 meters out of the village. you have  a BBQ fire as well as a Children's playground. good for hiking and biking.

name: Dromling Nature Reserve
description: A quiet spot in the Drömling nature reserve well suited for a night. On the edge of a meadow with Heckrindern. No facilities for waste disposal. Small hiking trails through the moorland. The nearest town Klötze is 10 km away.

name: Wickrath
description: Offical overnight spot for RV‘s located on the parking lot of Wickrath Castle. Busy over the weekend and nice castle.

name: Pfaffendorf near Bergheim/Erft
description: Dedicated parking spot for 8 RV‘s with no service and no limits to stay. Nice castle nearby. Good starting point for bicycle rides.

name: Duisburg Ruhrort
description:
Overnight Parking for RV’s and Vans at Ruhrort Yacht Club Marina. They provide 5 parking spaces (max. 7,50 m) and it costs 8 € per night. You can get power supply for 1,50 €. Freshwater (0,10€/10 l), toilets and shower are available. 
In 500 m, there is a big supermarket “Kaufland” with SB laundry.

name: Wanderparkplatz
description: Lovely place to stay overnight. With beautiful views a a soft buzz of the motorway nearby. It’s called a “wanderparkplatz” and is is surrounded by big trees and with a gazebo. During daytime about fifteen people park their car to walk the dog. At night it was quiet. Although we were warned for burglary

name: Grossheringen
description:
Close to the river Saale there are spots for 5 rigs. Sometimes you can hear the nearby trains, but at night it was fine. 
In 200m there are bathrooms (toilets) at the stadium. There is a bridge, so rigs can pass by if they are not higher than 3,50m.
Lots of wildlife to see.

name: Big open Parking, surrounded by Nature
description: It's just a big 24\7 parking (leftover from G7 summit), surrounded by hiking areas and a 5* Resort. Lots of space, even for big cars. No amenities, other than 5*. Reachable only via a toll road (5Euro). Our starting point to go to Schachen, Partnach-Klamm or even Mittenwald.

name: River view
description: Ideal place on the river, close to the border wher you can shop. Place for more tents

name: Near river Rhein by Lichtenau
description: Parking slot near to the Rhein beside a small street.

name: Regensdorf
description: beautiful parking place for a short break or overnight sleeping in your own car.

name: Kaatschen
description: Small parking lot close to the river Saale. Stopover spot.

name: campingplatz im grünen
description: nice place in rheforest.perfect.real campground with all facilities.price car €9.-adult €9.- child€9.-shower €1.- for 4minutes

name: camping ettersburg
description: nice gra place with really friendly helpull german ower.grass,near buchenwald.

name: Camping Hammelburg
description:
City camping provided by the 'City of Hammelburg'
Nice spot right next to the river. 
6€/24h - no gates but ticket check about 8 o'clock every morning. 
Free, clean toilets. Free fresh water (bring a wrench if you want to connect a hose). 
Free tank cleaning.

Restaurant in summer.
City with shops and restaurants about 5min walk.

name: Camping Innerstetalsperre
description: nice place near the barrage.all kinds of water activities are possible. helpfull staff. price for 2 person +camper with electricity €14.-tel01713291796

name: Bietigheim River Enz
description:
Six free places parking for motorhomes. Attention - use first left without High Bark!
50 meters from the river Enz (boot launch for kayaking ) and about 300 meters to the historical centre. 
Good for biking Enztalradweg.

name: Cemetery Kornelimünster
description: Outside of the village Kornelimünster ( on a top of a hill). a calm und level parking lot. Good for an overnight stop close to the Belgium border or for a visit of Aachen.

name: Near River
description:
Big grassy area just beside the River. Located 400meters from the castle ruins. Many trails to make a good hiking.
Beautiful view from the Burg on sunset.
Enjoy a bath in the river and have a nice time. Quiet and flat.

name: Parking Lot
description:
There is a parking lot for cars and one for campers and Van's.
It's allowed to stay 12h and everybody said it's OK to sleep here.
We payed 5 Euro and it was very good.
No facilities, but a beautiful view from the castle.

name: Grassy area
description:
Near the intersection of the highways. A big grassy área.
There is a little river in the woods. Do not park in the lower part of this spot.
It can be muddy and swamped. It's a little noisy but at night it's OK.

name: Parkplatz Kloster Birnau
description: Quiet parking und cheap, only for € 0.50 per hour. Possibility of daily tickets. You can stop to cook and sleep on site.There are bathrooms, we just stopped to dine but for our misfortune we found them closed. day tickets can be purchased in the kiosk.

name: River Weser site
description: 72 hrs mobile camper comunal site right at the river Weser

name: Parkplatz Tegelberg Schwangau
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Please check local and country laws to confirm wild camping is allowed in this area.  
----
very quiet parking.  stayed for two nights with no problems.  around 4 in the morning a car came by to do a patrol with headlights on the vehicles, but no problem.  very close to schwangau castles reachable on foot or by bicycle.  Nearby are paragliding jumps, playgrounds, cycle path, Neuschwanstein Castle and Hohenschwangau and the Marienbrücke which unfortunately currently closed.

name: Freudenstadt Panorama Bad
description: rest area.  water drain and toilet drain.  Drinking water 1 € / 80 liters.  possibility to stop for the night. in 5 min on foot you can reach "schwarzwald Center" shopping center with bakery, pizzeria, restaurant, clothing, hairdresser, shoe shop, tobacconist, and grocery store.  in about 20 minutes on foot you can reach the center of Freudenstadt on foot.

name: St.Aldegund Stellplatz
description: Payed overnight parking for RVs, currently closed. But outside is a dumping station, and freshwater too. The ask to pay 1 Euro for it.

name: Seehof
description: Beautiful Biergarten next to a bigger pond that is known for having the best bathing temperatures at the earliest stage of the year!

name: Bauern Cafe
description: Great roadside coffeehouse and regional product store next to the road to / from Garmisch.

name: Allgäu Ranch
description: Very nice and friendly Owners. Perfect view to the alps

name: wanderparkplatz/hiking park side
description: Quiet place for the night pretty much in Passau, next to the river Inn. Frequented by vans

name: Hohepeissenberg
description: Come here for the magnificent 360 view spanning sunrise and sunset!

name: Parking place
description:
Staying here for one night. no signs which say it is forbidden to stay. Police passed by and say nothing. 
Space for 20 Cars. Parking place for swimmers in daytime.

name: Parkplatz Kohlwald
description:
Nice parking lot with forest all around, next houses are approx. 150m away and no direct view to the parking lot.
Trash can on-site, very quiet, good hiking trails available.
Very good 4G LTE signal from O2 / Telefonica.

name: Canal bridge parking area
description: Public parking area next to a canal and bridge. Has a couple of picknic tables and benches. Does have garbage bins.

name: viewing spot parking place
description: super quiet and next to some nice hiking and a lake. follow signs for "Aussichtsturm"

name: Dietfurt an der Altmühl
description:
Official overnight parking. 

24h stay only (but no checks).

Dump station and fresh water available nearby ( Industriestrasse 61)

name: Gunzburg
description: Near tennis and football a little place quiet. Just for one night

name: Alte Veste
description: Old viewpoint in the greens of Zirndorfs City forest. Good for a quiet night once the restaurant next door is shut...

name: Tennisclub Weissenhof
description: 4 Level parking lot with trees and shade. 2.2m entrance barrier which is open most of the times...

name: Nice quiet spot near Marxzell
description: Medium sized parking lot (mainly for hikers during daytime). Almost flat surface that can be handled with standard vehicles. Nearby street is quiet during night-time and absolutely not annoying. Restaurant is 500 m away.

name: Straubing large parking
description: Large parking 5 minutes from downtown toilettes open hour until 6:00 pm no other service.

name: Weichelsdorfer Teich Parking Area
description: There’s a small parking lot next to a small fishing lake, enough space for a couple of camper vans or maybe one big rig. It’s not far from the A9, which is convenient but you can also hear the autobahn from afar. Otherwise it’s very quiet, you can hear the frogs by the pond. There’s also a picnic table and a couple benches around the pond. This was our first overlanding spot and we were pleasantly surprised by it. :) We are unsure if the authorities would have a problem with staying here, but we didn’t have any problems.

name: Lake view
description:
Nice dirt road parking lot for bird watchers. There is a nature reserved lake near by where you can see a lot of bird life. People are not allowed to enter the lake area, but on the parking lot you are legal. 
Don't make too much noise.
This place is nice to stay for a night or for bird watchers or bird photographers.
You can been seen from the next national road here.

name: Parkbad Schwabach
description: Here, next to the Parkbad Schwabach (public pool) and Hörauf Beer Garden, is a parking lot where camper vans can park/camp for up to three days for free. IMPORTANT: This spot is only for rigs with a built in toilet and closed wastewater system (I.e., you can’t dispose of wastewater here and there aren’t any toilets). A big rig could park here when it’s not busy, but would take up several parking spaces… not sure how acceptable people would find that.

name: Parking for motorhomes
description: Room for about 16 rigs. No services. Lots of walking paths to see the flamingos. Free.

name: Swimming pool parking lot
description: Big parking lot for the swimming pool across the road. Maybe 10 spots allocated to motorhomes and there is a pay dump station. Otherwise, overnight parking is free.

name: Riverside
description: Just a parking lot. Seems fairly popular with motorhomes. There were 4 when we were here, but there is probably room for 16 or so. No services, but the village is right there with a couple of restaurants and shops.

name: Goch Municipal Campground
description: Big, busy municipal campground. Not normally our style, but it's close to the nice city of Goch. Room for maybe 150 motorhomes. €5 per 24 hours at a pay machine. Nice modern dump and water station. Friendly hosts.

name: Spreewälder Seecamping Briesensee
description:
Beautiful campsite right by the Briesensee lido. Pine forest, sandy soil.
Sanitary building, possibility to borrow pedal boats and SUP.
Gentle, child-friendly access to the Briesensee.
2021: € 24.50 for 1 night for 2 people with camper and electricity.
No wifi! 
Schöner Campingplatz direkt am Strandbad Briesensee. Kiefernwald, sandiger Boden. Sanitärhaus, Ausleihmöglichkeit für Tretboot und SUP. 
Sanfter, kinderfreundlicher Zugang in den Briesensee. 
2021: 24,50€ für 1 Übernachtung für 2 Personen mit Campingbus und Strom. Kein WiFi!

name: parking near the ferry
description: parking free.perfect for the ferry next day acroos the river elne to glueckstadt

name: Naturcamping Perlenau
description: Cosy campsite along the river, with lots of green and nice camping spots. Designated places for campervans or cars with rooftoptents and an open area for tents. Monschau at 1.5 km, nice hike through the forests. Great showers and free WiFi available.

name: Schiltach in Black Forest
description:
A nice RV Parking by a little Historic town. Directly on the River Schiltach and Kinzig.
RV for 24 hours free.

name: Castell camper site
description:
It's a free parking lot for campers near a sports field (maybe there could be some traffic because of it). Then we were here it was very quit except for some frogs. Because of a small pond you have to expect some mosquitoes.

The spot have a kneipp facility, a big table with benches and a place for a campfire.

name: Parkplatz at the Weinbrunnenhalle in Kröv
description: In this car park are 10 pitches die campers. Parking along the river Mosel is free during the day. Between 7 pm and 9 am it costs € 8.5.

name: Stellplatz Ediger
description: Camper "Stellplatz" at the Mosel. Paid 8,50 Euro without electricity.

name: Campingplatz Hölzerner See
description:
Campsite with many permanent campers and beach at the Hölzernen See. Reception offers small food selection.
Sanitary house is okay. Toilet cabins are very small. For the shower you need a token from the reception (1€). Men's toilets smell strange. 
For one night the place is fine. In case of rain, many pitches are under water!
.....
Campingplatz mit vielen Dauercampern und Badestrand am Hölzernen See.

Rezeption bietet kleine Lebensmittelauswahl.
Sanitärhaus ist okay. Toilettenkabinen sind sehr klein, für die Dusche benötigt man eine Wertmarke von der Rezeption (1€). Männertoiletten riechen merkwürdig. 
Für eine Nacht ist der Platz in Ordnung. Bei Regen stehen viele Stellplätze unter Wasser!

name: Natur- und AbenteuerCamping **** Bautzen
description:
Nice campsite with very clean and large sanitary facilities. Showers are included in the price.
Bread roll service
Pitches and tent meadow
Campers and roof tents can stand on the tent meadow.
WiFi only at the reception.
5 minutes to the bathing area at the Bautzen Dam.
Good value for money!
.....
5 Minuten bis zur Badestelle an der Talsperre Bautzen.
Gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis!

name: Near Train Station
description: Basic parking lot where vans are allowed

name: Okertal Stausee
description: Nice large place for plenty of cars. 5min Walk to the lake where you can swim.

name: Parking Lot
description: Good place to stay for the night. 5min walk to the Schlei (which is a dunkeltal: not a river but more a fjord)

name: Forest Parking near Düsseldorf
description: Parking and Picnic Spot in the forest near Düsseldorf. Busy in the daytime but peaceful at night.... good Place for 1-2 nights

name: Oatseecamp
description: Big campground by the ocean with everything you need. Including a sauna, restaurant and minigolf

name: Parking area at Freibad
description: Publuc parking at the VW Freibad all the way to the entrance and then left to the end.

name: Singen Landesgartenschau
description:
Motorhome parking space for a maximum of 20 spaces and three overnight stays.

5,00 Euro/night

fresh water automat 

Central parking space to the city center just a few meters with retail and catering options.

Good for hiking and biking.

name: Eigeltingen Lochmühle
description:
The parking space for six motorhomes  are located on a restaurant parking lot with an adventure character.

Free. Electricity 5 Euro.

Nice food and 500 Meter to the town center

name: Clausdorf Badestelle
description:
Wild camping on a lake near the village of Clausdorf.
Bathing place and lookout tower with seating are available.

name: Rest area for bikers
description: Nice place close to the river of Danube. No water, no electricity. Nice old city. 100m to good restaurant.

name: Cemetery Berlin-Friedrichsfelde
description: Quiet and safe place near a city train station . Restroom for small money. Water in the cemetery area. Restaurants and Jobs also nearby

name: nice meadow
description:
nice flat meadow with paved road to it, near the forest. perfect for a night.

there is a bridge with an 'only 3,5 tons' sign, but we took it with our 8 tons.

name: Sports center parking lot
description: Overnight parking at the sports center specifically marked as okay for motorhomes. No services, just as nice quiet overnight spot. 6 hours free Wifi coming from a local telecom signal

name: Cruise Shipyard parking lot
description: Free overnight parking for self contained motorhomes. Just a parking lot, no services.

name: Municipal motorhome parking
description: Just a municipal lot for self contained motorhomes. Dump station and water available.

name: Dam Carpark
description: Nice carpark right on the dam, quiet and not too crowded

name: Lenzen Harbor / Elbe Ferry
description:
A quiet place right next to the Elbe River.

This is the parking spot for the 'Lenzen yachting club'.
The harbor restaurant is closed so there are no toilets or other services.
Supermarket in town, about 2km away. 

There is a elbe ferry nearby to reach the Westbank of the river. 

A former DDR guard tower can be visited with some historical information.

name: Camping park Stockach/Reisemobilhafen
description:
The pitch is near the river on the edge of the forest.  The city center Stockach can be easily reached on foot.

40 Sites 14,00 Euro 
March til November 

Good to explore the surrounding area by bike. 

Motor home exhibition area next door

name: Parking Lot - Tatzmania Wildlife Park
description:
Big parking lot which is completely empty after 18:30h. No problems with camping overnight, nobody cares..;-)
Quiet and forest all around, good LTE with O2.

name: Ferropolis
description:
Camping site direct at Ferropolis with sand neach at the see, 33,50€ for 1night incl entrance fee for the outdoor museum

Book via website!

name: Schleuse
description: Next to Schleuse. If you coming from Weg zur Erholung. Stay right in front of Schleuse Kersdorf in a small road to the water. It is big enough for 7to.

name: Airfield backyard
description: Hillside spot with several places with nice view over the river Unstrut and nice sunset. Locals were there, too.

name: Quedlinburg center parking
description:
Parking place in the city center. 15 euro for RV's, we only paid 5 euro for parking in our micro camper. Toilets closes at 17:00 when the tourist info closes. 

Next to church and quit.

name: Teufelsberg Berlin.
description: in the last leftturn to the Teufelsberg top is a small area where you can stand without problems for a night

name: Widest 360 view Saxony
description:
Quiet place behind fence from off-road park on the field. 
Just half km from Tarander Wald forest. 
Enjoy the stars.

name: Tagebau Welzow Sűd
description:
MODERATOR NOTE:  seasonal closures here per sign

Free Parking place very quiet, no problem to stay for a night

name: Murgtalcamping
description: Large campground in an very uninspiring environment, mainly filled with shabby cottages. Small grass section for passing travellers. Clean, good facilities, excellent shower. Friendly, helpful staff. Bread available from the fuel station across the road. Some noise from nearby roads. Good 4G. EUR 22.50 (2 adults, tent, electricity, car). Dish washing place, no washing machine.

name: Esso
description: Dump Station next to esso gas station. big parking spot for trucks

name: Schönbrunn am Waldrand
description: nice place to stay,close to the forest,space for 4 campers,very quit

name: Lörrach
description: Perfect for the night. Beautiful castle. Parkingplace on a hill. You need to level your car

name: Launsbacher See
description: Graveled and grassy area on a small lake. No facilities. Restrictions for protected zones apply.

name: Birkenwäldchen
description:
Nice campground in a Forest with great view on the lake.

Telefon: ‭033674 5151‬

name: Rostiger Nagel
description:
The Place is just next to the „Rostiger Nagel“-Lookout. It has a pretty good view and nice architecture. 
There is a big parking lot where you can put your tent. The road is normally closed during the nighttime. Please stay away from the lake since it is still a danger zone (mining), the channel is safe though.

If the kiosk is open, it has a toilet (with electricity if you are kind!).

Thanks for leaving the space tidy :)

name: Camping am See
description:
+ campground is nicely located next to the Bodensee
+ they offer spacious facilities for toilet, dishwashing and washing machines 
+ they offer „Radlerhütten“ for bicycles

- there are a lot of drunken teens in the tent-area 
- there are really strict rules about the beach, noise and playing games 
- they ask for 50€ deposit per person and can keep it from you if you disrespect their strict rules

name: Campingplatz Hohentengen
description:
Next to the Rhein. 
Nice friendly staff.
Tent area at the far end is nice
Breakfast available (7,5€)
3 pers + 1 Tent for 23€
Warm Shower and washing machine with coins

name: Günther‘s Heil
description:
Shelter with seats and firepit, great lookout over the lake and the dam wall. Inside the House there is space for max. 3 sleeping-mats, next to it is a rain shelter for s few more mats.
Tourists might pass by during the day.
Please leave no rubbish.

name: Kromlau Campsite
description:
Beautiful campsite in the middle of a small pine wood.
Bathing lake at site. Clean toilets, showers work with coins (1€ each)
15 € per night (1 person)
Dogs not allowed at beach .

name: Parking of local soccer team
description: Nice flat area, only 1 mile away from highway 5 (Karlsruhe-Basel). Perfect for nightly stop over. Very quiet and green area. Next to a bycicle path but very few passers by. Local soccer team hasn't played here for a while... (covid ?)

name: Camping Drewoldke
description:
Nice private campground next to Breeg an Juliusruh, just behind the dunes. 
Very nice hosts, giving you the best spot you deserve.
Has everything you need, including a small kitchen.
Good mobil reception

name: Sassnitz City Harbor
description:
Parking lot at Sassnitz City harbor. Caravans, mobile homes and busses only.
Pay & display (see picture) 
View to the Marina.
Toiletts about 500m away.

name: Rhein River
description: Next to the Rhein River - German side . Nice place. Little noise from the highway.

name: Big parking near swimming lake
description: Big parking space next to the swimming lake. Fits big rigs. Very quite at night and there is restaurant near by.

name: Quite parking in Saarbrücken - near cemetery
description:
I spend a night here and can’t complain about anything. After 9pm it was completely quite.  

A lot of space, and a small forest near by.

name: Forest (Grosswald) near Saarbrücken
description: Small parking under the trees. One complete level spot for a van or car. More spots without level ground. I spent a very peaceful night here.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Hammerweiher
description: RV park of the local community Dietzhölztal at a small lake called Hammerweiher. Perfect for hiking and mountainbiking.

name: Propan Gesellschaft
description: They fill gas bottles here. Alugas no problem, or exchange service for normal gas bottles. 11kg for 18,50€

name: Huppertz-Freizeit & mehr - Dump station
description: Grey water dump station and vacuum cleaner in exchange for a small coin.

name: Huppertz-Freizeit & mehr
description: Camping gear shop combined with workshop for camper van conversion as well as camper van equipment repair like fridge, heating units and more.

name: Petrol station on the way from Poland to Berlin
description: Petrol, several food courts, free WiFi and loads of parking space. Probably ok for wild camping.

name: Freibad Milchborntal
description:
Very quiet parking lot at the Milchborntal outdoor pool. 
Sehr ruhiger Parkplatz am Freibad Milchborntal.

name: Official camping not ground of Völklinger Hütte
description:
Free Camper parking of the UNESCO World Heritage in Völklingen. Electricity costs 1€, toilets as well. They close the camper parking at night, it feels very safe. 

You sleep inside an old Iron factory, so don’t expect to much. You can hear traffic and trains, their is a lot of light all night. 

Overall it was a good experience for me.

name: Ranch
description:
Beautiful camping place next to the main road.
We opened the gate ourselves and pulled in to the cow ranch and camped next to the trees on the side. We had a small fire and stayed overnight.
All good. We're planning to jump in the river close to this place. Water is amazing. When we go on the hike we'll put the car back behind the gate closer to the main road. Too bad that it's very noisy.

name: Gravel Parking Lot
description:
Gravel parking lot, good for one night, road is not to noisy.
Shelter available

name: Lonesome field’s near Marl
description: Small paved road near the Wesel-Datten-Kanal, there a few good spots around to spend the night. I stayed a few times here, it was always very quite.

name: Havelberg
description: it's a official campsite. They thought also for cyclist. although it's mainly for campers.

name: Saaleturm
description:
Nice grassy spot next to the Saale tower and the Burgk Museum.
Toiletts (50 ct) and kiosk available.
Suits approx 8-10 Caravans.
Good mobile service.

name: Parking lot
description: Stayed for two nights at this quiet parking lot. It isn't pretty or anything but no one bothered us and we were happy to get out during corona lock down. beware that we slept in the car during winter, so there were barely any other people. in summer the parking lot is quite busy but free for cars and buses but campervans have to pay. there is a supermarkt 3 minutes walking (on saturdays only open until 1pm). you can go for a nice walk to the beach/sea and just enjoy some time by yourself. nothing special but we had a good time and enjoyed the sea side during winter almost by ourselves. perfect for watching the stars during the night!!

name: Close to Ferropolis
description: Large parking next to lake and about 1 km from Ferropolis

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz in Anklam
description: Pitch about 500 m from the town on the Peene. There is a little Marina too

name: Wanderparkplatz Heiligenborn
description: A quiet car Park in the middle of the forest. Great place for hiking and biking.

name: Raitschin
description:
Very good place with all services, restaurant, daily opened. Electricity and dump. Good for bicycling. 
Parquing for RVs.


Sehr guter Stellplatz mit Gasthof, täglich geöffnet, kein Ruhetag. Strom und Entsorgung. Guter Ausgangspunkt für Radtouren.

name: Lake Site
description: Great Site near the Lakes. Plain ground. Little bit of noise from the highway.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz am Wasserfall
description:
An RV parking right beside an campground. It’s €7,50 a night. You can officialy use bathrooms of the campground.
Shower Token is €1 for 8 minutes.
Call the number (you will see) when you arrive. The Manager will come by to collect the payment.
Good for a night or more.

name: Gravel parking near Klais
description:
A gravel parking lot with space for 10+ vans.
First come first serve, bit by bit more vehicles are coming even on monday.
A small creek flows 100m down close to the road for fresh water.

name: Car Shop (Kfz Dürbaum)
description: Good quick service! Sometimes can be a bit longer to wait.

name: Parking near Autobahn
description: Right next to the Autobahn is a carpool meeting (P+R) where it’s save to stay. A bit noisy because of the Autobahn but usually no one at night.

name: Kessels Gas
description: Store where you can fill up/exchange your propane fisks.

name: Aral Fuel Station
description: BP group. Usually very nice people who help you with any concern.

name: Eco-Express
description: around 6€ to wash and dry clothes. Open until 22:00.

name: Kaufland
description: Big grocery story, where you can also buy Oil and bulbs for your car.

name: Hertha-Quelle (Hertha Spring)
description: Locals fill their Bottles and drink the Spring-Water. Nice and tasty Water I like it too.

name: Jet petrol station
description: Free water tap. You may want to fill your tank

name: Cozy corner by a small river
description: A nice spot between the corn fields and a small river. Accessible by a couple of hundred meters of a field/gravel road. Looks like a place where some fisherman can spend their free time. No facilities at all, typical wildcamping spot so please leave no trace. Suitable for bicycles, motorbikes, cars and small campers (1-2 cars max).

name: Oder Havel Kanal
description: Open Space at the Canal. I love this MadMaxoresk Places and the Sounds of Ships pasing by. Ships park here, and mybe you could ask some, to give you a lift to Stettin (Szczecin, Poland).

name: Schöneberger Seen / Lakes
description: A set if different lakes where you can camp, barbeque and swim. Some lakes are used for Sand and Gravel Mining, so big trucks driving arround on workdays..

name: Aral gas station
description: Big and quiet parking place at the back of the gas station

name: Parking by the forest
description: Parking in the woods near Route 504 next to the border with the Netherlands

name: Hainspitzer See
description: Parking at a Lake. Always some Campers arround at this place.

name: Beckum
description: Local parking space for three motor homes. Here you can get fresh water and power (you have to pay for it) and also a spot for black water (free).

name: Parking place with overnight at Nennig
description:
Big parking lot at the right side of the road 100 meters from the Mosel River.
There is a Camping place few meters in front, but we stood at the parking place for free..
Of course no facilities. But OK to sleep.
There is a grocery store just in front so you can buy fresh food and vegetables. Crossing the Mosel bridge, at the left side has a public restrooms for € 0,70. Several restaurants also.

name: Parkplatz Waldsiedlung
description: Parking lot with the option to pay to stay overnight €7 for normal cars and €15 for a RVs (+1€)

name: Wohnmobilplatz Stolzenau
description:
Campground with view to Weser River
More then 50 Places
Long Vehicles welkom.

name: Riehma
description: Small place for a quick overnight stay near the border to Czech Republic. Space for small and large vehicles outside a small village.

name: Parkplatz zum „Schwarzen Leuchtturm „
description: Not many people, no Water, no Power, start Point to go to the „ Schwarzer Leuchtturm“

name: Stellplatz Elsflether Hafen
description: Nice place, beside the Hunte River, 8€ per night, 1€ for Power (8hours max. 1500Watt), 1€ Water, trash, disposal

name: Stadthalle Verden
description:
Culture - conference - events

All kinds of cultural, information and corporate events are held in the town hall. The hall can be seated in different ways, so that many forms of use are possible. Our rooms are special. Whether music, theater, ballet, trade fairs, conferences, balls, parties and events: this is where culture, experiences and information meet tradition. In the 19th century there was a cavalry barracks at the Holzmarkt. The listed structures are still visible today and give our house a special ambience.

https://www.stadthalle-verden.de/stadthalle.html

name: Elan Gas Station
description: Gas Station with a littel Shop, car wash, Diesel, Benzin and LPG

name: Vogelsang Brunnen
description: Water for you to drink. Greets from Germany

name: Brunnen oberhalb Kleinried
description:
Water fountain with good water. 
.....
Wasserbrunnen mit guten Wasser. Falls man benötigt

name: Munich Allianz Arena
description:
There is parking for recreational vehicles just outside Munich’s gates for only 15 euro’s per night. This price is the same for cars with trailer caravans.

Attention campers! The north bus parking lot at the Allianz Arena is available for campers and cars with caravans.

name: Tierklinik Posthausen
description: We have been committed to the health and care of your pet for over 25 years. Thanks to your trust, we have developed from a practice in Achim to a national veterinary clinic. A few years ago we built a new clinic in order to meet your requirements in the future. Thanks to the most modern equipment, it allows us to care for your animal at the highest level and promotes the specialization of our veterinarians. In our premises we treat your darling with the utmost calm and care. The focus of our actions is on the health and quality of life of our patients as well as a trusting relationship with you. It goes without saying that we work closely with your veterinarian.

name: Carpark Waldfriedhof Neuschönningstedt
description: This is the carpark of the Waldfriedhof Neuschönningstedt (cementry).

name: Carpark Achtermoor/Schlapshof
description: Carpark at the nature reserves Achtermoor and Schlapshof

name: Das Venn ruft
description: It is an elevated platform for 2 tents. Basic toilets available. Maximum 2 nights in a row. Maximum for 2 tents. A tent can't be bigger than 2,25 x 3,5 meter. Season is from 1. April - 31. October. Tickets available under www.trekking-eifel.de. Price for 2022 is 10 euros/night/tent. There are several sites in the area. Only hikers and cyclists.

name: Nordstern
description: It is an elevated platform for 2 tents. Basic toilets available. Maximum 2 nights in a row. Maximum for 2 tents. A tent can't be bigger than 2,25 x 3,5 meter. Season is from 1. April - 31. October. Tickets available under www.trekking-eifel.de. Price for 2022 is 10 euros/night/tent. There are several sites in the area. You might be able to park your vehicle at the nearby Camp Schelde (southern end). Water can be found at the entrance to the "Eifel-Wohnmobilpark-Vogelsang"

name: Camping Schillig
description: On the Strandparpklatz: Fresh water and gray water can be emptied free of charge. To empty the toilet there is a cleaning machine that costs 1 €.

name: Mawile Eifelschlaf
description:
They have 2 construction wagons (Bauwagen) turned into sleeping wagons. The Eifelsteig passes here about halfway between Gerolstein and Neroth. Just ask when you're there or contact +49 (0) 6591982890 or info@mawile-eifelschlaf.de before. Cellphone reception can be a bit poor at the location. So it might be a good idea to call from a place with better reception. Paid 35 euros for a night alone in one of the wagons. 

Check mawile-eifelschlaf.de for more information. Probably you could camp here for a small fee if the wagons are occupied and have a shower, etc.

name: Wohnmobil Stellplatz am Stausee
description:
1€ per 4 hours of Power. No toilets. Great in winter, 3 easy round tours for hiking start here. 
Possibly a gem in the summer or a nightmare depending on how full the Stausee gets, you’re allowed to swim and fish in it. 
More details available on Park4night app

name: Parkplatz neben Sporthalle
description:
Translation:Parking lot next to the sports hall.
Suitable for 1 or 2 nights
On the outskirts next to field.
Quiet place. Also suitable for large vehicles.

Parkplatz neben Sporthalle.
Geeignet für 1 oder 2 Nächte
Am Stadtrand neben Feld.
Ruhige Platz. Auch für große KFZ geeignet.

name: Friesland Camping
description: Official campsite right next to a swimming lake. Well-kept sanitary facilities, well-kept entire area. At the lake there is a snack, showers and delicious cocktails.

name: Parkingplace
description: 3 Days of free parking for big vehicles. In toilet, no water.

name: Burginsel Delmenhorst
description: Delmenhorst Castle, also called Delmenhorst Castle, is a lost moated castle on the "Castle Island" on the southern edge of the center of the city of Delmenhorst in the Oldenburger Land in Lower Saxony in the Delmeaue. The castle was the center of the city and county of Delmenhorst for almost 500 years.

name: Fressnapf
description: Around 1,500 modern stores in eleven European countries offer a comprehensive, competent network for animal lovers and pet owners from Denmark to Italy. In addition to pet food, you will also find a wide range of accessories and services in the stores. The Fressnapf Group also offers an extensive range of exclusive brands in all price ranges.

name: Braker Parkplatz
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:We could not confirm that overnight parking is allowed here.

small parking lot on the main street. Good starting point for bike tours.

name: Große Höhe
description:
The Große Höhe is located south of Ganderkesee and Delmenhorst near the Adelheide military training area. This is a varied forest area near the course of the Delme river.
