As long as no exercises take place on the adjacent military training area, it may be entered for hiking. However, you should stay on the paths and not take any remains of ammunition with you, which should not be the case either.

There are several smaller and larger parking spaces for hikers along the “Zur Große Höhe” road. These are often very full on weekends. This is a popular local recreation area that is particularly popular on weekends.

We start our hike at one of the hiking parking lots. Across the street on the other side of the street, a sign points to a nature and adventure trail. We follow this path initially. There is a lot on offer, especially for children. There is also a school camp in the forest nearby.

name: Fritz Berger
description:
OUR LEISURE MARKET OFFERS YOU:

generous parking facilities
competent specialist staff
personal and individual advice
Customer card
OUR PERSONAL SERVICE FOR YOU:

Spare parts service for Fritz Berger products
fast and uncomplicated complaint processing
Central tent repair service
Reservation service
Follow-up delivery service
Gift vouchers
48 hour service, 24 hours for a fee
SERVICE AROUND THE PRODUCT:

Order service for viewing (except custom-made)
Exchange of gas bottles
Sample presentation in the store
Advice / instructions for the installation of gas stoves / gas technology with the appropriate material composition
Offering complete packages (movers, TV systems, solar) in connection with the workshop at an all-inclusive price - on request

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Delmenhorst
description:
The motorhome parking space with eight free parking spaces is located directly on the river, on the edge of the city park, the Graftanlagen, and at the same time only a few minutes' walk from the city center.
The special service: You can use the disposal options at no extra charge, only the electricity supply is charged.
Please note that the fresh water supply is not available until further notice.

Boat rental, mini golf, the GraftTherme wellness and leisure pool, other leisure options and stylish restaurants can be found in the immediate vicinity.

All you need to use is a parking permit (valid for one week, after which 10 euros per day will be charged). You will receive the parking permit directly at the parking space, on the box next to the information board. Please fill this out yourself and then place it visibly in your vehicle.

name: Tourist Info Delmenhorst
description:
Have you discovered Delmenhorst for yourself and would you like to get to know the city?

You can receive booking inquiries, tourist package deals and information on current events from us.

Competent, friendly and helpful, we are happy to answer your questions. Your free time is our job - we look forward to your call.

Lange Strasse 10, 27749 Delmenhorst
You are also welcome to contact us by email
or by phone at 04221/99 2299.
Email : shop@dwfg.de
web : https://www.dwfg.de/tourist-information.html

Opening times in the winter months:
Monday to Friday: 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Saturdays: 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.
and by appointment

name: Stellplatz Sillenstede
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE: We could not verify that overnight parking is allowed here.

Official parking space in a car park. Also suitable for big ships. Kiosk and bakery in walking distance.

name: Stellplatz Forsthaus Upjever
description: Official parking space at the Forsthaus Upjever (https://www.forsthaus-upjever.net). Very idyllic in the middle of the forest. Perfect for walks or bike rides. There is also a museum mill on the site.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Bruchwiesen
description: quiet established caravan campground near the old city centre

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Schießtal
description: Official place for around 8 camper vans close to the city center. No toilets. Electricity was advertised but out of order when we where there.

name: Parking lot „Heisser Brocken“
description: Thermal baths / spa facilities | Old town well worth seeing Parking spaces for mobile homes on grass grids. Slightly sloping terrain with car parcelling between the thermal baths and the wooded slope. Further stands on graveled area.

name: Westtor Sendenhorst
description:
Motorcaravan Night Stop
Up to four Vans below 8 Meters long allowed
Normaly you can get electricity there, unfortetunatly someone knocked the pole over. So at the moment just staying over night and dumping black water possible

name: Skyline of Stockach
description: A great Sunset place in the Hills above Stockach.

name: Lakeside Parking Lot
description: This is one of the many quiet parking lots next to the lake around München. Just search on Google maps, satellite view. lakes. find the parkplatz next to it, usually there is more for one, and camp.

name: guckaisee
description: nice place to stay with car or van near a small lake

name: Campingplatz Blauer See
description:
Very nice & clean campground with sandybeach & Lake directly nearby the tent. Costs roundabout (without electric power) for one night, 1 person, one tent and bike 15,- €. Free Wifi. Restaurant at place and very few km away.
Lake is wonderful and clean. You don't need shower coins ;-)

name: Loderhaus Brunnen
description:
Water well. You can help yourself

Brunnen an Loderaus. Hier kann man sich auch selbst versorgen

name: Next to river
description: Easy access spot, right along the river. Long green lane with a bench on the left. Quiet, close to town.

name: Einsames Plätzchen
description: When it rains, I think it is only for 4x4

name: Talsperre Wanderparkplatz
description:
Easy parking. No supply or disposal. Absolutely calm. For a night or two. Hiking trails or jogging...
---
Einfacher Parkplatz. Keine Ver- oder Entsorgung. Absolut ruhig. Für ein oder zwei Nächte. Wanderwege oder joggen …

name: Park & Ride for Stuttgart - perfekt for big rigs
description:
Free Parking 24/7 next to metro station & lake. Supermarkets are near by. Lots of space for every kind of vehicle.

We actually stayed a few days in our 7m rig…after 5 days the police told us to leave

name: At the substation
description: small place on sand and stone. Ideal for one or two nights with the roof tent. It's only a 40-minute drive to downtown Berlin. There is some traffic during the day, but hardly any at night.

name: FRA 4122
description:
Absolutely quiet place in the middle of the forest, with benches and a campfire site. There is enough wood in the area. The area is very large, surrounded by wild nature and is partly solid gravel and partly grass. The missile defense position FRA 4122 used to be here, but nothing of it has been there since 2020.  It is being recultivated.

The location is ideal to see Berlin and the surrounding area. It is only 30 minutes to the next motorway and only an hour to the city center.

Access is via a direct road from the long main road! Directly in front of a no-through sign, right. Some navigation devices have problems calculating the route point exactly.

name: Bremke
description:
Home in Germany
Unterstraße 3
37130 Gleichen/ Bremke

name: Trailhead parking Schloß Burg
description:
Quiet big parking area between the trees. Houses nearby.
Nice for walking and MTB next day.

name: Big parking near forest and church
description:
Very quite parking near the forest. Fits big rigs too & more or less level.

Good for 1-2 days near Saarbrücken. The town nearby (Dudweiler) also has great cheap public swimming pool.

name: Forest parking - beautiful woods around you
description:
Small parking, a few people in the day time come to walk in the forest. At night nobody.
Lovely forest around to walk and have Picknick. Also there is a swimming pool near by.
Just for small vehicles, not much space.

name: Teufelsslchlucht
description: Parking at the Dino center at Teufelsschlucht. Camping allowed after closing of the little theme park. Also a small nature reserve (teufelsschlucht) with a nice walk. Near the mullerthal in Luxemburg. As far as we know the only allowed free camping spot in the area. Restaurant and toilet available when the park is open

name: Große Lauter
description: Parkingspace in front of nice river. Many walker come here. Nice BBQ place

name: Camping Niederrhein
description: Beautifully calm campsite in close proximity to the Rhine

name: Trekkingplatz Frankenwald Kobach
description:
Equipment: eyelets for fastening the lines on the platforms, fireplace with lighter and firewood, weather-protected outdoor toilet, lockable wooden box, water barrel with fire-fighting and service water
10€/site (Max 4 persons) - 1 night only

Ausstattung: Ösen zum Befestigen der Leinen auf den Plattformen, Feuerstelle mit Anzünder und Feuerholz, wettergeschützte Outdoor-Toilette, abschließbare Holzkiste, Wasserfass mit Lösch- und Brauchwasser
10€ per Platz 4 Personen

name: Wynen Gas
description: Specialized in gas installations/service on all types of liquid gas for camping cars

name: Klostermühle - Restaurant/Hotel
description: Restaurant with a good selection of meat and non-meat dishes and even vegan ones. There are many dishes with game meat. The unique selling point, however, are the vegetarian and vegan dishes. These are hard to come by in this region.

name: Daktec - Autohaus Krüger
description: I had my Landcruiser HZJ76 modified at by Daktec. The quality of the work was very good. Also, the communication was very friendly. I would go there again. They are specialized in 4*4 vehicles and participate in ralleys in North Africa.

name: Elberadweg Häuschen (Bikes only)
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No vehicle access

Direct at the Elberadweg, small house. Near the road, but it's ok for a night

name: Biohof Reinhart
description:
Quiet campsite on the farm. Restaurant available. Showers, toilet.
....
Ruhiger Campingplatz am Bauernhof. Gaststätte vorhanden. Duschen, WC.

name: Fritz Berger Shop
description: Fritz Berger Shop, filling Gas https://www.fritz-berger.de/filiale/deggendorf/

name: Trinkwasser
description:
Drinking water well. below the ski lift
...
Trinkwasserbrunnen unterhalb des Skilifts

name: Am See
description:
Nice place on the lake, pebble beach, swimming possible. Near the highway, separated by a dam-a noise can be heard. You can stay overnight, although not officially allowed. Occasionally fishermen stay here. Bathers from time to time during the day.
....
Schöner Platz am See, Kiesstrand, schwimmen möglich. Nähe der Autobahn, getrennt durch einen Damm-ein Rauschen ist zu hören. Man kann übernachten, ist natürlich nicht offiziell erlaubt. Gelegentlich stehen Fischer hier. Tagsüber hin und wieder Badegäste.

name: Parking lot next to Unimog Museum
description:
A spot next to the Unimog Museum. Public parking spot. The passing road might be a bit noisy at night. It’s clean and safe.
Restaurant and toilets at the Museum

name: MEREX / MERTEC
description:
Unimog/Mercedes Benz 
Mechanics, parts, big rigs

Ask for Andre (MEREX) or Eugen (MERTEC).

www.merex.de
www.mertec.de

name: Schwarzenbach-Talsperre Parking Spot
description:
Public parking spot at Schwarzenbach Talsperre (Dam). WC at the kiosk.
Paved ground. Quiet at night. During day you can watch lots of motorcycles rushing by.

name: Stellplatz Izelberger See
description: It‘s an public RV overnight place for 6 RV‘s. There is Power and Freshwater for €1. To stay here is free. It has gras and its right at a nice little lake. The place as quiet. I rate it a 8.5/10

name: Kleiner Vachentiner See
description: It‘r right by the lake with lots of shade. Great for a swim with a fireplace.

name: Standbad Lychen
description: Nice campground on a little hill right behind the lido. Power, shower, toilets and the entrance to the lido is all incl. paid € 26 for two adults. You stay were you park your camper or tent. No designated and numbered slots. If you stay at the very top of the camping hill you‘re right away in nature

name: Pavillon Rastplatz
description: Nice overnight spot up the hill. Small Pavillion available and shade.

name: Public shelter
description: Big public shelter with 3 big tables and space for 4/5 two person tents

name: Tierarztpraxis Dr.med.vet. Elke Schwarz-Kugele
description:
Tierarztpraxis Dr.med.vet. Elke Schwarz-Kugele
Steinstrasse 47, 71404 Korb.
Open Monday - Friday 7.30-12.00 h and  14.00-17.00 h

name: Fressnapf Stuttgart-Wangen
description:
Fressnapf Stuttgart-Wangen, Ulmer Straße 199
70327 Stuttgart, Deutschland
Open Monday - Saturday  09:00 - 20:00 h
Pet food, accessories and some services.

name: Bleiche
description: very quiet and near to town center no facilities, they plan to install them, 1.50€ for 8 hs during daytime. Free from 7 pm to 7 am

name: Biebesheim
description:
Parking no service no tent Big cars near The 
River Rhein dogs allowed

name: Under the trees
description: Right on the edge of the paid parking area, under the trees.  Lots of shade and quiet.  Place for a maximum of three campervans that are not longer than 7 meters.

name: Wacht am Rhein
description: An old abandoned road next to the river Rhine. The old bridge is closed with a permanent road-block. You can park on the road or on an old parking lot. Bike-path next to it and in the morning several local people come here by car to walk their dogs. Gas station and burger king nearby

name: Campsite Barefootpark Egestorf
description: Campsite associated with the "Barfußpark Egestorf". A little downhill in the woods there are also toilets.

name: Dorfbrunnen Hecht Quelle
description: In summer, there is good water for filling up watertank with 10l Gartenwaterbox.

name: nice place next to Jena
description:
great view.
large meadow directly on the slope to winzerla
mostly hikers around but they don't feel disturbed.
---------------
super Aussicht.
große Wiese direkt am Hang zu winzerla
meist wander unterwegs die sich aber nicht gestört fühlen.

name: Schwalbenmuhle
description: Fantastic place on a parking lot along the river with a nice trail for a small hike. The parking lot is for nature visitors and in front of a very good restaurant owned by Mario who offered us electricity for free for our 2 days. Diner at his restaurant was great, huge supermarket around the corner. lovely and quiet.

name: Lübeck Old Town RV Parking
description: €6 per 24 hours, free on Sundays. Easy walk over the bridges into the town. Public WC available in the car park.

name: Parking over night
description: Official parking for Camper over night 24h/5€. Bakery with cafe next door, open Mon-Sun with toilet.  Next public toilet 250m. Restaurants nearby.

name: Volkach Stellplatz am Main
description:
Good Place at the Shore of the River Main. Close to a Ferry.
Green Place and Quiet. Dumpstation 300m at the Station of the Fire Brigade. Restaurant close to the Church also about  300 M from the Campervan Place.

name: Penkun Former Campsite
description: Abandoned stellplatz but still listed on local signage. Great location right on a small lake with forest surround and a castle up the small hill. No facilities, however the small restaurant “Park am See” is open from 11:00am to 9:00pm with a toilet and great food.

name: An der Havel
description: Nice place at the river beetzsee. with a beach near there. suitable for all rigs.

name: Lake side
description: A nice lakeside spot. with nude locals and couples at weekends. perfect for a night.

name: Riverside
description: loneliness place at the river. reachable offroad. be carefull when it rains.

name: Wild camping
description: Dirt road leads to a dead end, so an OK place for a night.

name: Bleiau
description: Established campsite with mainly longterm campers and space for tents and other campers. Lovely placed on a Rhine-island close to Ginsheim-Gustavsburg. Mainz can be easily reached by car,bike or bus/train within couple of minutes. We paid 20€ for one night, a pickup incl popup-cabin and two adults. Owner is very relaxed. I can recommend this place

name: Green and grassy parking lot next to lake
description: Green and grassy parking lot next to the lake. Next to a road but not many cars at night. Quiet spot. We saw some cars come and go but we were the only ones staying the night.

name: Boarisch Kongo
description: Official parking space on the farm, for mobile homes and similar vehicles.  Drinking water and electricity connection.

name: Seven Springs Camping
description:
A nice place run by a traveler. The entry may not be too inviting, but give it a chance and go to the restaurant/reception building. The camping is undergoing some renovation, but has all that is needed and for sure more is coming. There is a railway track nearby, but it didn't bother us at night. 
Paid 16 euro for a tent and 2 people and 2 motorbikes.

name: Scheibe See... small carpark
description:
Nothing special but somewhat hidden. Small free carpark.
Tents can be set up by following the path towards the lake, turn right at the fence and 10m to your right is a secluded spot. 
From. The carpark 50m to the lake shore, attached to the bike path (13km one round)

name: Fish pond
description:
Best place to calm down next to a big fish pond/lake. 
Beautiful and quite place. 
Great for tents as well! 
Keep your chairs and tables inside or use a paid campground!
NOT for white big campers or caravans!

name: Forest carpark
description:
NOT FOR WHITE CARAVANS
This is a beautiful spot next to the forest. Signposted carpark with no limits.
Grassy surface. Autobahn closeby

LEAVE your chairs and tables inside!
This is not a campsite.
It is for travellers whose appreciate a free spot

name: in the woods at the lake
description:
Beautiful place to stay a night or two 
Please keep your chairs inside.
NO official campground
DO NOT mess it up!
DO not post it anywhere else

name: Bergerhof
description: Parking for hikers. There is a grill and Restaurant open from 9 to 18, where you can chill out, plus lots of hiking trails. After 18 clock, it's quiet here. Weekend could be busy. Vans are ok here. Anything bigger might have problem. Slept well here .

name: Stellplatz Am Kalkwerk
description:
Great place, choose your site on lawn.
Very nice hosts !
Former VEB Kalkwerk (GDR times).
No facilities.

name: Rohlsdorf
description:
private property open for motorhomes and rv’s / exmo’s
the owner lives next door and is friendly and helpful 
no restrooms / no electricity / no water available 
a quiet and safe place to stay for the night 
keep that spot clean

name: Leidolsheimer Rhein
description: Nice stop with benches next to the Rhine

name: Niedersonthofener See
description: Parking on a green meadow directly to the lake (parking fee (3,50/d). Public toilets ans showers. Nice and quite, sometimes you can hear a train.

name: Parking Place close to Foggensee
description: Just a parking lot. Not for big vehicles. Quite and lovly in the woods

name: Illmensee parking
description: Parking direct to the lake, quite and beautiful view

name: Camperstop in Kastl
description: Great! Free fast city Wifi, clean public toilets open 8:00am to 8:00pm, designated Motorhome parking. There are some large shade trees and a great restaurant next door.

name: Salzhausen Aire
description: Small RV Aire with eight spots.  Parking is level on a gravel lot and is free as is dumping station.  Power and water are available for a small fee each.  4G signal.  It's next to a green space and away from traffic and noise.  Close to town and its services.

name: Sunpark parking
description:
Parking place, very quiet 
Steep way up
No services

name: Serways Raststätte Am Hockenheim Ring Ost
description: Air and water near the toilet entrance. Does not say if the water is drinking water.

name: Lakeside Park-Up
description: Great! Huge gravel car park right by a small lake which is excellent for swimming. There’s outdoor (cold) showers and a cafe with toilets (open during the day, closed evenings/nights).

name: Andreikes Ranch
description:
Our front yard is suitable for big rigs or even 3 normal rv's.
We are overlanders our selves, so overlanders are welcome for a stopover

name: Hamburg motorcycle
description: Great motorcycle mechanic, sources parts with next day delivery. Tyres, chains brake pads and very reasonable labour costs

name: Fahrhaus Hodorf
description: Klaus is a great host. Small cosy campsite with a swimming pond in the middle. Plenty of seating hot showers, cooking facilities, fire pit. €12 euros for tent and Moto.

name: parking lot next to Tiroler Ache
description: roomy, graveled parking lot, partly under a bridge with a nice view. Since the place is located right at the Tiroler Ache River, the place is used by Rafting and Canoe Touring guides to pick up their boats. So it might be a little crowdy at daytime.

name: Quiet grass parking place next to camping
description: Grasfield next to camping place am guduwer (in case this one is closed). Suitable for pitching your tent or a camper van. Toilet and water tap nearby. 1 min walking from the lake and a restaurant

name: Parkplatz Oberfischbach
description: Larger parking area, quite quiet location. The subsoil consists of gravel and grass. The place is certainly nothing extraordinary, but it may be sufficient for an overnight stay. It may be full during riding events of the nearby equestrian club.

name: Chamerau parking at church
description: Parking near the church and a boat slip station. Toilet is close by. Nice for a night.

name: Seecamping Obernzenn
description:
Official campside near a small lake. Quiet place with nice people. You can buy bread, drinks and ice at the reception. 
There is a break from 1 to 3 p.m. During this Tine the campside is really quiet…

name: Wohnwagenstellplatz Peenemünde
description: Places for campers with toilets/showers in the harbour of a Ship Museum.

name: Potable Water Source
description: Site of a water purification company in full nature. There are two "kiosks" that you cannot enter but you are out of sight behind the last one. Potable water source nearby.

name: Parkplatz Falckensteiner Strand
description: Calm, beautiful parking lot under the trees. Very spacious, not crowded when we visited, just a few campervans. Just a few minutes walking distance to the beach. Great spot!

name: Parking at lake
description: Pretty big parking lot with trees right next to a lake. Quite busy, because there’s a restaurant and a bus stop. We came late and left early. Perfect for one night!

name: Briester Landprodukte
description:
This is a Mini-Campground provided by a farmer. It only has 3 Spots and is very quiet and exclusive. Costs are 20€/night. No Toilets, no Shower but Power (1€/kwh) and free Wi-Fi. 
SUP for rent. 
You’re right at the beautiful river Havel, can make a fire, fish, swim. You have to call in advance, don’t just show up!

name: Campingplatz Rote Schleuse
description: good cleen camp site with hot shower and WiFi with a bar and restaurant

name: Port of Linumhorst
description: In beautiful Linumhorst in Brandenburg, there is a small disused port on the Rhin River that is great for driving to.  However, the bridge is closed to vehicles and therefore access is only possible via Linumhorst!  The place is quiet and in the middle of nature by the water.  It invites you to linger and go for a walk and is perfectly located for extensive bike and motorbike tours.

name: 7springs
description: Campground at a nice little swimming lake with facilities and a restaurant.

name: Chestnut Tree Campervan Site
description:
Nice and cozy official parking lot for motorhomes. Located at the border of the little town Neuenkirchen. Close to the river Weser. Perfect for a walk to the river.

A BBQ site and a soccer field for children is here, too. You need to bring your own grill grate to use the BBQ site.

You don't have to pay fees here.

This is an official spot for motorhomes, but unknown and hard to find. So you'll be alone here!

name: Campingplatz Stadt Köln
description:
Nice camping site at cycling distance from the city center. It is located right at the edge of the river, you have a nice view. The toilets and showers are clean. There is a cooking area with hot water, free gas stoves and benches and tables where you can sit. The kitchen area is open day and night. The management warned me of bike theft. It is pretty easy to pick up a bike and carry it across the fence. They have created a fenced cage where you can store your bike, it gets locked at night. There is a tiny store, I have not used it as there are supermarkets nearby. 

Minus points:
- When it rains, draining the water away can be problematic, water puddles appear.
- Even though the camping site is located at the edge of the city, there is a some background noise. There is a suspension bridge nearby with a lot of traffic. The traffic on the river is noisy too.

Plus points:
- Nice relaxed atmosphere.
- Large trees provide shade in hot weather.
- View of the river Rhein.
- At cycling distance from the city center.

Overall it is pretty good, It is a nice relaxed, no frills camping site. I have stayed there again (and again) after my initial visit.

Campingplatz Stadt Köln
Weidenweg 35
D-51105 Köln Poll

name: Forrest parking spot next to Gudow
description: Little used parking spot, barely seen from the local road. Footpaths lead into the forest and to a lake, but we didn't try them. No houses around, and plenty of space.

name: Water Spring
description: There is a parking for a hike here. Also, a tap from the mountain. Locals come here to fill jerry cans of water. Told me it is “Trinkwasser”

name: Lüneburg Sülzwiesen
description:
Nice Campspot surrounded by trees in walking distance to the city center of Lüneburg!
Absolutely magnificent City, with a beautiful old Town!
Stay here for around 5€ with Water and Toiletts (drive through the gate with your paid ticket)

Sometimes City-Celebrations taking place during the Summerholidays, than it could be louder..otherwise it’s very quite and not too busy.

name: Wilde campaign
description: owner's are really friendly and welcoming the showers are rely nice  and it's just a cool place with a lake 3minits walk away you can swim in

name: behind the little wooden church
description:
Restricted access for vehicles!

I'm traveling by bicycle and just need a nice flat place not in street view. I left my bike behind the wooden church and cooked there. there are cars on the road but they can't see you. there's a path about 150m? long (uphill). no water, nor anything. I was too lazy to set up tent so I slept w my mat and good sleeping bag on the church doorstep. it's 14⁰ at 23h on august 9.

name: Weinberg
description:
Lonely place at the highest point and on the end of small ways through the wine garden.
Top panorama. Only for small campers.

name: Big maintanance place near autobahn
description: There is a nice view to some villages. Should be noisy from traffic on Autobahn. but nobody will be here. you are Just alone. nothing Else.

name: Near Güstrow
description: Spot near the road. Only grassy ground for tent or Van.

name: Parking Waldspielplatz
description: In a rather difficult wildcamp area is this a nice opportunaty. Parking at the forest, just a few dogwalker came by. No "No Camping" signs, had a quiet night. Area perfect for hiking and biking.

name: Naturparkplatz Fladensteine
description: Nice flat Parking in the forest close to a Geolehrpfad, the impressive Fladensteine and a MTB-Trail! Had a peaceful night, no "No Camping" signs, but dont try it at the official Geolehrpfad Parking at the Soccer Field, there are louds of signs...

name: Camping & Pension Mühlleiten
description:
Small campsite at 2 minutes by car from Konigssee. Always room for tents, but there is little room for camping vehicles.
Fully equipped and very pleasant service! A little close to the road which is noisy in the morning but remains calm at night.

name: Wildcamp above mini powerplant
description: A little flat parking space above a mini powerplant around 40 m from the road, parked vehicles are not invisible from the road. Suitable for 4x4, 1 big or 2 smaller cars. Quite easy to access, the access road don't look worth trying from the asphalt road but that is an illusion.  There is one road on each side of the power station, use the one to the right looking at the powerplant, the flat spot is behind the little hill to the left.

name: Offroad-Mobile-Autark
description: Off-road Motorhome builder as well as auto electronics, repairs, fault finding, gas installation and inspection. Victron certified installer and supplier. Building and supplier of custom made stainless steel fuel tanks. Supplier and installer of Autoterm diesel heaters and engine warmers.

name: Landschaft Park Duisburg Nord
description: Free parking for caravans and mobile homes where you can dump black water toilets and garbage.  It’s a nice area to stay overnight with a lot of walking around and looking.

name: Wankbahn camper stop
description: Just a quiet camperspot. You come here and the next morning you pay €22. It has showers and toilets for free. And there’s a cable line up to the top of the mountain. You can also eat in the restaurant next to it.

name: Wohnmobilplatz Sportstudio Füssen
description:
Very basic place to spend the night - looks like a parking space - mostly campers will visit; toilets and showers available; sanitary dump + fresh water station - about 40 places - quiet in the evening
Register in Sportstudio across the street
19€ per spot regardless of number of people in the car - showers at 50ct

name: 5 Oberrieder Weiherstraße 86488 Breitenthal
description: Top place!  Calm!  Nice on the water! Also suitable for large mobile homes!

name: Reisemobilstellplatz Geisingen
description: Well maintained!  Also for large mobile homes!  Straight, level shelves.

name: Peetschsee
description: Beautiful little resting area with plenty of space to wild camp. Only accessible with bicycle / hiking. Beware, the path to get here is relatively sandy but very doable on bicycle. Gorgeous spot and very quiet, nobody around

name: Mühlensee / Havelquelle
description: Good place for wild camping along the Berlin - Copenhagen cycling road. Close to multiple lakes. Sandy, foresty, grassy ground. Plenty of places to choose from. Quiet, only 1 group of people on the other side of the lake there when I arrived at 7 PM.

name: Mühl Rosin Forest
description: Place in the forest along the Berlin Copenhagen Cycle way where you can wildcamp. Flat foresty soft ground, very quiet. Only one car passed by in the morning. This was the best place I could find around here to wildcamp, to the south and west there didn't seem to be any good places. No water here!

name: Todtnau, Passstraße
description: Pitch for 30 campers.  Level surfaces, good for one night, nice for hiking and cycling, great summer toboggan run!

name: Marina Zecherin
description: Small Camp in a Marina. Very friendly people, quiet place on the river Peene. Good to have a bicycle so you can travel around.

name: Dianalust Forest
description: Although most tracks in this forest area are only for logging vehicles, this track doesn't have a sign saying so. The track leads to a wildlife observation tower. After the tower, the track was too rough for us, so we camped near the tower. You do hear the highway 3 a bit, but apart from that it we had a very quiet night.

name: Donau Total
description: Lovley beach spot right at the Donau. Great place to go for a swim. Privat and wilde…

name: Drakenburg
description: This camp site is part of a water sports center. Campers can stay as guests, for a tent is is €7 per person with an honestly box system. when you arrive follow the signs to the tent area, there are basic facilities in a nearby building. it's super friendly and a beautiful spot to spend a few days relaxing next to the water.

name: Neugartenland
description:
Welcome to Neu-Gartenland. 
You land here in our garden, which we would like to share with all nature lovers. Squirrels, hares, many birds, hedgehogs and sometimes deer live here. Feel comfortable here and stay as long as you want. 
Our garden is over 5000 m² and offers a lot of beautiful corners for campers and glampers ;) 

It is important that you arrive self-sufficient. There is no drinking water, no electricity, no rubbish bins and no toilet. But a lot of peace and the most beautiful nature. 
By the way, the zoo is not far away and you can sometimes hear the lions roar and the monkeys screech. 
We have very friendly neighbors here - please be considerate of them by keeping quiet and at least 5 meters away from their garden :) 
Thank you very much! 

You can reach our garden via a fixed driveway. At the "Campus Südstadt" stop, drive straight ahead into the small access road to the gardens - approx. 300m - then you can see a small sign on a hedge - then turn right. You can stand anywhere on the site (please leave a decent distance to our neighbors). We look forward to you!

 ——— Important: do NOT make a fire and ALWAYS leave the fountain closed! 
——— 10 € / day: please via PayPal

-----

Herzlich willkommen in Neu-Gartenland. 
Du landest hier in unserem Garten, den wir gerne mit allen Naturliebhaber teilen möchten. Hier wohnen Eichhörnchen, Feldhasen, viele Vögel, Igel und manchmal auch Rehe. Fühle dich hier wohl und bleibe solange du möchtest. 
Unser Garten ist über 5000 m² groß und bietet super viele schöne Ecken für Camper und Glamper ;) 

Wichtig ist, dass du autark anreist. Hier gibt es kein Trinkwasser, keinen Strom, keine Mülleimer und auch keine Toilette. Dafür ganz viel Ruhe und schönste Natur. 
Der Zoo ist übrigens nicht weit weg und du kannst die Löwen manchmal brüllen und die Affen kreischen hören. 

Wir haben hier sehr freundliche Nachbarn - bitte nimm auf sie Rücksicht, indem du dich ruhig verhältst und mindestens 5 Meter Abstand zu ihrem Garten lässt :) 
Vielen lieben Dank! 

Du erreichst unseren Garten über eine feste Zufahrt. Fahre bei der Haltestelle "Campus Südstadt" geradeaus in die kleine Zufahrt-Straße zu den Gärten hinein - ca. 300m - dann ist ein kleines Schild an einer Hecke zu sehen - dort dann rechts rein. Du kannst überall auf der Fläche stehen (bitte lass zu unseren Nachbarn einen ordentlichen Abstand). 

Wir freuen uns auf dich! 

——— Wichtig: mache KEIN Feuer und lasse den Brunnen IMMER geschlossen! 
——— 10 € / Tag: bitte per PayPal

name: Festhalle Brillit Wohnmobilstellplatz
description: Official campground for motorhomes, in front of the local shooting club and municipal sports club. close to a nice forest.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz am Emssee
description:
Parking space for 14 vehicles in the Emssee car park.

* Toilets
* Water
* Electricity
* Gray and black water disposal
------
Stellplatz für 14 Fahrzeuge auf dem Parkplatz am Emssee. 

* Toiletten 
* Wasser
* Stom
* Grau- und Schwarzwasserentsirgung

name: Hiker's parking lot in the wild moor
description:
Nice official hiker's parking lot (Wanderparkplatz), far away from the civilization — something like one hour walk to the next farm.
You can hike around the big moor lake from here.

name: Freizeitanlange Heideweiher
description: Visitors parking besides a good swimming lake. There is also free toilet, a children playground and fire places. Ample space, also suitable for large vehicles. No good tap to refill water, only the lavatories.

name: Stellplatz bei Höslwang
description: Nice spot for 2 Campers, friendly, nice view, quiet. 10 Euro per night.

name: Parking spot
description: Safe parking spot close next to highway but very calm

name: Wasserwerke Vohren
description: Place to refill water, reachable by bike, foot. Suitable for bottles, canister etc. 10m near street

name: Camping Am Stausee, Ralingen
description:
Large grassland area next to the river Sauer without fixed pitches - choose your spot.
Camping was hit hard during last years floods and the permanent residents area is being refurbished. But the grassland is fine for temporary guests.
Just pick a spot when you arrive - the manager will pass by twice a day to welcome you and collect the fee.
Toilets and showers are in a closed building (badge will be issued by manager) - clean and up to date infrastructure
8€/car + 5€pp + 3€/pet

name: Borgwall Barth
description:
Flat and shaded spot at the end of the road/entrance to a nature walk path. About 3-4 RVs may fit on gravel. The status od adjacent grassy field is not clear (there are remainings of small fence around it) so we stayed away of it.
Beware od mosquitos.

name: Street Parking
description: A parking place next to the street. Quiet during the night. A perfect place to start hiking tours in the national park. Until now, it is for free.

name: Perfect parking place in the Veldensteiner Forst
description:
Great place to stay for a night (and to start a hiking tour).
Very quite at night, directly in between the trees.

name: Apelhof
description:
Large camp ground, mostly for permanent campers.  For camper vans their is a smalish grass spot, no trees, one feels quite private.

The showers seem very new, and nicely done.

Cost is e20 for 2 people in a camper.  Showers and electricity cost extra.

The hosts are friendly.

name: Parkplatz "Müritz Ost"
description: It is allowed to stay overnight on the smaller, front part of the huge forest parking (we were directed here by a security guard). This spot is parallel to a road but there is almost no traffic untill ~6am.

name: Hasenbachtal
description:
Large open field, surrounded by trees on the perimeter. 
Camper van, 2 people, 1 night
 E12. 50

Friendly host

name: Staustufe
description: Parking place next to the lake and dam. Road and dam are a bit noisy but the lake is nice.

name: Pieschener Allee Parking
description: Paid parking spot and great spot to stay the night. 10 euros for a 24 hour stay for a bus. Payment is through a machine. You can also get away with paying 5 euros (car fee). Many campers come here and each morning a bakery bus service arrives, where you can get baked goods.

name: Reisemobil Stellplatz Koblenz
description: Large site with water, electricity and dumpstation. Per night 13 euro. Very convenient for big rigs!

name: Rottweil water and sanitation station
description:
Fantastic facility. Water 10c for 10L OR 1e for 100l. Flushing dump station, free. Parking at additional cost next to swimming pool. Rubbish bins.
All this needs is a laundromat and this would be a perfect chore day stopover.

name: Eco Express Laundromat
description:
Clean and efficient machines. Open to 10pm weekdays and Saturdays. Easy parking nearby. Parking free after 6pm Saturdays. 
XL 14kg machine 10e
Or 3.50e
Dryers 1.50e per 15mins

name: Steinen Schlächtenhaus
description: Parking on top of a hill, quite, nice view, bird Park within walking distance

name: Bird Park Weitenau
description: Bird park open from April to October 10:00-17:00, birds of prey flying at 11:00 and 15:00

name: hotel camping waldwinkel
description: nice little camping place close to Helmstadt and the former east German border. not the most friendly owner but perfect for an overnight

name: Ulm Carpark
description: Large, level tarmac carpark near the Danube river. Quiet, just distant sound of church bells and evening music from the park across the river.

name: Camping Carpe Diem
description: Family style campground with many sites for campers or tents. Secluded tent only area in the back by the creek.

name: Dingolfing Aire next to park and sports centre
description: Free parking next to a park and the sports centre. A new parking area for motor homes on gravel with water 1euro.

name: Next to Danube
description: Along a track to the river and up and over raised embankment to the riverside. Grassy meadow.

name: Dargun - Free Camper spot
description:
Official and free parking spot for campers/vans in Dargun. No amenities or anything but 4G cellphone reception. 
Close to the castle and the lake. 
We stayed here with our bikes and tent.

name: Camping Sulzbachtal
description:
Nice campground. Some spots with shade. Terraced on 3 levels. Small restaurant.  Aprox 2 km from town center. Natural swimming pond. Clean toilets and showers. Possibility to empty greywater and chem. toilets. 
One camper, 2 people, no pets, no electricity, 29€ in high season. 
Internet to be paid daily 1€.

name: Riverside
description:
A quiet place to stay at the river Iller.
There is enough space for two vans.
The approach is small so you should not try to drive down with a bigger caravan.

name: Camping  Lug ins Land
description:
Large modern campground on terraces. Little shade. Large spots. Good, large restaurant. Very modern and clean toilets and showers (some, all in marble) Swimming pool, children's playground. Approx. 10 min. by foot to the next village, 2 km to Bad Bellingen.
 
1 Camper, 2 people, no pets/ kids, no electricity, 39€ per night in high season. (This is the upper limit for my taste.)

name: Lohmen
description: Parking on a grass-covered area, 20 m to a bakery, 100 m to supermarket. Bus and train are nearbay. Base of several intrested hiking trails in the Saxon Switzerland. About 8 km to the Bastei bridge.

name: Munich - near English Garden
description: Roadside parking here or in the next street by the river. Free overnight and Sundays. Some road noise but reduces overnight. Easy access to city particularly with a bike.

name: Festwiese Nienburg/Weser
description:
Translation: Large lawn area, also used for fairs, circuses and AMR meetings. Good for a few nights when there is no event. Weser, lakes, walking paths, swimming pool and the nice old town within walking distance.

Grosse Rasenfläche, wird auch für Kirmes, Circus und AMR Treffen genutzt. Gut für ein paar Nächte, wenn keine Veranstaltung ist. Weser, Seen, Spazierwege, Schwimmbad und die nette Altstadt fußläufig erreichbar.

name: Stellplatz am Friedhof
description:
Legal parking space at the cemetery. Suitable for transit…. Without everything. Grocery store and gas station on site
----------------
Legaler Stellplatz am Friedhof. Geeignet zur Durchreise…. Ohne alles. Lebensmittel Geschäft und Tankstelle am Ort

name: Northernmost point of Czech Republic
description: You can not be more at the north of Czech Republic.

name: Womopark Moyland
description: Only for campingcars! Big space, next to the castle. Don’t forget to visit it!

name: Wasserwanderrastplatz (cyclists only)
description:
Official camp site for cyclists and boat-people (like canoo or something) only. It's free!
There are benches, a fire pit, trees which provide shadow and you can access the river. 

No cars allowed.

name: Burg Eltz Parkplatz/Wohnmobil Stellplatz
description:
very very calm area. At daytime it is used as parking place for walking to the Burg Eltz. Staying overnight is possible by paying 2 parking tickets (2x€2, cash only!)
This is the closest experience to wild camping in Germany, and it is fully legal!!

name: Gästehaus Lutz
description:
Simple place for one night or even a week.
Only a hand full of spots - so for your confort you should book

Good Breakfast and wine from its own land.

Perfect Place to avoid noisy truckstops on your way.

name: Reisebusch Parking
description:
5€ for 24h parking... big parking lots for motorhomes and Van's, 
dump station and water

name: Reisebusch Parking
description: Good spot for one night... 5€ is okay, you get a dump station and big lots for big vehicles.  16 spots

name: Ruheparadies
description:
Family owned, small campsite with electricity, showers, toilets and wifi. It's in the middle of nowhere, simple and absolutely beautiful. 
Prices are on the website. We paid 10€ for two people and a tent (Everything else is included).

name: Small lovey spot at “Sauer” river
description:
Small parking with the River in 20m distance, the road is also close but almost no traffic at night. There are some places to sit and trash cans as well.

Possible to swim in the river or do fishing here (need to buy permit in Wasserbillig 5€)

name: Camping Aichalehof
description:
Small Campsite close to the Staffelsee. Open only from may 1st  to October 3rd 
Price 31€ for 2 people in one vehicle.  Little shade. Clean showers and toilets. Shower costs 50 Cents for 3 min.  Small restaurant, closed on Mondays .

name: Pilsensee Camping
description:
Nice large camping at the lake shore. Many resident campers. Little shade. 
Bar and restaurant on site. The restaurant is monday and tuesday closed. 
Check in fully automatic. Clean toilets and showers. 
36€ for 1camper car and two people.

name: Karlsruhe Rheinufer
description: Nice parking area next the Rhein in the area of the Rheinstrandbad.

name: Körber Kopf
description: Viewpoint top the swabian alps near stuttgart

name: Mosella
description: Small camping next to the river with a field for small tents, bikers, hikers and also for camper/ caravan

name: Wintrich Motor home site
description: Great site under the walnut trees on the banks of the Moselle. Electricity included in price. €12.50 per night toilet €0.50 shower €1.00. Water available at €1.00 for approx 90 liters and toilet disposal free of charge.

name: Waldcamping Thalheim
description: Campground with a kind of hippie-vibe at the border of a little village. A lot of woods in the background.

name: MSM Motorrad
description:
I hope I pointed the correct location, as did it some days after, and not used to GPScoordinates!

It is between Solingen-Wuppertal, Kohlfurth, opposite side of Wupper of Cafe Hubraum.  www.msm-motorrad.de


Michael Sladek is the owner of the garage for motorbikes (definitely doing big bikes like BNW, KTM, Moto Guzzi, etc. but there were also old bikes parked).

In the same garage was also a car mechanic working.

name: RV space at the fairground
description: On both sides of the road you will find a big parking lot, where it is allowed to camp. It is very convenient if you need a place to stay for a night: very quiet during the night! 20 minutes walk into town. Parking at the south side of the road is near to the railway, so you might have more noise at that side. No facilities.

name: Near Stone Quarry
description: A nice spot in a green field with two entries (one above and one below), not visible from the street, good for a night or a day picnic.

name: Entsorgung Ostuferhafen
description:
Disposal  perfectly in the ground, with parking space
----
Entsorgung Ostuferhafen Kiel perfekt im Boden, mit Stellplatz dabei

name: Parkplatz Hohemark
description:
Four assigned spots for Campers in a parking lot. Free in the evening and over night (6pm-10am), small fee during the day.

Just next to the Taunus mountains with plenty of hiking and mountain biking trails. 

Quiet at night.

There is a large school next to it, so it is not comfortable to spend time there during the day, it is rather an overnight spot. 

Restaurant with good food and clean restrooms (no shower, but water access) nearby (~50m). 

Cell reception very good.

name: Höfe am Bühl Parking
description:
As couldn't pinpoint, it is opposite of this location, entrance Höfe am Bühl, secure parking for motorbikes, fee daily 11€.
They have parking for motorbikes, left mine 3 nights without a problem.

name: Parkin Lot
description: Parkin lot with nice mountain view. Only a few places are level ! Quiet place next to the forest. Hut with benches and small fireplace.

name: Murgunsel Gernsbach
description: Great official place to stay for max of one week. 10 euro a day. electric 1 euro per 12 hours, toilet, water and wastewater available. Great place for 6 campers. Beautiful town with good food, near the river. Quiet at night.

name: Cemetery Burg
description: Ravel Parkinson lot, very Quote at night. No infrastructure.

name: Ford Garage & DPF cleaning
description:
Ford Garage with super friendly, helpful, English speaking staff. Waiting area with coffee. Highly recommended. 
Next door, RSM Rennsport Muller will clean Diesel Particulate Filters.

name: Breiholz Parking
description: Parking near the canal, there is space for atleast 6 big campers, or even 8 if really packed. Ships passing by at night but it’s quiet. Free ferry nearby.

name: Altschloss parking
description: Quiet parking lot in the forrest at the start of several beautiful walks. No amenities, busy during the day but alone at night.

name: Camping Wees Missunde
description: Nice campground directly at the Schlei which is a Fjord from the eastern sea. Established in terraces on grass or sand, one has a nice view over the water. Ablutions are very nice and clean, shower with coins (1€). Recommendable for cyclers as well for people who have a boat or a SUP. Price for 2 people and a campervan including electricity is 24 Euro. WLAN at reception. Small Shop at campsite with astonishingly sortiment! Fresh baked cake every day.

name: Cemetery Toilets with water
description: Potable water and clean toilets available. Very convenient for cyclists. On top of a hill.

name: Womo Stellplatz Bad Tabarz
description:
Ein kleiner Stellplatz direkt neben der Therme, welche man mit der Gästekarte täglich 1,5h umsonst nutzen kann. Der Platz ist sehr schön. Dusche Toilette,Wasser und Internet sind vorhanden. 

A small parking space right next to the thermal baths, which you can use daily for 1.5 hours for free with the guest card.  The place is very beautiful.  Shower toilet, water and internet are available.

name: Parking area Hessisches Kegelspiel
description:
RV park for 18 vehicles not far from downtown Hünfeld.
The place is chargeable.
The parking fee of 6 euros per 2 hours must be paid at the ticket machine.
Possible payment methods: credit card, cash or via Easy Park App.
Gray and black water can be disposed of free of charge - residual waste bins are also available.
Fresh water is available for a fee.
For each of the 18 parking spaces there is a connection to the shore power. The fee is 60ct per kilowatt.
----
Wohnmobilstellplatz für 18 Fahrzeuge unweit der Innenstadt von Hünfeld.
Der Platz ist kostenpflichtig.
Die Parkgebühr in Höhe von 6 Euro pro 2 Stunden muss am Ticketautomaten entrichtet werden.
Mögliche Zahlarten : Kreditkarte, bar oder per Easy Park App.
Die Entsorgung von Grau- und Schwarzwasser ist kostenlos möglich - auch Restmülltonnen stehen zur Verfügung.
Frischwasser ist gegen Gebühr erhältlich.
Für jeden der 18 Stellplätze besteht eine Anschlussmöglichkeit an den Landstrom. Die Gebühr beträgt 60ct pro Kilowatt.

name: Camping im Wald
description: it's a silent street just off the highway with a lot of space for big and small rigs. didn't stay the night but saw a few campers here

name: official wild camp
description:
official place for camping ( 3 day allowed) near hotel and fuel station. 
Next to big natural Park. Very peaceful and quiet in the night.

name: lakeside strassbourg
description: There was an entry close to here which is how I found this spot. Out of the way but still close to Strassbourg, quiet and in nature. This morning people came to walk their dog but that's about it. There's room for 1 or 2 big ones, but not really any more.

name: private garden
description:
Space for tent or camper in the driveway!
Gladly you can camp with me in the garden!
Please contact me before you arrive! 
Mail: cedric98.ch@gmail.com

name: free parking - BMX trail, therapy centre
description: Free parking places near the park of the rehabilitation center.  But there are five lanterns that illuminate the whole night.  Otherwise very quiet and secluded.

name: Lüneburg
description: Parkground in the City of Lüneburg, 50 parkingplaces

name: 4WARD4X4 Equipment
description:
Land Rover Defender, Discovery & Jeep Wrangler Specialist
Home of ENGAGE4X4
https://www.4ward4x4.com

name: Wildpark Tannenbusch
description:
Very quiet parking space in the parking lot of the Tannenbusch wildlife park. No supply and disposal available. In summer you have to pay € 2.50 to access the car park at weekends. The place can be used all year round.

Sehr ruhiger Stellplatz auf dem Parkplatz des Wildparks Tannenbusch. Keine Ver- und Entsorgung vorhanden. Im Sommer muss man für die Zufahrt zum Parkplatz an den Wochenenden € 2,50 bezahlen. Der Platz ist ganzjährig nutzbar.

name: Stellplatz Weizern
description: For Rv‘s, Campervans, electicitiy avalible. Privat Place at a Farm with animals. Pets allowed. No showers or restrooms. Bakery 2 minutes away.

name: Dump station + Water
description: The dump station is free to use. For water you need to pay a small fee (cash only with coins).

name: ServicePoint
description:
English: The best (mobile home) repairshop in the greater Bremen area!
 Super nice and absolutely competent owner (Christian Mühlner).  We regularly had our car serviced there & most recently had our camper prepared for our long trip (from South America to Alaska).  Everything always perfect.  He is a mobile home owner himself & knows what is important.  In addition, very fair prices & also says honestly if something is not necessary! He even has lifts for mobile homes.  Absolute recommendation! 

German: Die beste (Wohnmobil-)Werkstadt im Großraum Bremens! 
Supernetter und vor Allem kompetenter Besitzer (Christian Mühlner). Haben dort regelmäßig unseren PKW warten lassen & zuletzt unseren Camper für unsere große Reise (von Südamerika bis Alaska) vorbereiten lassen. Alles tiptop. Er ist selbst Wohnmobil-Besitzer & weiß worauf es ankommt. Außerdem sehr faire Preise & sagt auch ehrlich, wenn etwas nicht notwendig ist!  Er hat sogar Hebebühnen für Wohnmobile. Absolute Empfehlung!

name: Sonnensee
description: Beautiful campsite, partly in the forest, directly on the Sonnensee.  With inn and very friendly people.

name: Very secluded stay, even with camper van
description: When your travelling on the 1 between Bremen and Osnabruck, this is very close to the 1 and quiet place to sleep. In the middle of the woods.

name: Auszeitwagen.com
description:
They are doing everything around your camper or Exmo. They have a well equiped workshop. Auszeitwagen.com +4915788269282

A well organized workshop for Expeditionsmobile and camperworks. 015788269282

name: Lennestadt
description: 23 2 for campervan overnight, electricity and pet 2w nearby

name: Tucherpark/Englische Garten
description: Boondocking in a very quite neighbarhood; good for huge rigs.

name: Hirschgarten
description:
Parking lot for cars, bigger rigs should be possible.
Toilets/restrooms & restaurant close by.
Free of charge, close to S-Bahn.

name: stellplatz Travermunde landstrasse
description:
nearby the ferry's.
good for a overnight when you take the boat.
near by bar, restaurant, supermarket

name: Beautifully place in the woods
description: Beautiful sport for tent or maybe 4x4. Place for a bonfire but be carefully if it’s summer and dry. Really silent and lonesome place.

name: Reifen Bestellung 24
description: Good tyre shop in Berlin. We found our tyres and they had them installed all within a day we order them. Very profesional.

name: Bergcafé Egbert
description:
A tiny Café run by an old lady. Interior is very oldscool like a museum. The cakes are delicious and all homemade!
Opening hours:
Daily from 10am to 6pm
Closed on Tuesdays and Fridays.

name: Overlander-Shipping.com
description: I'm at the por with them, they are perfect! makes everything! And the guy, Ricardo is the best! They make shipping worldwide if you need! English, Germany, Portuguese all languages! We came from Argentina, and they helped us here with everything! Really really recommended if you need a transport! The address is Martin-Luther-Straße 8, 20459 Hamburg, Alemanha - Search on internet "Overland Shipping Hamburg" them you can find them!

name: Parking Hotel zur Post
description: Parking area next to the restaurant. Very friendly owner, allowed to stay for the night. During the opening hours you can use the facilities of  the restaurant.

name: Parking spot
description:
A parking spot by a park with the river near the center 
We stayed the night , calm place 
April 2

name: Wohnmobil Parkplatz
description:
a very large parking lot for mobile homes and separately cars.  with dumpstation but no bins.  no stand limitation, free of charge

ein sehr grosser Parkplatz für Wohnmobile und seperat für Autos.
mit Entsorgungsstation aber keine Müllbehälter.
keine Standbegrenzung, kostenlos

name: wohnmobilstellplatz
description:
Directly on the Elbe, with a view of the water
 well maintained
 24h for 14.50eus
 electricity separately

Direkt an der Elbe, mit Wasserblick 
sehr gepflegt
24h für 14.50eus
Strom seperat

name: Pension Ober Juchhe
description:
Pension Ober Juchhe in Gräfenthal has four guest rooms and one apartment/holiday flat, guest kitchen available;  family atmosphere;  environment with a lot of nature.
The host and lady has great advice for activities in the area and for good camping spots.
--
Die pension Obere Juchhe in Gräfenthal verfügt uber vier gästezimmer und ein appartement / ferienwohnung, gästeküche vorhanden; familäire atmoshäre; umgebung mit viel nature. Der Gastgeber und die Dame haben gute Tipps für Aktivitäten in der Umgebung und für Campingplätze.

name: Campingplatz Kinzigtal
description: Established campground with clean facilities, space for caravans. We pitched a tent and had two motorcycles. It was somewhat expensive as this cost €31. Nice bathroom facilities and a bar that’s open part of the year (not when we were here in mid-April).

name: Camping Ottobeuren GmbH
description: Established campground with hostel-like facilities. Nice open flat ground (which also makes it windy!!) but the camp also has some lovely dorm rooms which were €20 per person. Me and my partner stayed here in mid-April and got a six-man dorm all to ourselves. Great shower, very hot and powerful. Clean. The camping itself is not cheap. Would have been around €30 for two people, two motorcycles, and a tent.

name: Sternplatz
description: Nice Spot near the Road behind trees. Quite in the night.

name: Van Dams Kirschenhof
description: Nice campground just outside Werder. Space for campers and bigger rigs as well as tents. Clean toilets and hot showers. Campsite also has lovely biergarten with beer, wine and fresh apple juice for sale. No wifi but decent 4g signal.

name: Campingplatz Hoher Fläming
description: Small campsite with space for around 12 camper and and bigger rigs. Small area for tents also. Simple food and beer available. Clean toilets and kitchen facilities

name: Parkplatz Hirschgarten
description:
A parking lot with a height limit of 2.1 mt.
Anyway, we came after the hint of a local to stay with a camper for a night and the bar was open.

There was another van, they stayed the night before without issue.

Quiet place, nearby the big Hirschgarten

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Blaubeuren
description: Simple but clean place. Within walking distance to town center. (Approx 15 min)

name: Gartow: city, castle and beach activities
description: In Gardow there is a beautiful beach at the Gardow lake. You can sein Here and Play football or volleyball at the lake side. In the other side of the lake is the small city center where you can either visit the castle, buy the needet stuff at one of the two supermarkets or have a nice pizza or icecream (free wifi there).

name: Nemitzer Heidehaus
description:
At the current position there are different points of interest: First there is the Nemitzer Heide itself. A natural habitat witch is either beautiful and kind of surreal at the same time. You can go there and visit it and have a walk into the Heide (stay on tracks - its protected landscape). 

Second, there is also the Heidehaus (food, water and drinks and toilets) and next to it a 24 hours parking lot for camping vans (for free) set between the trees. If the parking lots arend too frequented you can use a lot for camping with your tent. A natural playground for little and bigger children is there too.

Pay attention: because of the protected landscape in this section lighting up a fire is forbidden!

name: Heidesteig Fährhäuser Biergarten + Fähre
description: At the current location there is a Restaurant with Biergarten. You can ask the owner to stay for a night with your tent. A big parking in area is right there. The ferry you need to cross the river Mulde is there too but it doesn't transfer bigger vehicles.

name: Vohenstruass town Aire
description: Free camping for motorhomes.  Next to town hall.  Power, water, dumping available.  Apparently if you go into town hall (before 4pm) you can get a key for the showers and bathroom and chemical dump  but we didn't need. Strong cell signal.  A bit of road noise from highway but not unbearable.  Not too far of a walk to town for shops etc.

name: Platz neben Grillplatz
description:
Place next to barbecue area. Toilets, fireplace, seating, etc. are available. For one night it is a good place.
---
Platz neben Grillplatz. Toiletten, Feuerstelle, Sitzgelegenheiten usw. sind vorhanden. Für eine Nacht ist es ein guter Platz.

name: Burg Herzberg
description:
RV parking space.
No water
No electricity
Without toilet

Wohnmobil Stellplatz.
Kein Wasser
Kein Strom
Ohne Toilette

name: Biwakplatz Mögelin
description: It's one of a very rare legal Wild Campsite in Germany. It's legal and it is for free, direct on the River Havel.

name: Open Area for camping
description: Open Area surrounded Boy trees. A Streit is 500m nearby but cars do not Drive by frequently.

name: Glatten town aire
description: Small parking area for motorhomes on paving stones near an outdoor pool.  Power at a fee of 1eu for 1000kw for up to 4 vehicles but extra gravel lot for more that don't need power. Garbage can available.  4G cell reception.  Paved trail next to parking.  In summer pool is open and has showers. A short walk into village itself.   Very quiet this time of year.  We saw as we left a "sani station" on the left as you leave.  Looks like you pay a fee for water and to dump.  unsure of cost

name: Parking Place
description: It is. close to the Mosel. Its only forbitten for trucks.

name: Wohnmobilstellplatz Zinse
description:
Small free mobile home parking space in the hamlet Zinse.
No supply or disposal facility, space for 3 mobile homes.
Good place for hiking.

name: Zur grossen Tanne
description:
German food restaurant
motorcycle meeting point
also some rooms available for overnight stay

name: Drinking water well
description: Free water from a public well. Clean to drink.

name: Mohrendorf
description: on a gravel road by the canal at the locks of Mohrendorf. wonderfully quiet, plenty of room. no facilities

name: Am Park, Uebigau
description: Quiet Place near the Village. We stayed there for one night with two cars next to some small lake and a river.

name: Hot Showers
description: Great spot to catch a one Euro shower without having to pay for camping. Nice and hot and clean. Enjoy.

name: Parking Dechsendorfer Weiher
description: Spot for a night, not much traffic at night time.

name: Historische Mühle Vogelsang
description: Beautiful but small Campsite with good Restaurant nearby. You can start hiking right at the location.

name: Motel 24
description: Budget Motel. Semi secure parking for bikes, park right in front of hotel lobby and reception. Clean rooms - shared bathroom. I paid €46 - does the trick for a night.

name: Hofstellplatz Legau
description: Campground for caravans and campers at a barnyard. Electricity, toilet, shower and a washing up area

name: Parking space of abandoned hospital St. Goar
description: A local representative told us about this parking spot of an abandoned hospital. Close to town and not too much traffic at night.

name: BRN Hotel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Hotels on iOverlander must be typically available without reservation. Accepted because cellphone internet is everywhere and avoiding costs for a reception leads to low prices. Please report if there are issues with reserving on the spot.

Paid €38 for a single. Online booking only with booking.com or on their website https://brn-hotel.de. There is no reception - remote checkin only!
Semi secure parking for bikes right in front of room. Clean rooms - good for a nights stay.

name: Torgau at the river Elbe
description:
Parking lot outside of the old town, but just 4 minutes walking distance. 
Not leveld. 
For an overnight stay you have to pay €5,10€

name: Volksfestgelände - Beside river Elbe
description: Close to the water, good walking distance to the city, at night time free of charge

name: Green field by Meißen
description: Big flat area close to the road bridge. Free of charge, no infrastructure but a gas station :)

name: Schöne Aussicht Parkplatz
description:
We stayed for one night with our defender. It is not suitable foe big Campervans. Beautiful views. Albeit is is behind a street you can sleep well . No traffic after 22.00 until 8.00.
This is the best spot around. The tipp came from the local firebrigade.

name: Schäldeberg Hantenkreuz
description: A windy spot but with a beautifull view of rise and sun dawn. pretty quiet, but in the morning there might be people with there dogs for a walk. Wide open area with a bench and table.

name: Restaurant Main Haus
description:
Parking near the river Main. Restaurant and park nearby.
In a calm neighborhood.

name: Wild camping near canal, fireplace, mosquitoes
description: Nice, secluded spot near a canal (Havelkanal). Lots of mosquitoes though. There is a fireplace. You dont necessarily need a 4*4 to get there unless the track is still wet (i.e. from November-April).  A bit of clearance might be enough. It should be doable with a normal van. The only way to get there by car is along the canal coming from the Schleuse Schönwalde.

name: Parking near Lake
description:
Mid-sized parking lot right in front of a reservoir where you can rest and swim.

Can be a bit crowded in the daytime, usually quiet at night - a few other vans or RVs.

Overnighting allowed, usually no patrols - but they leave again without saying anything. 


Also very clean

name: Lost Place at Grabowsee
description:
Shortly before the Lost Place at Grabowsee is a great way to spend the night.  It is advisable to visit the former lung sanatorium beforehand or the next day by prior appointment.  A corresponding telephone number can be found on the Internet and on site at the entrance.  Hollywood films as well as many German films and TV series have also been filmed here.

 The road has very little traffic during the day and almost no traffic at night.  From time to time joggers or mountain bikers come along the way.  You can also go hiking in the forest here.  The street offers plenty of space to stand on both sides.

name: Parking Lot - not for motorhomes
description: Parking lot in the Center of the village Wesen. Great place with view on the Walensee. The night costs 3 CHF. Descreet table "Not for motorhomes. Use parkinglots Speerplatz“

name: Shell Serways
description: Excellent trucker shower for 3 euros, straight off the motorway. Part of a diner/shop/gas station. The hot/cold part is part of the large push button, just rotate.

name: Aral petrol station.
description:
There are many places across Germany that have free water bottle filling stations. Just go into this one and they will direct you to a tap/sink adjacent to the counter. There is a good website where you can find more locations like these: 

https://www.trinkwasser-unterwegs.de/brunnen-in-der-naehe

name: Hotel "Im Jaich" & "Im Jaich Boarding House"
description: Hotel "Im Jaich" and "Boardinghouse".  Nice and very clean rooms in the best location.  About 15 minutes walk to the center.  Ideal for picking up or delivering the vehicle from or at the port.  The prices vary depending on the occupancy of the hotel.  E.g. from EUR 115 per room / 2 people. The Reception is in the Hotel "Im Jaich". Lot of Parking spots behind the Boarding House.

name: View of the castle
description: Very nice place. It's possible to make a Fire. There are chairs and tables.

name: Hidden among the trees
description: A quiet little spot amongst a grove of trees in a light suburban/farming community.  Very popular on other apps,  it worked great for us with a few friendly locals occasionally walking by.

name: RV Parking Arzbeeg
description: Camper parking 5 Euro per  24 hour stay (paid by very confusing app). Electric: €0.50 per kw. For hot shower, select shower on little boiler.

name: Hundersingen Grillplatz
description:
Nice barbecue place directly on the Donau. Small shelter.
Not accessible by car. A few minutes walk to the village.

name: Campingerverein Große Plötzsee
description: Campsite with beach and swimming beside Große Plotzsee

name: Camp and hut
description: Nice fireplaces, big gut with tables and benches

name: Good for a peaceful sleep
description:
If you do not mind to camp near a communal receycling centre, this spot can be a possibility. We liked it.
It’s quiet here, no “forbidden” signs.

name: Shell - Autohof
description: Shower for 4€ per person. As a couple you can go in one together.

name: Am Hexenturm
description: Basic Camper place with 5 spots about 8 meter long, Cost 5 Euro pay by envelope. 🤠

name: Campingplatz Himmelpfort
description: Quiet small campsite beside lake. Clear water for swimming although quite shallow without walking out. Secure lockers for charging electronic devices. Small shop selling eggs, bread and essentials. Italian restaurant beside campsite. Quite some mosquitoes in evening.

name: Camp Wagenburg
description: 4 Euro pp cash. Just ask the nice man in the office building on the left when you drive in. You get a token which lasts 5 minutes. Lovely facilities.

name: In the middle of the fields
description: Quiet Place on a hill. Road steep and narrow in winter only 4x4. Spot even in grass and sand. No amenities. Keep the place tidy please

name: Fassberg
description: Camping Sonnenberg is very nice! They have a large, open field at the end of their large camping facility and easy to park and accessible for expedition trucks. Very kind Dutch couple runs the camping. Toilets and showers are clean and a small restaurant is also at the reception building.

name: Camping Am Brillteich
description:
Nice little quiet campsite in the wood. Lots of birdsong. Not far from supermarked.
13.50 Euro for Tent and Motorbike.
2.20 for a small beer. Cheap price in that area. Bathroom with hot water and clean.

name: Passau
description: Free Motorhome parking area. lots of space although busy. No facilities. close to town. Some road noise.

name: wild camping next to lake Nymphensee
description: Large meadow. The surrounding trees provide a good visual cover so you won't be seen. There is a small path leading to the lake (Nymphensee). Not many passer-bys. Most people access the lake from the other side. Unless the track is wet and muddy you won't need a 4*4. The track is on Openstreetmap.

name: Riverside
description: A lovely little spot hidden away down the end of a track. The track is a dead end and becomes unpaved, so it is probably rarely visited, although around 10pm a walker came by with his dog. Lots of mosquitos as it's right on the river. Enough space for a tent, beautiful and utterly silent at night.

name: Stellplatz unter den Bäumen auf dem Gutshof
description:
Only for mobile campers not tents.
.....
schöne Stellplätze am Bach. Nur für Womo geeignet...

name: Ferdinands Homestay
description:
Mobil Camper parking area and hostel available.
.....
Wohnmobil Camping and Hostel are available

name: Flüssiggas Flensburg
description: Super nice shop to refill gas bottles. Near the motorway on your trip from/to Denmark. We used German adapters.

name: Breitenworbis - Sportplatz
description:
Overnight parking 
Parking area at the Sportpark - Nice and calm

name: Brauhaus Pirna - Parking area
description:
Parking area allowed for campers for one night for free - check in at the Brauhaus - fabulous fresh craft beer also for take away
at the distillery - You are welcome to eat a Flammkuchen with a fresh brewd 🍺 in the Brauhaus.

name: Euro Rastpark
description:
Didn’t use any of the facilities. 
There are showers, a laundromat and there is food

name: Euro Rastplatz
description:
Didn’t use the facilities. 
There is a laundromat, showers and food here

name: Hotel am Friedberger See
description: Quiet location. Close to the 8 if coming off the autobahn. Parked my motorbike in the courtyard. €66 for single room. Not the newest hotel but everything was clean. Small problem checking in as arrived later, had phone number to call but I couldn’t call it. Booked through booking.com. Free cancellation & pay when arrive. Breakfast is €10. I didn’t take it so can’t comment. Would stop again for a night when covering distance and just need an easy bed with safe parking

name: Camping Meier
description: Small campsite perfect for cyclists ! It has everything you need (shower, toilets, washing machine, fridge, water, peace and quiet) for an affordable price (paid 9 euros for one tent and two persons). People here are really nice and you can also buy drinks onsite or order a pizza from a nearby restaurant ! There isn't really a reception or anything just someone living in a motorhome who will explain the things and collect the money.

name: do it
description: Dirk is since 30 years an educated car and motorcycle mechanical Master and happy to help all travellers in his fully equipped garage

name: Wohnmobilhafen "am weißen Stein"
description: open the chain and take a spot. 12/night plus 1,5€pp plus 3€electricity

name: Motorradwerkstatt Halle
description:
Perfect place for repairing my faulty brake discs. Had to buy them myself at the local "Louis" shop. There were happy to use them. They were very friendly and within 1,5 hour I was back on the road again.

Plus: Around the corner is a place were you can have a cheap good lunch.

name: wildcamping in der Nordschleife
description: Nice little spot with a view over Quiddelbach, not even but good enough. Close to a road (which is not very busy tho). No sings and enough space for 2 or 3 cars to park here. You can hear the cars racing on Nordschleife during a race day

name: caravan site on a parking lot
description:
12 parking spaces (5 €/day to pay at parking meter)
 1 water supply station (10 cents/litre)
 1 sewage disposal station (free)
 1 drainage channel (free)
 3 power supply stations (50 cents/kWh)

More information in german can be found on website.

name: Forellensee
description: Large family campground next to lake. Next to highway, therefore rather noisy. Adequate ablutions. €29 for campervan, 2 adults, no power

name: Shelter besides cycle path
description: Roofed shelter beside cycling path closeby Schwaan. Good for a tent spot when raining.

name: Trekking Camp
description: Informal campsite in the forest, can be reached by a step hike from parking lot.

name: Stunning Views in quiet carpark
description: Carpark for the swimming lake, beautiful views over the river and easy short walk down to the water to swim. Carpark had a few cars coming and going as people also go there to fish but we were not bothered.

name: Free parking overnight
description: Free parking carpark in the evening and until 8am. Quiet place with access to a public toilet, restaurant and the lake for swimming.

name: Glass recycling
description:
dropped off some old glass bottles here
only glass and clothes recycling available

name: Leutesdorf campsite
description:
I paid €15 to pitch a small tent. free showers, handwashing facilities. paid washing machines. nice but unremarkable restaurant.

check in until 10pm

name: Heiner's Barn
description:
After experiencing great hospitality on our four years overlanding trip, I feel like it's time to give back to the overlanding community. Feel free to camp out in the courtyard and share a beer by the fire during night time. There's space and some tools to do some repairs, wifi, a washing machine and a bed in a house if you're really desperate. I'm pretty busy building up a community supported vegetable farm. Feel free to lend a hand there or build some camp infrastructure if you want to stay longer.

The coordinates given are not the exact place, as this is my relatives' and my home. But it's only minutes away. Please get in touch beforehand. A day or two in advance and I will most likely be able to arrange something. With a 10 minutes warning I might be somewhere else.. 01784792128

name: Water fountain
description:
slow running but potable
small water fountain on side of road

name: Water fountain by stadium
description:
fast flowing drinking water
on the cycle path from Koblenz to Boppard

name: Stephanskloster Ruin Parking Lot
description:
Nice, big and very quiet parking lot next to the Stephan’s Abby ruins, the road up is in somewhat bad condition (but that depends which country you are used from…for German standards it’s fairly poor condition). It’s pretty steep driving up but not too windy should be accessible for all kinds of vehicles.

Two other campers were up here with us when we stayed here. The parking is on a bit of a slope (our board computer measured it as 4%  before we put the blocks under).

Nice view from the ruins and easy access to hiking trails to city center or other viewpoints.

name: Pit in forest
description: Small road with a pit, where we stayed overnight, very quiet only some wild boars in the woods, in morning some cars local people on way to work

name: Roatel Hotel
description:
Very unique budget accommodations. Room with twin bed and private bath in a 40ft container. Remote check-in. Very new and clean. Perfect for a night stop-over to get out of the rain.
Motorcycle parking right in front of room.

On arrival check-in @ my.roatel.com or phone +49 211 21092000

name: Campingplatz Marienort
description:
Regular German style campsite
I paid €15 for a one person tent + €1 for shower
there is a restaurant, open every day except Monday

name: Water fountain in the centre of Wertheim
description: the fountain in the square is not drinking water, but there is a small water fountain next to it which is. suitable for filling up water bottles and washing. apparently a result of the Fridays for future "active youth" group, thanks guys

name: Laundry
description: A lot of machine. Dont know the price. You can park in front

name: Bildungscampus Heilbronn LIV
description:
People go to the LIV (Learning. Informing. Connecting.) to learn. There is free wifi and there are cost free toilets. The students refill their bottles in the washroom so the water has good quality. 
There is also a cafe with a nice iced latte macchiato. 
It is opened only from Monday-saturday from 8-22 o’clock.

name: Görlitz
description: Close to the river Lausitzer Neisse on a dead end road. A small paved parking lot for 10 rigs.

name: Aussichtsturm Rathmannsdorf
description:
Free parking with no overnight restrictions posted. I did not stay here but rather came to have breakfast here. One other camper van was parked and seemingly got up from a good night sleep. Small quiet little town. Not sure about amenities. Toilets available for 50cts (open from 9am to sunset). Tower costs 1€ to enter. 
25min walk to Bad Schandau or by bus

Rather steep and narrow to drive up but doable with most campers.

name: Zweirad-Center Zöller
description:
Motorcycle shop/mechanic/workshop

Main brands: Honda, Suzuki, Voge, Kymco

Open:
Tue-Fri 09:00-13:00 + 14:00-18:00
Sat 09:00-14:00
Sun+Mon CLOSED
